description:
You come here for the corned beef hash breakfast! It's just what you do. Because it's awesome! I've actually never been here for lunch but he menu looks enticing! The gem is located on Pier 39 (don't worry there is a parking garage across the way and you can validate for an hour of it. 

We came here on a Saturday morning to get an awesome breakfast while we were visiting. It's a bit touristy but that's ok. It's part of the charm. There is outdoor seating so you can look over the bay but we chose inside to avoid the chill. 

We both ordered breakfast platters. And ate them entirely! The food is plenty and worth the price tag. 

The place has a bit of a northeastern feel which is neat. 

I recommend coming here and checking it out if it's your first time in San Francisco or even if you live here.
author: Ashleigh C.

description:
First of all the food is not that good... i ordered eagle burger worth 18$ i said medium it came out well done, so the patty is drier than california, same with the bacon...
2nd... if you are 6person or more they will force you to pay an extra 18%...
Im not coming back here again and we told our friends not to eat here when they visit SF... worst experience ever...
author: Rodge D.

description:
The food was so small in portion .. we got the blt and the club .. the fries were tiny .. but our bartender kimj was the bomb great service great personality a sure to have dined at his bar ... 

I'd suggest more bacon on your blt for sure
author: marci h.

description: Go for the view!  Great little outside area above the street to eat and watch the boats go in and out and people walking the wharf. Food is excellent and drinks are VERY STRONG. Both times I have been here in the late afternoon on a weekday and got in with no wait. Staff is friendly but can be slow. Enjoy
author: Tonya W.

description:
The first sign to run should have been when there was a 40 minute wait next door at Fog Harbor Cafe and zero wait here, but we were hungry and the menu looked good so we went in...

Such a bad idea. While our waiter was very nice, he wasn't great. But fine. Just feed us. 

My salmon dish came a full 5 minutes before anyone else's did. When I mentioned it to the waiter he was like, oh sorry, but when we looked around we realized it was happening at every table. 

On top of my salmon already being cold when it came out, and even colder when I finally was able to eat it with my family, it was hard and tough and flat. I needed a knife to cut it. I mean, who cuts salmon with a knife? It was paper thin and tough. It literally tasted like jerky. 

Adding insult to injury, i paid the extra $2.75 to replace the mashed potatoes with veggies. Not double veggies, just replace it with, because apparently you don't get a carb and a veggie with your meal. It's one or the other. So I pay the extra $2.75 and it's the sorriest side of veggies I have ever seen with only 1 piece of broccoli! It's was horrible. 

When my family's food finally arrived, it was warmer than mine but all over seasoned and very mediocre. 

For 4 of us, without alcohol, the meal was $150 (before tip). I don't mind spending $150 on a decent meal, but this horrible. Borderline fast food and definitely not worth the price tag. 

My advice is to wait for a table at Fog Harbor.
author: Alexis M.

description: It's been awhile since I've been here and was looking forward to see what the new owners did with the remodel. The remodel is nice but unfortunately the entrees weren't. All the other surrounding restaurants had like so we decided to go to this restaurant which was pretty empty which now I understand why. Outside the clams that were delicious the rest of the entrees were bland. The lobster cocktail was less than I expected and it looked like the scoop some lobster meat on a ice filled glass, the fried calamari was tasteless and too much breading, and the main entree, the stuff shrimp was soaked in a bed butter along with the rice was mushy. Hopefully the owners will adjust and realize the reason why they are not getting lines waiting outside like their neighboring restaurants.
author: Ken L.

description: This place is amazing!! It has a beautiful view and is a historical site so it is very nostalgic. The food is amazing!! We were there for breakfast no wait, nice view on the water. After our coffee, we had the Crab Bloody Mary which was so fun and exciting just to look at. We also had Crab Benedict that was to die for, it was so good I forgot to take a picture! The eggs were poached perfectly and the flavor combination was perfect. This place is casual, but the food is fast and five star! The food is a little on the pricer side, but worth it especially with the view, atmosphere and the food is great! I don't give many five star reviews but I love this place every time I come and I look forward to going back again!! I loved it!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I wouldn't recommend sitting at the bar at this restaurant to anyone. They do not honor their "validation services" if your bill is less than $20, sometimes. I came in on a Saturday at 5 for a quick snack with 3 before actual dinner with other friends, but I wanted to get one of my friends ticket validated first so she could leave. 

From the instant the bartender greeted us, I felt as if he was condescending. He asked us what we were having tonight & we said just water, we wanted something quick. He did not crack a smile and just put away the coasters and looked at us silently as if saying "ok, so if you're not ordering drinks what are you having". We just sat at the bar cause there was a full house & did not want to sit outside. I ordered my chowder & then asked if I could get the ticket validated but got turned down for "ordering too little". I'm sorry, does it say somewhere that I needed a minimum order amount? Nah, he was just being rude. 

Let me just say, I've had this same exact order on the floor before with a server & i still got my ticket validated-- no sorry excuses. Their clam chowder isn't anything to run home about, either. It's comparable or even lackluster to the clam chowder stands outside of the wharf. 

...soo, ultimately I felt that we were treated that way because our poor little bill would affect his tips.
author: Ada W.

description: Terrible service. Food was bland and my dish came with a fruit serving. The fruit was touching with the food so the Melon, and orange slivers were drenched in potatoes and the tomato sauce that was used with the potatoes. I had a mango mimosa but was pretty bitter. The food came out pretty fast, that was impressive. The waiter NEVER came back to check on us nor did he introduce himself. So it was difficult for us to even call on him. Eventually after we were done we managed to wave him down to get the tab. It took him seconds to get the tab and cash us out. I wish he'd been that attentive when serving and waiting on his tables.
author: Marissa S.

description: Most of the menu is single items and "EXTREMELY" pricey. $5.99 for two eggs so think of how much everything else is. The service was an "F" as I had to constantly ask for things that should have been asked of or initially given when food was delivered. Don't waste ur time and go broke here. My rear was hurting after I left this place for getting taken advantage of!!!
author: Travis B.

description: Fog harbor was packed so we went to Eagle because there was plenty of seating (should have known then.) We had a crappy experience sitting at the bar- bartender was more into talking to his buddies (and seemed really into himself) than helping customers.. wore one glove on his left hand while he was cutting fruit, then using it to touch his cellphone, then cutting fruit again. We were going to order a full meal but service sucked so we decided against it. Never got anything without asking.. he dropped the menus off and never asked us what we wanted to drink, then we sat there with the menus for literally 20mins until we finally called him back over to ask if we could order. It was a warm day and I finished my water but he never paid enough attention to us again to get a refill, as well as place settings. We shared the crab cocktail (it was meh) both of us taking turns eating off the tiny picking fork and no napkins. Sucked. His back was to us most of the time as he talked to other people or watched football. We were only 1 of 2 parties at the bar, so I can't even give him the benefit of the doubt and say he was busy. We are easy going customers (my husband being a bartender himself) and we always tip well regardless, but we couldn't wait to leave and go somewhere else. They could have made 3x the money off us than they did due to poor service and inattention. It was early November on a Saturday around 2pm.
author: Kiran L.

description:
When my boss said he wanted to have dinner at Fisherman's Wharf, I panicked immediately. I hate touristy areas with a passion. Fortunately, we went on a Wednesday night, and it wasn't crowded at all. In fact, I was the only person in the whole restaurant, so it was a little eerie. I guess I should be careful what I ask for.

The wait staff was super attentive and courteous while I was waiting at our table, even though they were probably bored out of their minds. In the meantime, I got a Bloody Mary which was quite delicious. Not as spicy or flavorful as I like, but still decent. 

When my boss arrived, I asked what's good on the menu because he's been here before. And oh my goodness, the Lobster Bisque Bread Bowl recommendation was phenomenal. I'm not usually a fan of bisque, and I was close to erring on the side of a seafood pasta, but I'm glad he steered me in the right direction. 

As much as I dislike the tourist scene, I would actually come here again, partly because of the Lobster Bisque and partly because it's such a great place for large groups. Service is great, food is great, and of course it's a wonderful place to walk around and enjoy the waterfront if you're into that.
author: Stefanie C.

description: I loved this place, for lunch those burgers were fulfilling.. Although I would have preferred to try the breakfast, it was still nice going there mid day on a date. If you get cold easily, I wouldn't recommend you sit outside . It's San Francisco, so the wind will pick up, but the view is worth it. It's not super fancy, so what you see is what you get, it's in the middle of a top tourist destination ! Recommend you are in that area... update.. finally got to try to breakfast at this place and I will say that I'm coming back for more !!
author: Santiago E.

description: The food was amazing, beautiful view and convenient location. The seafood was flavorful and prepared perfect. Very fast and friendly service. Would definitely go back again! The server Duy was great and prompt with everything that was asked of him! :)
author: Deonna J.

description: Just skip this place.  While the location is convenient in Fisherman's Wharf, the food is awful.  The chicken in the chicken linguine was tough and the steak if the NY stripe was way over done.  It is loud and noisy.  Eagle Cafe is a blight in the San Francisco food scene.
author: Gina D.

description: Been to Fisherman's Wharf many times, but this has been my first time eating here. Host was friendly and seated us immediately, our server, Pablo, was quick to get our drink and food order. He was extremely kind. Views overlooking the Wharf. Had a clam chowder bowl and chili bowl each and they were delicious! The playlist they have for music was the best, nonstop 80's classics! We'll be back!
author: Michael T.

description: This place isn't have bad  we came here on a busy Sunday. The original place we wanted to go was crowded and we were starving so we headed up to the second floor of pier 39 to find something to eat. This place didn't have a line and we got in as soon as we told them the size of our party. We looked at the menu it's pretty small, but not bad looking. The price was also reasonable. I ordered a hamburger, mixed grilled seafood, and a bowl of clam chowder in a bread bowl. The eagle bacon American burger was amazing especially medium rare. Their side of French fries was awesome as well. My mom really enjoyed their mixed grilled seafood which consisted of grilled salmon, tilapia, mahi mahi, and shrimp. The clam chowder was pretty good, but the bread bowl was cold  if it was heated up a little bit I think it would have tasted amazing because the coldness of the bread made the clam chowder cooler than it should have been, but otherwise everything was great. The waiter was busy checking up on his other tables and it was understandable that he's busy, but we only talked to him three times. Other then when we first met him and him bringing out our orders he never checked up on us. I actually had to ask him for our check and box to go  I made eye contact with him, but maybe he was looking somewhere else. He was very focused on his other customers and he checked up on them, but it felt like we weren't really treated well  it was okay, but the food definitely made up for the experience.
author: Susan K.

description:
Great place to await the Fog Harbor next door. Knowing they are two different restaurants, they still compliment one another.  Visited twice in one day.  Great Bartender,  knowledgeable on drinks.  Atmosphere is rocking.
Would recommend for the thirsty traveler.
author: Ervin T.

description: This places food was good and well worth the price, outside seating is the way to go! I got the corned beef hash and would highly recommend!
author: Blake F.

description: I had a nice lunch here. I got the crab salad sandwich and it was pretty good. There's usually no wait here like the other restaurants. I was able to sit outside and enjoy the water view. I did have to hunt the waiter down at first, because nobody took my order after 10 minutes. After that, everything was fine.
author: Kare V.

description:
The food was good. I got the clam chowder in a bread bowl, sourdough of course. More bread and less soup than I was expecting but it was good bread so I'm not complaining. Friend got the lobster bisque, which was also pretty good. The service was good and we sat outside, which had a great view of the Pier.

 Visited 12/31/17.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The first and best lunch I ate when I settled in San Francisco. 
The soup with clams is very original. The shrimps with sauce and French fries are excellent. Good presentation and a taste very different, there is a gastronomic research from the cookers, they are serious.
I take a banana split outside with an amazing view. Coffee is good.
They also made formation for younger, next generation is on the road. I appreciate all professionalism of this restaurant.
My preferred spot in SF.
Thanks a lot and keep giving good foods, great pleasure to eat also healthy.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Quick Read: Understaffed, Overpriced, Decent Food

Food: I had the baked tilapia which was pretty good. Fell apart and tasted good. The side of fries were a little too thin for my liking. My girlfriend ordered the burger but stated it was very "average".
It certainly wasn't bad but there's other places that can serve better burgers for the same price point

Service: There was one server for about 10 tables it seemed like. It was poor but not because of the servers fault. It took me about 35-45 minutes just to get my check after I had finished eating. A few other tables had got up and left after they didn't receive service after waiting for 20 minutes.

Appearance: Nothing fancy. Note there are flies all in the building. Didn't bother me, but just a heads up.

Price: Overpriced for what it is. Average food and for some reason the drinks are overpriced. The non alcoholic drinks are expensive. Does orange juice suddenly become a rare exclusive thing in the pier where you have to overprice. Along with that the glasses are half the size they should be!

Overall experience: 4/10
author: Jonathan S.

description: Stood outside in the cold for an hour waiting for them to open at 7:30 a.m., as their signage and website both state... only to learn that they don't open until 8.  Is it that much trouble to update a website?
author: Pamela D.

description: Good food and great server but the kitchen was very slow and unorganized. We ordered 8 meals and they all came staggered. By the time the first person finished others still haven't even gotten their food. The sever apologized but never heard from management.
author: Mitchell F.

description: Stopped by for a beer and ended up with one of the best Paloma's and Lemon-drops we've ever had. The fried shrimp was delicious too. Best part by far was Kem-J... service, personality and major cocktail shake skills.
author: Heather H.

description:
First time here, came here over the weekend, stopped in around noon for a quick bite. Staff was very friendly and I was seated immediately. 
Today I opted for a cup of their clam chowder and a beer. The clam chowder, unfortunately, was too thick and tasted a little bit like flour. 
I am a huge fan of clam chowder and have been eating it all my life growing up in the bay area, unfortunately, I would opt for something else at this restaurant.
author: R. B.

description: A three star experience at most, nothing really stood out. As expected your paying for the view and being at the fisherman's ward. Breakfast here is very basic nothing too crazy, make sure you ask for crispy bacon, probably the best part of the meal. Don't try substituting any of your side cause they'll charge a pretty penny!
author: Sherwin B.

description: I was absolutely delighted by both of the meals I had here. I was visitng San Francisco for a week, and although I have been to the city before, I had never eaten at Eagle Cafe. My first morning in San Francisco I took a trip to Eagle Cafe on Pier 39 and I was so impressed by their breakfast. I had the crab omelet, which came with potatoes, fruit, and lightly toasted bread. Everything tasted incredible, the omelet was loaded with crab, potatoes well seasoned, fruit perfectly fresh. I decided to return on my last night and ordered the baked prawns which were stuffed with crab. It came with rice and vegetables. Again, everything cooked and seasoned perfectly. Great portion sizes as well. If you're in San Francisco, especially if you are a tourist, I highly recommend you visit Eagle Cafe.
author: Brianna L.

description: The view on the back deck is amazing for people watching. The food is your typical "Denny's" type nothing to great about it. Would not return here. Service is minimal at best.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Well, knowing there are better seafood joints on the pier, I ordered a $16.50 Waldorf Salad. No celery, no fresh grapes, and they forgot the walnuts. Basically a huge bowl of greens with some raisins and apples with the lemon yogurt as a drizzle. The proportions were all off. This was a plain greens salad, not the saucey, apple, grape, and walnut dominated Waldorf. Chowder was mediocre. Come here for brunch, but go somewhere else for dinner.
author: Carla B.

description:
I'm not sure what happened...  I went there this morning to have breakfast with the family. As always, the Bloody Mary was on point but the Eggs Benedict sucked. It's on the menu as a "specialty" but you know that first cut into the benedict, there's all the anticipation and satisfaction of the yolk oozing out...I didn't get it.  The eggs were overcooked. I don't get how you can mess up something so simple for a restaurant known for their breakfast. The serving sizes also have gotten a lot smaller than I remember.

I've never ventured out to other restaurants on the Pier because Eagle Cafe has always been satisfying. Maybe it's time to move on.
author: Cindy B.

description: Top on my list of things to do at Fisherman's Wharf was to eat lunch. My husband and I decided on the Eagle Cafe. He had the grilled shrimp and cold slaw (their spelling) and I had an appetizer - the cheesy crab bread - and we were both pleased with our choices. The sourdough bread was fresh and substantial and the crab spread on it was rich and creamy. I had a lemonade with it which complimented it well. The service was cheerful and professional.
author: Christine F.

description: I ate here once because the place across the street was busy. At best, this bar will have you yawning relentlessly but, just like an abusive spouse, you'll stick around because of one redeeming quality: The bartender is a smooth criminal. He poured filthy drinks & was the only person in town that could point a Bird scooter directly to the worst narcotics in the northern hemisphere - but I'll tell you what - I was supposed to leave 2 weeks ago & here I am, 14 days later with countless friends, 2 dogs & a new life I never knew I needed here in San Francisco. He saved my trip and this sad sack of a restaurant from a terrible review. All hail Eagle Cafe.
author: Whitney C.

description: We found this restaurant after disembarking from our wine cruise on the pier. There were many places to dine at Pier 39 but we chose the Eagle Cafe because (1) we were seated immediately and (2) the lobster bisque and clam chowder in a bread bowl sounded appetizing. They were! The service was excellent and the portions were quite large. Recommended, especially during the day so you can better enjoy the view of the pier.
author: Vincent Artemio E.

description: We came here on a Sunday at noon and we were seated right away. We decided to sit outside so we could people watch. We were short on time so this was the restaurant we picked which was close to the parking across the street. They validate parking so make sure you tell them. We shared a bread bowl and the chowder was pretty good. I like my soups hot and this was not hot at all. Bummer. I ordered a fish sandwich and was impressed when I first got it. Huge sandwich with a side of fries. Hmm.. the fish lacked flavor. Even with some extra tartar sauce and hot sauce. I only ate half the bread. Hubby ordered a crab sandwich and he said it wasn't tasty. Service was good. I don't think I will come here again, though.
author: Barbara F.

description:
Do you enjoy...

- Grouchy hosts.
- Slow service.
- Over-priced food.
- Misproportioned cocktails.
- 18% Auto-gratuity for less than par service.
- Being seated outside in the heat of day with 2 children.
- And a completely disrespectful and an unprofessional owner? (Yes, I'm talking about you WALLY.)

Then Eagle cafe just might be the place for you.
author: Jordan K.

description:
We came early, so there were plenty of seats. It got pretty busy as we were leaving. They do not have window seating for parties larger than four. The burgers were pretty good.  I was not a fan of their french fries, house salad, or crab sandwhich. 

They have crayons for kids to color on the large white paper tablecloth. The kids enjoyed that. 

Overall it was just ok, and pricey!
author: Sharine N.

description:
I have been here a few times. It appears that the place is under a new owner. The breakfast was good. The old paint job was all white. The new paint job SUCKS. This place felt like a maritime hang out, what it has been since it was first built as a maritime office, etc. The color now makes it looks like a dang pumpkin or a cantina and does not relate to it's history at all. And where did all the maritime history go that used to be there? The hats, the photos, the history of how the building got to where it is?
Sadly, this place now blends in with everything else at Pier 39 & along the waterfront (it does still have an amazing view) and as one of the oldest still operating restaurant/buildings on the waterfront, it's depressing. 
Did I mention the new paint job sucks?
author: voododo j.

description:
3.5 stars for food and service. The oysters are very fresh but the clam chowder was really just ok. My husband enjoyed his lobster bisque though.

Check in on Yelp for 10% off your bill!
author: Sally L.

description:
I think Eagle Cafe gets lost in the crowd since the line for Fog Harbor gets so long. We were told the wait would be approximately 15 minutes but we opted to sit at the vacant tables adjacent to the restrooms (which honestly, was not bad at all). 

Our server was friendly and very prompt despite how busy it was. I got a mojito (refreshing and well made) as well as their fish & chips. Not the best I've had, but it definitely hit the spot.
author: Matthew L.

description: Very nice restaurant perched on top of pier 39. Nice views, good food and a really good bloody Mary! Very friendly service.
author: Lissette G.

description: This restaurant is amazing when it comes to the drinks. I came in with my friend super late kitchen was closed but we have the best drinks ever.  I wasn't sure what I wanted to if I had already been drinking all day I won with the bartender's choice and he made me the Manhattan it was awesome orange pill with a very cute touch to my drink.
author: Jasmine H.

description: I went here after a touristy day with my girlfriend, It was after at the Disney tree lighting. The place was pretty empty and had about 2 hours or more before it closed. As I walked in it was clear they had a large party and decided not to clean up after having a large party. The waitress was nice and service slow. The restaurant was out of several menu items. The prices wasn't worth the quality of food served. Definitely a tourist trap.
author: Queenie ..

description: We stopped here on the 4th of July. It was crazy busy, but we didn't need to wait for a table. We both got bread bowls. The lobster bisque was AMAZING. The clam chowder was pretty good too, but we are from New England so ours is better . We also had the garlic Dungeness crab and shrimp which was messy but yummy! They were busy so I'll give them a pass on having us wait with no refills and no food left for 10 mins before getting us the check. It was the 4th of July - they deserve a pass haha.
author: Katrina D.

description: We have gone to this restaurant a number of times over the past few years. This time we happened to  arrive with a cruise ship. We were building up this restaurant to our friends telling them about the nice view that they have good food and reasonably price drinks.  My wife and I and two friends arrived made a beeline to the restaurant and wanted to sit down at the outdoor bar and were told that we could not be seated. They told us they could not see this at that location if you're not going to order food. We explained that we were each going to order an appetizer plus a number of drinks which I'm sure would've totaled $250. I shared this point with our waiter and he still refused to seat us. The funny thing is there was no one sitting outside at location we wanted to be seated. So I'm wondering if they didn't want to deal with my handicap friend who is in a wheelchair or for whatever reason the waiter just didn't like us. The good news is there are plenty of locations where you can sit down with her friends to enjoy a drink and a beautiful scenery that this harbor has to offer.
author: George T.

description: Loved the stuffed shrimp for dinner! We enjoyed dinner inside the restaurant, overlooking the Pier. It was delicious and the service excellent.
author: Mellonie P.

description:
The food is very good the portions are large, there is a problem with the restroom though there isn't enough.  So you can't hang out for long because after one drink yes go to the restroom right.

The bartender's the owner very pleasant nice to see the owner involved.
author: Pearl A.

description:
The best thing about this restaurant is the view! We ate here just for the ability to sit outside in the beautiful weather and look out over the water while we ate. It was a magnificent atmosphere! Inside is also nicely decorated and has a decent amount of seating for small groups. Outside seating is very limited bar style so it's mainly good for one or two person parties. There is only one gender neutral restroom so you may have to travel outside the restaurant to use the restroom, or wait for awhile. 
The service was friendly and we were able to order quickly, but afterwards service was slower. Their menu isn't very large but it has good variety, although it would be tough to navigate as a vegetarian. The brunch menu consists of omelets, sweets, and fish specials. We each got an omelet and were happy with both the taste and portion size! For lunch I had a burger and my husband enjoyed a half crab at a good market value. Again, the taste was good. The burger and omelets seemed a little over priced, but that's to be expected based on the location.
author: Katie D.

description: Originally I was waiting in the two hour line for Fog Harbor Fish House next door, but I did not think that was worth that long of a wait. So, we waited half and hour for the Eagle Cafe and got the outdoor deck seating which was amazing! I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl, and it took a long time to come out. The serving size was really big, but I wish the soup itself was a little hotter in temperature than it was served as. Overall, the flavor was delicious, but nothing spectacular. Definitely a good alternative choice if Fog Harbor is too crowded.
author: Keilab A.

description: Stopped in for some mimosas on a Saturday morning and we wanted to sit on the balcony. We were told the balcony was for people ordering food. There was nobody on the balcony but the manager still wouldn't let us. Even though we offered to move if someone wanted our spot, manager was dead set on "NO". Then they advertised $9 mimosas and charged us $11. The staff was very nice, the manager not so much. We quickly drank our drinks and left. I also took a picture of the balcony when we left to show it was empty. I think this was poor decisions on the manager's part because he lost our business.
author: M M.

description: We order a fried chicken sandwich, tilapia and a  P.O. boy sandwich. All of us were extremely disappointed. Very small portions and fries were cold.
author: Kayly O.

description:
While doing the tourist thang at the Pier i decided to stop at Pier 39 rather than fisherman's wharf to have a beer and an appetizer before moving on to my next excursioni had an IPA and decided on a garlic shrimp. I was sitting at the bar and the bartender was friendly enough. 

When my appetizer arrived it came with bread and cold unspreadable butter why do they still serve frozen butter. Anyways the shrimp seemed fresh, we are close to the source afterall. Anyways the brother was rather soupy and was heavily lemony. So much for the frozen butter. Anyways, there was the right portion of garlic and herbs. It was the lemon that missed the swing from being a homer. 

I will probably not visit this place again and figure my penalty for not hitting the Fisherman's wharf
author: William B.

description: Par at best.  Way to expensive, and check you receipts.  They add their own tips and do not highlight so you can  easily tip twice
author: JD B.

description: Absolutely the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. I would not recommend even walking by the door. First off, although the food was pretty great, they were way overpriced. However, the service left much to be desired. The servers were not willing to split bills in more than 2 ways and when we paid, the waiter refused to split the check personally, only equally, because it would "be easier for me". Then, the waiters did not even have the intellectual knowledge to swipe 2 cards through the machine. 15 minutes later, they decided to just have us sign the check before charging it since we had to leave which seemed really sketch. I'm worried that they're going to overcharge me after I'm gone and wouldn't even know. Overall just a very sketchy place. I would not recommend at all.
author: Brandon C.

description:
I grew up in a seaside town. My family loves seafood - hell some even work in the industry. So my cousin comes down with her children from Alaska for a visit. (Alaska where fish are aplenty and fresh) It's hot and busy everywhere when we come across this place that wasn't too busy at all. Should've taken that as an obvious sign when all the other restaurants were packed with lines and this one had plenty of tables. We were a group of 8 - 4 adults and 4 kids. All the children had the same thing chicken tenders and fries and a cup of orange juice. I tried some fish and salad and a side of fries. My cousin had the same thing and the other two adults had oysters I think it was and another seafood item. 

The fish tasted like it had been frozen from those $10 bulk bags at the supermarket but they give you two and charge you $20+. It was dry, chewy and disappointing. Ours came cold and the fries were better at Burger King. We didn't say anything but just left but after spending around $200+ I'm really disappointed in the quality of food and will not come here again.
author: Julie C.

description: Amazing clam chowder and lobster bisque. Service awesome.  Great place to stop on pier 39.
author: Lisa M.

description: Horribly overpriced for quality and quantity of food. There is a reason there isn't much of a wait here compared to the neighboring restaurants.
author: Al J.

description: Views and bloody's are amazing! Breakfast is good but also very reasonable on the wallet. Also came back for some oysters in the afternoon and more drinks, again the views on the patio are great if you're not with a group.
author: Cody E.

description: This place's food was hit or miss. Our shrimp tasted great, the salmon was the worst I've had in my entire life. Ultimately , our meal for two adults, two kids was 160 without tip, and once we got home three out of four of us had food poisoning. Think vomiting, cramps, etc. I would not recommend!
author: Gail J.

description: Sweet waitress. Rip off food and drinks. Waited to sit outside instead sat by bathroom. Buzz kill to SF experience. Don't do it!!!
author: W M.

description:
Honestly, I'm not sure why this place only has 3.5 stars on Yelp?! We came here unplanned as we initially wanted to try Fog Harbor but the wait was way too long and we were actually seated pretty quickly at Eagle Cafe.  I was with 6 others but there were enough seats at the bar.  

My boyfriend and I shared:

-Clam Chowder Bread Bowl
-1 dozen Oysters
-Angel Hair Salmon Pasta

The Clam Chowder Bread Bowl was alot bigger than I had expected, but no complaints here! It was a pretty chilly day in SF so the chowder really hit the spot and warmed us up real quick.    
Also, it actually my first time having soup in a bread bowl and I must say, I am definitely a fan. I was surprised to see how well the bread bowl holds up as I expected it to get a bit messy with soup spilling out but not at all!

One dozen oysters will cost you ~$25 which isnt too bad at all compared to the other spots around this area.  The oysters were from Virigina and W O W--I was pleasantly surprised at how incredibly fresh they were!  No fishy aftertaste or sand/rocks left in your mouth afterwards.  One dozen was definitely not enough because I was left wanting more after the last oyster.

The pasta came out last and it was the finishing touch to our meal.  The pasta was very light but very flavorful as it was sauteed in garlic, basil and light tomato sauce.  I was pleased with the amount of salmon in my pasta as well as the diced up sauteed tomatoes as well.

I really would not mind coming back to dine here again the future. Short wait, fresh oysters, delicious food and good service!  

** T I P S**
-Check in on Yelp for 10% off lunch or dinner! (no exclusions!)
author: Regina O.

description: This was a great stop for breakfast! It was a bit pricey, but the view was worth it! I had an omelette which was delicious! The fresh squeezed orange juice was great! The server was friendly and attentive!
author: Jessica C.

description:
My friend was in the mood for some oysters - she found what she wanted and it led us to the Eagle Cafe.

On the second floor of the entrance into pier 39 you will find this restaurant. Seafood is the fare and drinks as well!

It was busy for lunch and much of the interior dining area was full, so we opted to sit outside on the picnic tables. It was just perfect.


The weather that day was just the right temperature, the view of the bridge on the horizon, the wind blowing just slightly, I felt lit was almost staged to perfection.

The wait staff was nice and friendly and when we ordered our drinks, it did take a bit of time but we didn't care much.

With frosty beers and a bloody mary martini, we ordered our food. The food came out in a good timely fashion and the portions are pretty huge! Come hungry!

I ordered the chicken fngers - to me chicken fingers are chicken fingers - but the oyster shooters were fresh and good, and the crab melt was amazing!

If you're needing a place to rest on Embarcadero - and need some drinks and seafood - come and visit here. I hope your experience was just a good as ours!

:]
author: Ryo Hanalei Z.

description: Our waiter was really nice but the food was just okay (ordered the club) and my vodka tonic was one of the worst I've ever had. At one point I asked a girl working who wasn't busy for a lemon wedge and she never did come back. Bathrooms were disgusting... not very enjoyable other than the view and our waiter. Went because there wasn't a line... assuming this is why there was no line. Wouldn't go back.
author: AnnMarie J.

description:
For vegetarians and vegans: this place is NOT vegetarian / vegan friendly. There was one salad and fries. That's IT. 

What was even more disappointing? They cook the fries in the same batter with the seafood! So even the fries aren't vegetarian / vegan. 

The salad was also bland with almost nothing in it. 

As well the staff was rude but I think it's because my friends and I look young. They were definitely more friendly to the surrounding adults.
author: Amit T.

description: This restaurant doesn't even deserve a star. Waited 30 minutes at the table on patio no one came and even looked at us. TRASH!!
author: Mike X.

description: Food was over priced for mediocre service and clam chowder worse than progreso clam chowder. Don't waste your time or money here go up the street to the fishermans grotto
author: Kevin G.

description: My wife and I used to visit Eagle Cafe on a regular basis when we lived in the Bay area. So its been a few years since we have been back and were disappointed on our visit. The prices are outrageous even for Fisherman's Wharf Pier 39. Especially, since we learned that most of the fish dishes on the menu are not fresh but frozen. We won't be back.
author: Dennis M.

description:
I failed to check what time breakfast ended. I saw all these amazing reviews. Breakfast brain had to quickly adapt to Lunch brain. Lunch wasn't bad. Had a burger and their fries were fantastic! R
Thin cut and crispy. My fave
author: Estella I.

description:
The clam strips....were clam strips.  Decent, hard to screw up.  The cheeseburger was good....again, hard to screw up.  The original thing we got were oyster shooters.  Not your typical oyster shooters.  It was like a huge shot of vodka with a couple oysters and hot sauce at the bottom.  It wasn't good.  

The service was fine.  Our waiter was pleasant, offered to validate our parking, and was attentive.  We were, however, seated next to the bathroom.  It was a strange set-up....a room full of tables and then three extra mini-tables shoved into the hallway next to the bathroom.  Maybe it's where they put the unsuspecting tourist.  

This place was just ok.  Nothing fancy, nothing terrible.  I did like that it was not a commercial restaurant which seems to be the only thing down at Fisherman's warf.
author: Harmony N.

description: Food is separated per meal which is disappointing when they hand you the whole menu. Food was ordered and we sent some back due to taste. The place is pricy for the small amount of options and not worth it. No gluten free options available for you gf connoisseurs
author: Licia P.

description: For the area, it's fine. If you like overpriced food and cocktails in the middle of a tourist trap, this place will be right up your ally. We chose it bc they were still serving breakfast, which made it less expensive than the restaurant next door. The California omelet was good, but large. I could have split it w my daughter. I wish they'd reduce the portion sizes and the prices. The orange juice was absolutely disgusting it's more like an orange chemical drink. I watched the bartender pour Bloody Marys, which seemed to have 2 shots in them, so there's that. I probably should have skipped the omelette and went straight for the bloody. It might've made the next hour in pier 39 half bearable.
author: Renee M.

description: This place was amazing!!! It is a little pricey but not to bad for San Francisco. I had the Rib eye and it was amazing. My husband had the salmon pesto pasta with grilled shrimp added to it and he said it was the best dish he has ever had. Super friendly staff. Very attentive.
author: Kristine M.

description: Whenever I would come to SF I would always come to this location, but I will have to say that it will be my last visit. When me and my family first got here we were seated right away which was perfect. But right when we ordered our drinks they said they were out of coke? You have a bar how can you be out of coke? So we ordered a sprite inside and I had ordered a mango margarita, my family got their drinks first but I never received mine. It was not a busy day and I had been waiting for my drinks over 20 mins straight and still no mango margarita. So I had to tell one of the workers to cancel the drink, than shortly our fried calamari which was very good, until at the very end of our appetizer there was hair at the bottom of the plate which was disgusting! Good thing the manager voided it, but overall our waiter had such a bad attitude and was being aggressive and did not wanted to be at work. Plus the clam-chowders are not as good as they use to be. I was very upset with the service and finding unwanted hair in our meal.
author: Jocelyn P.

description: It'll do in a pinch. Compares favorably to enduring the long lines at Hard Rock, but the food and service are unremarkable. Same as it was 80 years ago, I reckon.
author: Roger B.

description: Military Memorabilia removed.... My wife and I have been going to Pier 39 for 32 years....that's when we got engaged. Every year since then, we've been going to the Eagle Cafe..at least most of those years.  The food has always been good, no complaints, the service has been good too...my biggest disappointment came today when I noticed that the management had removed all the military caps from many ships and veterans that served in wars all over the world.  This was not part of some great remodel, but appears to be the only noticeable change. I looked forward in the respect the restaurant gave our veterans but now it's a disgrace that they taken all of those caps down. The Eagle Cafe, a true piece of Americana now just another place I don't need to visit. Today my daughter got engaged and looks to keep the tradition going..going somewhere else I guess.
author: Russell M.

description: Excellent service and a great experience. Had lunch here and food was absolutely delicious. Come by and try this place out! I had fish and shrimp.
author: Chris J.

description: My wife's salmon was severely off. The rest of the food was just regular and for the price this is a rip off. Tourist trap. Do not come here.
author: David M.

description:
We came here for my friends birthday  the oysters were really good, but the clam chowder was one of the worst I've ever had. Really disappointing, clam chowder is one of my most favorite soups ever. 
We were seated quickly- we were there pretty early. Our server wasn't really helpful and he didn't know if they had clams  I probably won't be coming back especially since SF has so many more eateries .
author: Milee T.

description: Okay so I have been to this Cafe an embarrassing amount of times. What that has allowed me to tell you with confidence is: the food here is consistently excellent. Dare I say one of the freshest and most flavorful places to eat seafood in SF. The Diablo Shrimp is a must. If you don't try the Fried Oysters you are missing out. Easily the best oysters I have ever tried. In fact, it's non - negotiable. If you love seafood - you'll love this place. Reasonable prices and great service. Pro Tip: For an amazing view of the Pier 39, come on a sunny *but not windy day*. Follow me on IG @thelavenderchai for more pics!
author: Oyin L.

description: This Place Looks a Little Sketchy, But it's Beyond FLAVORFUL  Everything is AMAZING, The Calamari, the Grilled Seafood Platter and my Favorite Oven Roasted Praws Stuffed with Crab  And Our Waiter MARIO was Awesome
author: Janice L.

description:
We were looking for somewhere to grab food before our Alcatraz tour. This place was a little over a 10 min walk from the pickup location and got the job done. We both had the corned beef hash. It's a big portion and comes with eggs, potatoes, toast and fruit. Definitely a heartier meal. Overall, I thought it was just ok, but this place seemed to be one of the few decent breakfast options in the area. 

The restaurant is upstairs overlooking the water and would've had the view going for it if it wasn't so foggy/rainy that day.
author: Therese M.

description: This was probably the worst restaurant I have ever been to. The food wasn't even bad, but the service was complete garbage. The servers weren't clear with anything and didnt even seem like they liked their job, the food was way overpriced, and it took them over half an hour to swipe a card. They made the payments at the end of the meal way overcomplicated and ended postponing the card payment to a later time. It felt like a complete waste of time in the fact that I could've walked across the street to get the same food for cheaper and faster. Overall, I definitely do not recommend this restaurant.
author: Alex H.

description:
We stopped by here after a company event at the Aquarium of the Bay. To begin with, they had missed our reservation but were quick to set things right for us. We were a party of 20, which means we pretty much occupied more than half the restaurant. 

Food is great - the clam chowder and seafood grill is absolute delish, and they also threw in complimentary calamari's and icecream because they messed up our reservation.
author: Diana D.

description: Service is great here, manager is on the floor helping out, refilling drinks, walking around and our waitress is great! Food is good as well
author: Ashley G.

description: I rented the Eagle for a private event. I worked with Karen to organize the event on very short notice. She was a delight to work with and so were all of the staff on hand the day of the event. Everything went smoothly; the service was perfect, the food was delicious, and the restaurant space was clean and accommodating. The Eagle Cafe will forever be the host to our special day that went off without a hitch. Thank you!
author: Friday W.

description: I hadn't planned to eat here, but was pleasantly surprised by the super friendly waitstaff, very little wait time for food and portion size. Our server, Rodrigo, was awesome. I tried the clam chowder. It was just okay. I really like the one next door at Fog Harbor. Beware they only have one restroom and the line for it can get pretty long. They do have outdoor seating in the back of the restaurant. It's like sitting at a covered outdoor counter. A pretty cool place that I might visit again.
author: Cyn T.

description: Came here after a trip to Alcatraz. We were super hungry and wanting some food to eat. Our whole table ended up ordering all bread bowls (lobster bisque or clam chowder). Both were very good but when I started eating the lobster bisque, it wasn't all lobster, I could tell they added crab meat and shrimp to the bisque as well (which I was totally shocked about). But otherwise our experience was awesome! Our food came out very fast, right after we ordered our food it came out in about five minutes or less which was awesome! You can't beat your food coming out that fast at most places.
author: Magz K.

description:
The spicy jumbo shrimp was fantastic, but insanely expensive, given the amount of shrimp you actually get. 

The clam chowder was a disappointment for a restaurant that is literally on the Bay, bragging about SF's famous clam chowder, but at least it was the one thing that wasn't exorbitantly overpriced. The server forgot to bring us the clam chowder till after the rest of the food was arrived and we asked about the chowder, at which point it was cold

The bread put out with both these dishes was stone cold, stale, and likely store bought. Impossible to chew, which made the meal quite unpleasant. 

The fried oysters were decent, but the plate was primarily fries (which was meant to be the side) and then some oysters (which was meant to be the entree). Once again, quite an expensive dish that disappointed with quantity. 

Service was okay. Our server was pleasant and helpful, but they seemed a little understaffed, as he was gone for long periods of time, and forgot to bring us our chowder. 

The restaurant itself could definitely use a slight revamp. I'm not sure if they're trying to retain the "vintage" look, but it's descended into a little dark, dingy, and dirty looking place. Going for proper tablecloths and serviettes over paper might be a good start. Working on plating and presentation would also help a little. The menu also looks like it's been I'm use since 1928, and it's extremely hard to read. Definitely needs an overhaul. 

All in all, prices were a little too much for me given all the shortcomings of both the place and the food, so I likely won't be going back during my next visit to Pier 39.
author: Nishant R.

description:
Friendly staff i have no complains about that if i can give them 5stars i will, very attentive. 

BUT

Food is okay, too over priced for me i ordered fish and chips with clams combo huge plate (ofcourse for a 25$ meal) it's bland the fries is tasteless. I think my favorite part of the dish was the slaw but over all it was not that special. I guess i pretty much paying for the view not the food. Hahaha.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Yeah so this entire area is a tourist trap, that was never in any doubt, but sometimes you just want to spend a low-key morning watching the sea lions and sitting down to a no-nonsense breakfast. This place has pretty much transported a greasy spoon diner menu into the slightly classier package of a run of the mill tavern. The white tablecloths and wood floors bely the fact that you're still eating corned beef hash or an omelet, but the view is nice and the service is quick. Just don't expect miracles, and definitely expect the check to be more than that diner.
author: Joe L.

description:
We ate here last weekend, when we couldn't get into the Fog-something place next door. Wish we had chosen somewhere else. The menu is uninspiring at best. Generic recipes and generic seafood options. Pathetic wine list. Service was just barely adequate. The food was ok. Prices were high, even considering the location. $13 for a bowl of chowder. Not a bread bowl - a regular bowl. Yikes.

Nothing was terrible, but there are so many options down there. Choose something else.
author: John S.

description: My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to eat before Outdoor Movie Night at Pier 39 and stumbled upon Eagle Cafe (after seeing the wait at Bubba Gump was 1.5 hours). We ordered the stuffed jumbo shrimp entree, a bowl of clam chowder, and a plate of 6 oysters. Service here was pretty good, but the food wasn't worth the price - $70 after tax tip is what I remember. The oysters that we received were cleaned very poorly - there were multiple chunks of broken shell, and the connective tissue wasn't cut off between the oyster and the shell. The stuffed shrimp entree and the bowl of clam chowder were nothing special either. Overall, I had a pretty meh experience dining here.
author: Austin W.

description: Easy, good cocktail choice friendly service and fantastic crabs. A four stars well deserved.
author: Mario M.

description:
I give this place a excellent 4 !
The food came fast and the crab salad sandwich was superb it came with string fries . Requested the fries crispy and they were not when they arrived that's ok.
My wife salmon had a little too much spices and drown the flavor of the salmon but was cook perfect . All in all the restaurant is a good place to eat. Oh they do have Anchor steam beer in tap !!!! As for my 10% discount... I showed the app to our waiter and he said he do it . When the bill came it was NOT on the bill ( the discount) so I reminded him again and he mumble some thing and left. So I noted it on the bill and gave him a $6 .
author: Kevin S.

description:
What a delicious place to grab breakfast, and with their fresh fruit it's a plus! They have indoor and outdoor seating (overlooking the water). I had their healthy breakfast and enjoyed every bite.

By the way, their french toast is by far the best I've had in a long time. It wasn't too mushy and had a bit of crunch to the edges, and not too greasy like other french toast.

This is a must if you happen to be around pier 39 during breakfast/brunch. The servers are very attentive and courteous as well!
author: Nasha W.

description:
When you arrive to SF and have couple hours to check into your hotel room and want to avoid the hassle to look for places, right at the entrance of Pier 39 on the second floor Eagle Cafe is there for you. But think twice before walking in. Wait was only 5 minutes, we got a table right across the serving station. Ordering time was also good as well as the service time but to sell the tables faster and make more money at the end of the day, they lack the hygiene of the food and that is why I ended up finding a piece of paper in sauce of my shrimp dish.

Dish itself was okay, too much garlic for me though. My husband's burger seemed so so. Considering these are touristy places, one should lower the expectations but next door seemed better even we have not tried. 

Interior is cute, you may enjoy drinks by the window with appetizers. But keep your appetite to local places within the city.
author: Ceren A.

description:
The view when you are sitting outside is great and you can get to see the sea lions center, Alcatraz etc. 
Except that, the food was correct and overpriced. 
They sorted me next to a big trash can that was smelling. I asked for milk for my coffee and they gave me a glass of milk. I explained and then they changed it but charged me for the glass of milk!!!
author: Joy R.

description: This place straight sucks. Batter on calamari falls off. Clam chowder is super watery, pasta has no flavor and super watery, on top of that the service is horrible. Will not come back or recommend it. Wish there was a 0 star. Only thing decent was fried oysters. Save your money and eat elsewhere
author: SplitSecond A.

description:
Was in the area doing the tourist thing with friends and I were starting to get hungry so we decided to give Eagle Café a try.

It was a Sunday afternoon, but we got a table right away. After checking out the menu I knew I wanted the Fish & Chips so I placed my order.

I do love me some fish and chips, and when I think of chips I think of some thick fries, like maybe steak fries or something like that, so that's what I had pictured in my head as fish and chips. What I got was fish and shoestring potatoes. So very sad.

The fish was lightly fried and tasted great, the slaw that is served with it is a vinegar base and not my favorite, I was just disappointed by the chips, and the meal was not what I was hoping it to be.

Service was good, it was a busy Sunday, so there was some waiting around for the check and what not, but it is on Pier 39 and full of tourist. If you get to grab a seat outside, the view of the bay is great.
author: Monica O.

description: This place is the greatest. James made my birthday the best and the lobster bisque and the chicken linguini is 18 stars out of 5. Coming back before i leave town!!
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
My boyfriend and I were on the hunt for fresh oysters during our visit at Pier 39. As random as it may seem to have picked Eagle Cafe, we got lucky because we had one of the best fresh shucked oysters here.

We ordered a dozen for $25. They served them on ice with lemon, cocktail sauce and fresh horseradish. It was probably one of the best oysters that I've ever had. We finished the entire dozen in less than 10 minutes.

We sat at the counter and the service was excellent.

**RECOMMENDED**
author: Sharr K.

description: The service was fast, but not rushed. The server was on point. No drink ever went empty. The manager I presume visited our table twice to see if everything was going good. The food was amazing. We had the grilled seafood platter, crab salad sandwich, and children's chicken fingers. All were amazing. The clam chowder was fantastic!
author: Fernando G.

description: Just had a Valentine's dinner here. The portions were huge and the food was delicious!! Surprised more people were not here to enjoy such good food and service.
author: Tracy H.

description: Ordered fried fish & shrimp combo plate. The food was ok, just average. The slaw was shredded dry cabbage. Bottles beer is $5. Service was very good. Great harbor view from outside seating area.
author: Police Lives Matter ..

description: This place was awful. I asked for a burger and asked if I could get a side salad instead of fries and I will pay extra he said he could give me mixed greens. It was literally lettuce with no dressing, nothing on it. They forgot one of my friends meals another persons drink and let me say it was not busy at all. Food was just mediocre, would not come here again.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Great location on Pier 39 closer to the street side.
Stopped in for appetizers and drinks late afternoon following a catamaran sail cruise past Alcatraz and under the Golden Gate Bridge. The jumbo shrimp cocktail were excellent, very fresh and chilled really well with nice cocktail sauce. The crab melt appetizer was very good, too but could have been a touch better with just a little more bread. The fried calamari was excellent, very fresh, lightly battered, done perfectly and nice and hot. The drinks didn't come out as we expected though, but that wasn't much of an issue, an Old fashioned with no ice and a Makers neat served in a shot instead of rocks glass so best to specify exactly what you expect from the bar if that's important to you.
author: Carl S.

description: Went there for happy hour at 5:30 on 9oct2017. The bartender was pissed off for some reason and jerky. Forgot to make my drink, and when he finally remembered to make it, he just chucked it at me without a word.
author: Andrew S.

description: We wanted to stop somewhere for breakfast before we went on our tour of Alcatraz. This was nearby and looked promising.. Had a pretty disappointing experience. First off, I am okay with paying higher price for food that is worth it. The portions were skimpy, at least on my Crab omelette. Barely any crab and it was very flat and dry. Not a big beautiful fluffy egg omelette like one expects.. Then they messed up our order.. Now typically I would not count this against an establishment, everyone makes mistakes. But what made it bad for me, was the waiter questioning whether we really didn't order what they brought.. Just own up to it,  apologize, and bring me what I ordered. I wouldn't have given it another thought after that.. But to continually imply you are sure we said one thing over another is uncalled for.. Unsure If I would try this place again or not..
author: Jerm M.

description:
We live in the Monterey Bay area and have been visiting San Francisco for over 40 years. This overnight we stayed at the rather funky Royal Pacific Motor Inn
in Chinatown (dinner at the near by Firenze by Night in North Beach) and walked easily from the hotel to Pier 39 for a great breakfast at the Eagle Cafe. The waiters were all great. The food and coffee delicious and always fun to watch the sea lions nearby.
author: Ann F.

description: Food was great and the service was amazing! I would definitely recommend this place. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in SF.
author: Eric M.

description: Very bad service. They gave us a table & menus. But no one even came to our table to give us water & take our order. They were not even that busy that they couldn't handle all the tables esp when they had few empty tables around. We waited 10-15mins, then decided to just walk out.
author: Harpreet K.

description:
I don't typically eat at Pier 39 when I visit SF. This place deserves a one star but I'm giving this is two star because it has such a beautiful view and it's at the heart of Fishermans Wharf. This review is only based on the lunch menu. 

I was craving for oysters and while waiting for our table - asked the hostess. She seemed uninterested to help and had no idea what I was talking about. She did not seem like your typical hostess because she didn't greet the guests coming up, had no enthusiasm or professionalism.   The server messed up on our order twice. They kept ringing us the wrong dish and my friend recieved her tilapia plate as we were finishing out meals. The service is BAD. 

We sat down at a table near the window which you get a good view of the boardwalk. The seafood options were really limited for lunch. The pictures on Yelp didn't help in deciding what I wanted because had breakfast and dinner options. 

I order the steam clams in butter garlic sauce. Each of my friend order a fried seafood plate - clams, fish and chips, and fish and clams. The steamed clams had a layer of butter 

The fried batter had a nice even coating on it and wasn't too doughy. But the batter had basic taste to it. The fish wasn't the freshest. They had skinny fries paired with the plates and coleslaw. The friend clams strips were literally strips of dough. My friend ordered a Bloody Mary and couldn't even finish it.

Everything was mediocre at best. Not the freshest or amazing seafood place here.
author: Joanna H.

description:
We were there one week ago and had a bad experience.   One of the owners ( the guy who wears the head set) was extremely rude to a guest with a camera tripod.  I wanted to leave.  The "greeter" acted like she wanted to be anywhere but there.   
I guess they have a name so they don't have to care about service.  Even the servers who saw were uncomfortable and commented.   I have a lot of friends in San Francisco and I have told them all about eagle cafe's service.   Keep that owner away from guests and you will be fine.  Maybe he can be the silent partner.  

I will never be back!
author: Mark L.

description: Amazing fruit bowl, fresh coffee and cupcake. Service was quick and friendly would come back for lunch.
author: Lorna N.

description: Double decker BLT with fries for $13? Can't go wrong there. Also awesome view of the pier outside but beware it's a little chilly with the wind!
author: Emma J.

description: We actually wanted to go to the nearby restaurant but because they said we would have to wait atleast  half an hour we came here and it didn't disappoint.  It's a busy place and we had the grilled chicken sandwich with chipotle sauce and grilled fish platter which was one of the specials of the day.  Both the dishes were nice.The service was also good and fast.
author: Smitha K.

description: The best part about this place was the hostess that sat us. I ordered the Salmon plate with vegetables. It came out salmon  with lettuce. The waiter told me that is a vegetable and if I wanted real vegetables it would be an extra $2.50.. Never coming back!
author: Gina C.

description: I had the Club Sandwich. I was the best club I have had in my life and I've had a lot of them. Piles of ham and turkey and thick slab bacon. Yum! My ice tea was sweet without needing sugar. Had a cup of clam chowder as an appetizer and it was better than most. The staff was attentive and the view of the bay was nice.
author: Sharon D.

description: 2 eggs over medium (?) with potatoes and sourdough toast. Eggs were over cooked as you can see - potatoes were cold - toast was cold AND dry. I asked for butter and the waiter brought 4 pats of refrigerated butter no jam nothing. The view is nice but it's not a place I could recommend. A cup of coffee is $4.00 so I checked in on yelp to get 10% off and to feel (a little) better about a so-so breakfast.
author: Sheri R.

description: The crab Benedict was awesome!  The service was good. It's a bit of sound overload with both the tv blaring and the music turned up at 9:30 in the morning blended with all the patrons trying to talk over the noise.
author: Renee W.

description:
We ate here for Breakfast, since it was one of the very first places open early on Pier39!

The Eagle Cafe has a very cunning, old-world style feel to it.  The view of the ocean isn't very visible though, but you can at least smell the fresh ocean breeze!

The table tops are just plain paper, nothing fancy.  Food was splendid, I was actually impressed by their food - for an Omelette.  

One backdraw other than the DISGUSTING, unwashed, unhygienic one toilet Unisex bathroom  were the drinks, they put too much alcohol in it. 
Don't get their Mimosas or Orange Crush for breakfast, You'll be passed out by 12!
author: Marina S.

description: Really disappointed that they false advertise that they have raw oysters. Not only is it listed on their outdoor menu that's listed near the front doors but also on their black canopy on the side of the building. The manage said they haven't offered raw oysters in months... so why is it still listed multiple places? Just disappointing to wait for a table and then not get what is advertised
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Visited here with a good friend after we came back from a whale watching boat ride. I was freezing from the whale watching so all I really wanted was hot tea or something.

We both settled on hot chocolate and we also shared fried calamari and the fisherman's platter of fried seafood. Everything tasted good. One star lower only because man was it pricey! Though I suppose I should have expected that... I say you should consider coming here if you're searching for food in the ever crowded Pier 39.
author: Annie L.

description:
Eagle cafe is centrally located in Pier 39 on second floor with a great view of the harbor. 
It is a very nice (smaller) restaurant with friendly and attentive staff and great food and full bar. Had a 15 minute wait so started in the bar with bloody Mary's (spicy, as they should be). 
We had the calamari as the starter, was nicely breaded and fresh, everyone in our group loved it. 
We ordered the Clam Chowder bread bowl - delicious soup and bowl! Fish and Chips, which came with some of the best thin French fries I've had in a long time and cole slaw. Also had the mixed seafood plate, has salmon, tilapia and shrimp with Cole Slaw, all of it was very fresh, perfectly seasoned and served with a few fresh juicy lemons. 

Overall, all the food was amazing and we enjoyed the location and friendly service. Will be back in future and recommend to friends.
author: Tasha M.

description: Most amazing Grey goose Bloody Mary ! And calamari was fresh and amazing ! Bar tender friendly and server was attentive ! Highly recommend
author: Brenda M.

description:
The food was great, and the view outside was pretty terrific. It was my family's first time at Pier 39 and we didn't know which restaurant was good so we chose this one since it didn't have as many people waiting as other restaurants.  They said it would take 10 minutes for us to get a table.  20 minutes later,  we noticed several groups just spoke to the lady taking reservations and were seated immediately. My Mom asked again and only then were we seated (the lady even sounded a little bit annoyed at having been reminded). The waitress was nice and so were the servers,  I guess it was only the maitre'd who had a problem.  

Tip: order their clam chowder and grilled chicken sandwich,  it's really good!
author: Nieka U.

description: Stopped in for drinks and apps. Had a great experience! Spicy garlic shrimp is amazing. Fried calamari is very good, too.
author: Ash J.

description: I wish I could give a 0.  This place has the worst  customer service.  Bill was incorrect and we needed them to change it three times.  This was maliciously and fraudulently done, if you do decide to go here check the bill 5 times over for extra drinks, extra meals, and other extra items.  We understand they are in a tourist area but the lack of service and attitude from everyone to rush us of the restaurant is uncalled for when you spend almost 400 dollars.  I would say that this was one of the worst experiences we have had at a restaurant and everyone at our table felt the same.  How do you treat people so badly and overcharge them?  Avoid this place
author: Steven C.

description: First time our family came here. Great food. Okay service. The waiter messed up my mom's order so she kept getting parts of her meal delivered while we were eating & another waiter had to refill my drinks. I recommend the EAGLE BURGER. It's excellent!  The wait time wasn't too long but we came during lunch so we expected the wait time to be average. Great location at Peir 39. I'd come back again.
author: Ariana H.

description:
After walking into a dozen restaurants with a ridiculous wait we stumble across Eagle Cafe and good thing we did. 

There was absolutely no wait we were seated right away and even got a seat outside. Which I more than recommend! The view outside is to die for. I love people watching so this was by far the best view I could ask for. 

I ordered the crab salad sandwich and fries and it was a good sized sandwich that left me very satisfied. I was dying of hunger which is probably why I scarfed it down but no matter the case it was a delicious sandwich. Definitely would eat here again. 

You can't beat this view!!
author: Batul A.

description: Bloody Mary Review - With three different bloody marys to choose from, Eagle Cafe has all its bases covered. Choose between the pint sized Classic Bloody Mary and the Spicy Mary Martini. Or grab a buddy and get adventurous with the $24 Crabby Mary that comes complete with huge chunks of crab, crackers, cocktail sauce, and side of horseradish. Why go? A crab filled mary. | Price: $9.50-$24
author: Shelley B.

description:
Had been here once before to sit outside and enjoy a crab benny. Really enjoyed it. Went there this morning hoping to have the same experience. Couldn't have been more disappointed. My crab Benedict terrible. First, it came cold. When the waiter came by, I told him it was cold and then he asked what I wanted. I wanted it hot, sir. I then asked if it was intended to be served cold, which is when he took my plate to the back. It came out hot (thank god) with eggs that were actually runny like I had originally requested (but didn't get the first time). Unfortunately, it went downhill again. Three shells in my Benedict. For a $30 benedict, I couldn't be more disappointed. I was actually quite grossed out. Literally sat there fishing through my food looking for more shells before I eventually gave up. I could forgive one or two shells, but three?

I should have said something, but at that point I was just ready to get the heck out of there.
author: Christie C.

description: The California omelette was great, but the pancakes were just ok.  Service was phenomenal.  Only complaint is that there is only one customer bathroom and it constantly had 5+ people waiting in line.
author: Chris C.

description:
This place is nothing to write home to mom about but it isn't horrible. We were seated right away on a Saturday afternoon and chose to sit outside. It wasn't cold so it was nice. Our seats overlooked the ferry boats and we could catch a glimpse of the sea lions in the distance.

It did take some time for our order to be taken but it was busy and we weren't in a rush. The server was sweet and did her job well.

We got 2 beers a fried calamari order and half lb of spicy shrimp and a dozen oysters it all came to $73 with the 10% Yelp coupon sucks that they don't take 10% off drinks and sides but whatever still under $80 for 2 with drinks and food so we were happy. 

Food came out quite fast. And all tasted good. Nothing special but nothing bad. The calamari was fried to perfection the oysters were fresh. 

The spicy shrimp was however EXTREMELY spicy lol she asked if I liked spicy food cus it had a little kick to it, more like a punch in the face then a kick lol. It was so spicy I didn't even want to dip the bread in the sauce. The shrimp were good though, I'll get the garlic next time.

The only thing I did not like was the coleslaw it was the vinegar kind of coleslaw that is sweet and vinegary I'm more of a mayo coleslaw person and since this one didn't have mayo it just wasn't for me some people might like it but not my thing however the side was only $2.50 so it's not that big of a deal.

Will we return ? Perhaps but I'd like to try the other spots around here first. Nothing special here makes me want to come back unless it's for happy hour.
author: China D.

description:
Eagle Cafe was like an oasis for the starving tourist searching for a place to park their feet and eat some food and drink some crazy huge Bloody Mary's. It also happens to be a perfect entry diner to Pier 39. It's practically perfect!

The view was amazing from all sides. It was the perfect pier restaurant with fresh foods and delicious seafood. Definitely loved everything about this small place.
author: Fawn G.

description: Out of all the restaurants on the pier, we somehow ended up here. We were seated immediately and they took our order after giving us some time to look at the menu. We ordered the Chipotle chicken sandwich with fries, chocolate milkshake and clam chowder in the breadbowl. Everything was SO bland and underwhelming. I was so disappointed in everything but MOSTLY the clam chowder. I expect every restaurant in SF at the pier to have at least decent clam chowder even if it's not the best. But honestly...I don't cook often but my clam chowder I make at home is better than this. The entire meal was a waste of calories and money (and like every other restaurant on the pier, this place is extremely overpriced...our entire meal came out to ~$45). The customer service was average. I am not writing this to bash this restaurant (although it does sound like it...), I just think the menu and cooking needs to be revamped ASAP (unless this was an extremely off-day for them). Would not recommend at all.
author: Charlene P.

description:
Good food, nice outdoor deck with awesome view. Food is overpriced but you are on fisherman's wharf so to be expected. 

Seafood salad, fried clam strips and fish and chips all very good.
author: Kirstin B.

description: Spent a touristy day-trip in SF, and after walking up and down the Pier 39 rows of stores, decided upon Eagle Cafe (ALMOST went to Bubba Gump's though). Seated promptly at a small table for 2, and shared a starter of fried calamari. The portion was generously heaped, a good mix of rings and legs, although the batter didn't adhere to the squid so well. Two dipping sauces, just in plastic cups. We also split a dozen raw oysters on the half-shell, with lemon, grated horseradish, and the red sauce (cocktail?). Yelp check-in discount as well. Pretty good meal, although next time if I want oysters I will most definitely stop into Hog Island Oyster Co. for more variety of offerings.
author: Michelle L.

description: A great place to stop for brunch. Had the Salmon Benedict and was blown away by the flavor. Service was great as well as the environment.
author: Jace W.

description: Service was horrible. It took them 15 minutes to take our order. Ice tea tasted like water, I had to exchange for coffee. Clam chowder doesn't have any flavor so do their oysters. Very unsatisfied meal overall. Server wouldn't even honor my yelp check in discount because I had exchanged my tasteless ice tea water to coffee which she charged me for the tea anyway. She didn't even care to explain to me why she couldn't honor the discount till I asked. It was a most unsatisfied and irritating meal I ever had.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
Service is so friendly and welcoming. Have been back for the banana pancakes a few times now. Had a nice window table (get there early if you want a window table and no wait). 

Sever admits that the restaurant is more touristy than other places, but you are sitting on Pier 39 and can see Alcatraz from your table. Priced accordingly to the location, but food is actually really really good.

Hubby enjoyed the crab omelette, and side of bacon was delish and enough for us to share!
author: Elena M.

description:
Went in for the happy hour. Happy hour is only available at the bar so I didn't get a great view of the bay, but I had a friendly bartender
The Bloody Mary was good and is worth trying. Cost about $9.50.
I also bought some happy hour oysters for $1.50 each. Tasted fresh and yummy! Some were really small and some were regular sized, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Kat C.

description: I come here just for the Bloody Mary. Spicy, loaded with vegetables and peppers and served ice cold. The service is about what you expect for a place in Fisherman's Wharf but the view of Alcatraz, sea lions and the ocean from the patio makes up for it. The food is very good too and the portions are very large, you can easily split a meal here. My favorite is the grilled seafood salad. The seafood is cooked perfectly and is light and not at all oily. But go for the Bloody Mary, you won't be sorry!
author: Dave L.

description:
The oysters were itty bitty and the bartender wasn't very friendly. 

We simply went in to give the oysters a try and grab a cocktail. I'm from San Antonio so I guess I shouldn't known a margarita a touristy San Francisco restaurant wasn't going to be what I was used to. The margarita was super sour and just didn't fast right and the oysters were a lot smaller than expected. It didn't help that the bartender seemed annoyed that we sat at the bar too. I'd pass on this one folks.
author: Mo M.

description: Nice place but wasn't happy with the sizes of the oysters,very tiny. Our server was very nice so we made sure to leave good tip.
author: Lupe'aka S.

description:
No waiting for our table, staff was extremely accommodating, very friendly ( not in a fake way) and our food was sooooooo amazing!!!! 
We didn't even talk to each other for about 10 minutes! We were enjoying our dishes and realized that this was the best breakfast we've had in a LONG time... Can't wait to go back!!
author: Brianna C.

description:
The bartender, Marcos was super nice and helpful ..the margaritas were amazing 
So was our entree and the clam chowder. I definitely recommend this restaurant!!
author: Lizet C.

description: Went here real quick for a drink and some oysters while waiting for our table at Fog Harbor next door.
