Our bartender, Marco, was really attentive and provided all-around awesome service (as well as the other bar guy). Would love to come back here to try the other stuff. Also, their frozen cocktails are soooo good! We got the banana and mudslide one! The cocktails were about $10 each and the oysters were $16 for half a dozen.
author: Jelyn H.

description: I got food poisoning from the oysters here a couple weeks back. When my husband went back to complain to the husband, he was told the owner was not available. He returned again at a time when the owner was scheduled to be in and the oyster bar was gone completely- as if was never there. Every call has gone unanswered.
author: Jane H.

description:
My hunny and I celebrated our July 4th with a big ole Bloody Mary w/ a !#$% load of crab! Their Bloody Mary mix is one of the best, but they tend to add a lot of vodka so it's pretty strong. Recommend that you share this deliciousness with someone. I also ordered a mango mimosa, because why not? 

For a Holiday, it wasn't packed as compared to the day we went on a random day. Menu is simple and offers the basic. We were feeling like hungry sharks so we ordered their special seafood platter ($120). 

Seafood platter consisted of:
- 2 dozen oysters
- 1 dozen clams
- 1 dozen big juicy cocktail shrimp
- 1 whole dungeness crab 

As we've had their oysters here before and they were pretty legit, we weren't worried about them being crappy. 

Presentation was nice and huge! They put everything except for the crab on a big ice plate. We've never had their clams or shrimp before so we were in for a treat. Clams were tasty and with a touch of chewy tenderness that gave it a great texture. I think the clams won the battle over the oysters. However, the shrimp was the champion. Like the menu described, it was really juicy. We finally finished the plate and called our server to know to bring out the crab.

By the time the crab came, we both had a huge cholesterol rush. Heads feeling woozy, but not sure if it was really all that seafood or because of the tequila shot we had after. So one big disappointment of the crab was how they completely "dish-washed" clean the inside of the crab. All that yellow-gold goodiness was gone. For us, that's one of the best parts we look forward to in a crab. Otherwise, meat was on point. Easy to crack open. 

Our staff and service was great and paired well with a nice view. Seafood recommended!
author: Fiona L.

description: We used to love this place. Today, it will be our last visit here. With the new management, the service, staff, and  food, is just not the same. The waiter put our order in wrong to begin with. We ordered a calamari appetizer and when it arrived, the waiter failed to even give us plates. I ordered a mixed seafood platter and they brought me a fish platter.  When I told them about it, they took it back and slapped on two shrimps. By the time I got my order back, shrimp was warm but fish was already cold and dried out. And how can you mess up ice tea? The tea tasted like it had been sitting out for a few days. Once we got our bill, we noticed that they charged us 18% gratuity because apparently my 6 months old infant required them to serve her so they counted her as our 5th member of our party. Pretty disappointed because we always choose to eat here every time we come to pier 39. We will no longer be coming here.
author: Kia W.

description: This is not the great, legendary, Eagle Cafe, which served good, affordable food and drinks. Gone is the great chili and chowder, replaced by an over-priced tourist trap. Too bad. Go to Scoma's.
author: Tom C.

description:
To cap off our wonderful day spent sight seeing in San Francisco, we finished at Pier 39 to settle out of the cold sea air, and into some nice warm Clam Chowder Sourdough Bread Bowls!

Of course I had to order the Fried Calamari appetizer which came with tartar sauce and some awesome, spicy and horseradish-y cocktail sauce! The calamari was AMAZING! And the bread bowls really hit the spot with big meaty clams and chunky veggies in that amazing traditional creamy white stock...heaven! 

Did I mention that when I checked in with my amazing Yelp App, I got 10% off our dinner!? Ya, it was awesome because I wasn't even expecting it!! Sometimes in my excitement to take pictures of my food and check into the restaurants to later review and post my pictures, I fail to notice the FinePrint!! But boy was I excited to find that out!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
I came here on a whim one day after doing the Bay Cruise. Usually I try to avoid eating in a heavily touristy area, but I was hungry and I loved the location of Eagle Cafe!

I came here about 2:30pm on a Friday. They were pretty busy at this time, but I got a seat right away. Anywhere you sit here you get a nice view of the pier, which is what sold me on this place to begin with! You are cramped pretty close to your neighbors here, but it was ok by me.

For food, I ordered the Clam Chowder in the Bread Bowl ($10) and a Sam Adams beer ($5) to drink. My order came out in less than five minutes (sweet!). My food tasted very good, but it may have been because I was so hungry. I did happily eat all of it and it did hit the spot. I did spend some time enjoying my drink and the view after I was done eating. I never felt pressure to leave by the server once he took my plate away, which I liked. 

Service here was fast and efficient the day I came in, which I really liked! My server also automatically gave me 10% off since he saw me check-in on Yelp (how awesome!). I like how attentive he was!

Overall, I enjoyed my meal here at Eagle Cafe. Would I come back here again? Maybe, but only if I was with others and in the touristy part of the city. 

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description: Amazing breakfast, everything fresh. Great service and nice view. Loved it. (But it's slightly expensive)
author: Inbar I.

description: I came here for my boyfriends birthday lunch a week ago, he had the garlic butter crab...not even 30 minutes after he ate it, he became violently sick, was throwing up and was bed ridden the rest of his birthday. I called the restaurant 1 hour after we had lunch there...the manager said he was going to investigate the issue and get back to me. He refused to refund me for that meal and never followed up with me. It was such a disappointing experience and I would never recommend anyone to eat here. They do not take care of their customers. I would give them 0 stars if I could.
author: MahA O.

description: Really just mediocre everything... fries are cooked with the fried fish so if your allergic to fish steer clear... waiter never asked us how the food was or anything...
author: William D.

description: Hostess was super happy and friendly. bar staff was nice.  did not put the right order in for my husband dinner. lobster bisque was watery and luke warm, had quite a bit of lobster though. No wait or line to get in compared to all other places to eat. I'd skip
author: K M.

description: I was starving when I came here for lunch. It was about 2:30pm and I just spent the whole morning hiking Angel Island. The food came surprisingly fast and I wolfed down my whole meal. It took less than five minutes for our food to come out despite the restaurant having quite a few people. We were seated outside in the balcony area, overlooking the tourists along the wharf. The balcony area seats maybe twelve people along a counter table. It is quite a nice view, but definitely windy and cold out there. Make sure you have a jacket if you plan to sit out there. I ordered the fried shrimp po boy, which came with skinny fries. The shrimp were jumbo size and delicious. I tried the shrimp by itself and it tasted a lot better than it did with the sandwich. The lettuce and tomatoes in the sandwich probably took out the flavor. I wish they put more tarter sauce on it, but overall the sandwich was still good. The fries were just okay. Service was good and staff were friendly.
author: Julia K.

description: Eagle Cafe has very poor service, and prices. The waiters kept messing up the orders, and spilling food/drinks and dropping utensils. For the food itself it is average.
author: Jacob I.

description: Have been eating breakfast here for 30 years.  This morning I had a Vegetarian omelet.  On the side was deep fried hard spaghetti who came up with that? Omelet was worst of my life, Swiss cheese slices had been added onto open face omelet and cooked under heat lights. Really disappointing.
author: Jeff F.

description:
Positives:
*Oysters
Negatives:
*The Bartender

Unfortunately, the hygiene of the bartender discouraged us from ordering any more food. He constantly rubbed his nose, wiped sweat off his face, and handled money without washing his hands.
author: Anthony G.

description: I ordered Fried Clam Strips, but the server gave me Fried Jumbo Shrimps. He got the order wrong, but I decided to give the Fried Jumbo Shrimps a try. The food didn't taste good since the shrimps had a funny taste to them. Also, the food is overpriced! The service is slow even though there were only a few people in the restaurant.
author: Sandy K.

description: We were hungry so we accepted to eat here, the one restaurant what would seat us in less than an hour. The food was ok. Just like you would like it at a diner. Fried breaded fish (the menu didn't specify it was breaded), the kids meal was ok, our soups got mixed so we got them wrong. The busque was ok. There were no desserts available. The had run it of all of them but brownies. The waiter was nice. But definitely would not recommend. Tourist trap.
author: Marisabel G.

description:
Come for the view, but don't stay for the food. Like many others, the balcony overlooking the water drew me to this place.  You would imagine that any seafood dish you order from here would be top notch, considering you could practically fish a lobster or crab right out of the water yourself from the balcony of this place.

Wrong! There wasn't a single hint of crab meat in the crab cakes I ordered (in flavor or appearance). They were the saddest mash of canned sea mystery meat and loads of cornmeal to hold that together. I couldn't even choke them down. I could probably get better sea food at a red lobster in Kansas than this sea side cafe. That's a bit of a crime!

The train wreck ensued as the servers began to lose track of who each order belonged to. We were approached at least 4 times with food we didn't order.  Eventually, the staff gave up and just began calling out orders as they walked along the balcony seating area so someone would claim their food.  It was like a sad lost and found.
author: Clara M.

description:
I usually don't take the time to write reviews for restaurants regardless of the experience, but the service at this restaurant was some of the worst I have seen in the 5 years I have lived SF Bay. 

My parents came to town to visit me and we decided to stop for food at Pier 39. The food here was decent, a bit over priced, but that's what you get for a tourist area of the city. 

The service was abysmal. The guy at the bar asked us "what do you want" continually flopped stuff down at the bar when we asked questions and became sarcastic when we asked for crackers with our oysters. Altogether the guys was just really a jerk and acted like we were asking a ton to get a beer, fish and chips. I definitely won't be back and would recommend tourist to go to Fog Harbor. Much better service over there.
author: Levi S.

description: When we came in the bartender said "oh great, you guys want oysters?", not the way I expected to be greeted. We then sat for a good 5 minutes before someone even acknowledged us to take our drink order. We were served our food super fast but with no napkins. The oysters were fresh and shucked right in front of you...delicious. The clam chowder was decent. Overall food was okay...but there definitely needs to be better customer service, two men next to us sat for a while and ended up walking out due to being ignored. Dirty looks and ignoring customers won't bring in or keep them coming.
author: Bryana W.

description: Before getting on the Alcatraz Boat we made a short stop here for some breakfast . One of the best breakfast places I have been to , huge portions for a short price ! I would recommend to anyone , couples , families etc .
author: Audrey S.

description:
Worse decision to come here! Looked on yelped quickly and thought okay we'll give it a try and boy it was a mistake! We were going to go to Fog House, which we been there before, but there was a wait and there was no wait time here; now I know why. 

Food is pricey and the quality is not good! Not just not good but bad quality in my opinion. 

Ordered the fish and chips and the batter tasted and looked strange along with the fish, it was an odd batter with low quality fish. The small portion of Cole slaw it came with was eww, it tasted old and odd. It looked like it was slapped in the small plastic container and put on my plate, not presentable at all. 

Ordered coffee plus water and the glass was dirty twice. If the dishes are dirty, I asked myself what else was dirty? 

Our server ignored us the whole time because he was also the bartender. Had to flag down another waiter who seemed disengaged in general as if she did not want to be there. Even had to get up to pay for my check. It's ridiculous!

Overall, staff seems displeased to be there and not attentive customers. I would never return not even if they offered me a complimentary meal. I felt sick shortly after leaving. Should of waited for Fog Harbor next door.
author: Love Food And Wine W.

description: Old school Pier 39 fried food, but crispy,  flaky flavorful goodness. Excellent service as well!
author: Ross G.

description: Minus the oyster bar, it was nice. Under new management very pleasant Son(Liam) and Father. The food is very tasteful,  the lobster bisque was excellent.  Fried oysters, first time having fried salmon. No complaints on the food. The owner and his son are so freaking pleasant.  It was Liam first time waiting tables and he did an AWESOME JOB.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Not sure I would come back.  I feel a bit pricey.  And the fish was a bit dry.  I had oysters on a 1/2 shell to start which was the best part of my meal.  For the main course I had the daily special prawns stuffed with crab. Eh, yup eh.  Dry and tasteless.  Bf got the seafood plate with I believe was 3 types of fish salmon, albacore and tilapia.  He enjoyed the albacore the best,  and loved the potatoes.  Is that what you love about a seafood restaurant?
 1st & 2nd star is for Sara our waitress.  Great personality and very attentive.  We really enjoyed her!  Third star is for the view.  That's all I got.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
Eagle Café was pretty good.

I was a bit leery of eating in this area as we had eaten at a few restaurants nearby that were touristy and overpriced and not very good.

Our brunch at Eagle Café was terrific. I recommend the French toast with peanut butter.
author: Steve K.

description:
Based only on food, I give this place 3 stars, but I like the location and the nice sea view from our table overlooking the pier, plus the prompt business-like service so i bumped up my rating to 4 stars. After all, it's not always entirely about the food. It's the whole experience that matters.

The food wasn't bad. The crab serving in Crab Salad Sandwich was generous, but i thought it was a little bland. The fries that came as the side was a little on the oily side. The Grilled Seafood Mixed came with 3 types of fish - Salmon, Mahi Mahi and Tilapia with 3 small prawns. I was expecting a more diverse seafood dish rather than mainly fish. The fish tasted good though, probably because they were fresh. The  Clam Chowder Bread Bowl was decent but I thought there was too much potatoes in it, clouding the overall taste. 

But we had a wonderful time hanging out, making the whole dining experience very pleasant.
author: Zuhadi Z.

description: Wife and I went for brunch. Very prompt service and food was solid. Had the mimosa and Bloody Mary and they didn't disappoint. Would go back for breakfast for sure
author: Jared L.

description:
We come here a lot when I'm in SF or a day at Pier 39.., love the crab sandwich ...my son is a club sandwich junkie there ...lol we don't even bother with the menu ...lol

Yesterday was quite interesting .., the food service and drink service was fast and the wait staff running like chickens with their heads cut off ...got my anxiety going lol

But the bathroom line 
was slow and long just go down stairs and use the public ones
 
Two taller men working there seemed to be very high strung but seemed to get the job done and everyone served and refills filled at a non stop pace ...so I guess that is a plus
author: Anita C.

description:
10% off for Yelp members! That was a pleasant surprise!

Ordered the famous fish sandwich, and it was pretty large, but not as delicious as I would have hoped. It was a little bit too dry (but they do have tartar sauce on the side), but a large portion. It was large enough to share, that's for sure. The french fries on the side were very thin, but if you get them with ranch (which is my favorite), it all tastes yummy together.

The service was great, but again, because this is a tourist spot in San Francisco, the price is PRICEY. A bowl of clam chowder was $11, and the presentation of it, was simply that - a bowl with clam chowder in it. They could have done special with the presentation of it, but alas, it was time to eat up. 

I came with a group of 4 others, and when we first arrived, the host said the wait would be about 20 minutes. No problem - not bad! Well, eventually, I started seeing even larger groups who came after us, begin to get seated! I checked up on our name on the list and turns out, our name was crossed off. He said that was a mistake and that we were next...I don't know about that. So, word to the wise - check up after 10-15 minutes on the status of the line. You don't want to be waiting longer than you absolutely have to! 

Enjoy your visit to Pier 39 and enjoy the outside music entertainment as you wait. You'll have a great time!
author: Crystal C.

description:
I just got done with the Cable Car Combo. The best part was the corned beef hash, they do a superb job, tons of meaty corned beef, touch of potato and onion, substantial, not greasy. After that and some eggs the two pieces of bacon and two large sausage links while generous were probably unnecessary. Especially considering the breakfast potatoes, toast, and fruit. While it's an expensive breakfast for $18.95, it would feed two easily. 

Even though it's located right in the heart of tourist hell I thought it was great. Service was superb. Food came out quick. Eggs were done right. And I don't mind paying a couple of extra bucks to look out over the bay!  They have a great bar too, no complaints on my Bloody Mary. Enjoy.
author: RB H.

description: View is great of the water and Alcatraz to sit outside. Nice wine list. Limited vegetarian options. Service was friendly.
author: Sneha P.

description:
Who puts Bell Pepper in ClamChowder???
Ick I am allergic to Bell Peppers and since the waiter was excited about or offered to Correct my husband's order!!!
author: Kim W.

description: This was probably the best grilled tilapia I've ever had. Service was great and so was the location. I definitely want to try their burgers next time. They looked great.
author: Bailey R.

description:
Food is GOOD !! The service is excellent, fast, clean and has good view 
We came here for breakfast before heading to Alcatraz
author: Mid W.

description: Gonna give this place two stars because my omelette wasn't bad. But after my wife found a hair in her food. My omelette was OK, Bloody Mary was OK, they had come to see if everything was going well because my wife stopped eating after a couple minutes. She found a piece of hair in her food. I really didn't want to eat after that either. We have them back the food. They still charged us for her dish. And said sorry here's 20% off. I went back and said great thanks for the 20% but I'm not paying for her food she found hair in. Mind you it's not like we ate everything and then complained. We were not even half way done. So then they took off the 20% and just changed it for her in eaten omelette... experience was blah..
author: Darian W.

description: Definitely worth stopping in for a bite. Pretty big selection of food and reasonable prices. Would recommend sitting outside since it has a great view of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge, Sea Lions, and San Fransisco Bay!
author: Adam J.

description: Incredible view if you can get a seat outside! Went for breakfast this morning and had the chef's omelette. Very good!! Definitely recommend this spot!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We looked on YELP to see what restaurant we wanted to go for lunch.  We chose to go to the Eagle Cafe. The restaurant does have good views and that is where it stopped for me! I ordered the FAMOUS fish sandwich. (signature dish)...I received my wonderful fish sandwich (Dry bread with lettuce and tomato) and it reminded me of my teenage years when I would get a frozen fish stick out of the freezer! They gave me about 1 half oz of tarter sauce. My wife and Daughter had a salmon salad we all had Arnold Palmer drinks. All  of the amazing price of $115.37 with out tip!
Skip this and go to Hillstone down the street!
author: Danard C.

description: Do yourself a favor and take your patronage right next door to Fog Harbor for excellent service and stellar cocktails! My friend and I were looking for a great spot to grab a drink on a Tuesday night and we wandered into Eagle Cafe. What a mistake. We sat at the bar looking at the bar tender who looked at us then proceeded to ignore us, and pursue some random tasks, picking up used napkins, stacking receipts at the register, conversing with a coworker, etc. It was so obvious that the older woman sitting next to me handed us her drink menu. After 5 minutes of utter disbelief, we walked out and ended up at Fog Harbor after a warm invitation from their bartender who happened to be outside on a break when we were walking by. He was on a break and still engaged us. When we walked in, the bar was bustling but we found 2 seats, we were barely seated before we got 2 refreshing glasses of water and a warm greeting. That's service! We are 2 women of color by the way, so spare yourself the micro-aggressions if you happen to be a person of color or an ally. I will never step foot into this establishment again, nor will I ever recommend it. Visited on 9/19 at 6:30pm in case that helps leadership get their staff together. You are being poorly represented, or are you?
author: Denique B.

description:
So. Freakin. Good! My friends and I didn't really have anything in mind when walking into this cafe. I remembered one of my friends wanting oysters the night before and when I saw "seafood" while walking past Pier 39 I was thinking "let's just eat here." Well weren't we in for a great treat!

We entered the glass window doors and walked across the wooden floor to the outside patio area that overlooked the north end of Fisherman's Wharf. Such a beautiful view! And to the left is the bridge from the 3rd floor of the parking structure with views into Financial District and the rest of the city. 

We ordered crab cake benedicts, an omelette, and half a dozen oysters. The crab cake benedict came with house potatoes (one of my favorites) some crisp noodle looking things, and fruit. I was really confused and don't know why I didn't ask what the noodle things were but I still ate it along with the potatoes haha. Overall it was a great meal by the water! Their mango mimosa was super yummy btw!
author: Danya P.

description: The service was ok, the sunset was beautiful! The two stars are for the clam chowder that we ordered. Very bland and barely warm.  We came for oysters but decided against them after seeing how small they were on others plates. We will try the place next door instead. Cashed out after having the soup. Beautiful view of the bay from pier 39 though.
author: Fran L.

description:
Pros:
The location
The view of the bay, Alcatraz and the seals

Cons:
The food was okay. We had a chowder bread bowl and a dozen oysters. They bread bowl wasn't any better than why you can get anywhere else. The oysters came without crackers and with grated horseradish, which wasn't very spicy. 
The service was extremely slow, even though there were very few people here. 
The drinks were not made well. 

Overall, save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Becca H.

description: Cool place at Fisherman's Wharf. I like coming earlier before the crowds appear and sitting out on their deck. Amazing view. Very good food and beer prices reasonable considering it's in a tourist area.  Also, I love the lobster bisque. It is incredible!
author: Rick R.

description: Shit place, shit food, terrible service, the manager is stupid and a really expensive place. Dont go!! The ask for a 18% mandatory tip. Dont go!
author: Gabriel M.

description: Food was amazing, service not so much. Servers were not attentive and when we did ask for something they looked at us as if we were bothering them.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Great food!  Brought a group of 14.  Everyone enjoyed it!   It was incredible service.  I had the crab melt, really good and recommended.  No my norm!  The chowder was great, fish and chips.   Burgers were a big hit too!!  And the view is very nice, sea lions just below!  The kids and adults loved it.
author: Robert B.

description:
A-OK.

One of the least looking touristy spots along Pier 39, I was glad my travel companions were okay coming here for breakfast since I really didn't want to chain it up on our 3 day trip.   Our first two brunch destinations were closed on Mondays, so we headed to the Pier to try our luck. 

The omelette wasn't bad at all, about run of the mill.  The side of fruit was nice and fresh. The strawberries were plump and ripe - not left sitting around the refrigerator for days on end.  I let my eyes wander and take in the sights of the nearby table which ordered two massive crab cakes that looked ridiculous.  From what I could overhear, I probably should have gone with that order.
author: Matt P.

description: OMG talk about the best spicy garlic shrimp that ever touched my lips... the garlic shrimp is an appetizer on the menu but I start w a clam chowder (England style) and then  the shrimp as my main entree ...me n my boo share a 1 pounder. We get extra sourdough bread bc we like to dip it in the sauce.. the only thing I don't like about the restaurant is the name. Who names a restaurant EAGLE CAFE AT PIER 39 then again probably less of a tourist trap.
author: Ariana P.

description: I love this place is great, very consistent and its the only restaurant in the pier that accept order over the phone for pick up. Since i have my boat there is really convenient. Keep it up. I really enjoy the food and the service there.
author: Sil P.

description:
Very delicious! We did not eat dinner, rather we ate breakfast. 
-We were a family of 15 and the service was good! They rearranged the tables so that we all could be together. 
-What I ordered were the blueberry pancakes, a popular dish so it must be pretty good to be popular..A disappointment. The blueberries were not fresh, they tasted like they were out of a can/frozen. They left an artificial taste on the pancakes. 
-What my family ordered were french toast with eggs and they all finished the plate. They recommend it.
-so overall, if you want blueberry pancakes, don't eat here. Everything else was delicious!
author: Kristabel M.

description: The quality of a restaurant is every bit as much about it's service as it is about its food. This was bad service. Mgmt and staff failed to address a rowdy customer who interrupted the entire restaurant and upset my table, sitting not 6 feet away. My son and his wife, who I'm in town visiting with my mother, became upset enough to leave the restaurant, even as our food was just arriving at the table. I had to address the man and his party because mgmt and staff didn't. That is horrendous service and needless to say, my family and I will not return. Unacceptable for an establishment in such a high traffic tourist area to not have an adequate plan of action to address that kind of situation. And quite sad that management did not bother to address my mother or I, despite witnessing the behavior from the other table and the discomfort caused to my party until after I paid and addressed the manager directly. "I was going to come over to talk to you" is ineffective and disrespectful after you've walked by and around my table after witnessing all of this and said nothing prior. And by the way, the least that could have been done was an offer of a discounted meal for bad experience. Perform better for future customers because it won't be any of us.
author: RN R.

description:
Taking a break from The Exploratorium, my family and I decided to walk towards Pier 39 to enjoy a meal together. We stopped by Hard Rock however, the wait was about 20 minutes so I did what every impatient person does: improvise! 

There were spots by the window, all stool seatings. We asked to be seated at an actual table. They warned us that it will be extremely cold since the door to their outdoor patio is right next to the table but we were stubborn, unfortunately and demanded to be seated there. 

My dad and sister got the burger, my daughter the pasta dish from the kid's menu and a vanilla milkshake, and I got a BLT. Hell, I had a BLT the previous night, I recall. 

The orders took quite some time to get to the table. My only gripe was that the dishes that came out were all staggered; the burgers came first then about 10 minutes later, the pasta, then the BLT after what appeared to be a decade. 

My BLT was delicious. The bread was toasted just right, the lettuce were fresh and cool, the bacon was semi crunchy, and the tomatoes made the sandwich the right texture: soft and crunchy. The side salad I opted for instead of the fries were great as well. 

No complaints about the burgers and the kid's pasta was subpar. The vanilla shake was creamy and rich... I would never have allowed the shake to be ordered since the entrees were all pretty hefty... 

Prices are average for a tourists' spot. Staff moves at a quick ass pace so don't expect them to be personable w/ you. If you need the check or to-go box, ask for it once because it will be days before you get checked on again.  And don't sit by the door!
author: Tram N.

description:
It was our last day in San Francisco and we decided to head down to the Fisherman's Wharf area  to find a breakfast spot before the flight back home. We were highly indecisive as to where we wanted to eat, but, out of desparation, we finally settled on the Eagle Cafe at Pier 39.

We arrived late morning and found that it wasn't that busy. We were promptly seated, provided coffee, and given menus to peruse. The first thing that struck me about the menu was that the prices were shockingly  high. This was the first opportunity I had to have breakfast in San Francisco, so I'm not sure if that's the standard in the city, or if it's just because we were likely in a tourist zone. Needless to say, I was surprised, to say the least.

I opted for scrambled eggs, hash and potatoes. My travel companion selected pancakes that came with eggs, sausage and potatoes. Both of our breakfasts came with unconventional, large hamburger buns that functioned as toast. That was certainly a new one for me. Maybe they ran out of regular bread slices and, instead, decided to get rid of the extra hamburger buns they had on hand? I have no idea, and it didn't really matter to me. There was nothing wrong with my breakfast. It tasted good. It fulfilled its purpose. I don't think it was worth the price I paid for it, though. 

The coffee was good, nice and strong. Loved it. 

While everything was decent, I couldn't help but feel we could have done better. Not being a local, I suspect we fell victim to our ignorance as tourists. Next time, I'll be sure to be thorough in researching SF breakfast destinations.
author: Gary R.

description:
Sad to give them only  especially when I was here last week and it was great! I guess busy times is when u truly can rate a restaurant. 

Food was 5 stars - we had crab and shrimp cocktail and the girls had the chowder! Delicious!! 

Wait time was ok, great for being a busy night and the hostess staff ON POINT!!!! 

Our waitress Sarah was great 

3 stars because of the bad experience with the buser. Really rude - cleaned off our table when we were not done and instead of apologizing made a rude snippy comment- when we asked for his name he refused to give it, instead called management over and even management asked us who we were talking about. Definitely bad communication. The buser then talked about it with other customers sitting around us. Poor customer service not to mention the lack of professionalism. 

Pretty sad that one person can ruin the review and experience.. 

Nothing done by management therefore they get
author: Lisa E.

description: Absolutely Horrible! Even for tourist trap standards this place is simply bad. Super rude service, expensive bland cocktails.. & they should really have a place for the staff to eat other than standing right behind customers at the bar slurping noodles. Ridiculous.
author: Mario V.

description:
This is one of those places you'd expect to be a tourist trap with shitty frozen seafood and chowder out of a can, being literally attached to Pier 39...the ultimate tourist hell hole. 

It is so NOT that! 

We hit this place every time we're in the neighborhood and their seafood is consistently the very freshest, moistest and most flavorful. Their oysters on the half shell are crisp, briny, and delicious with fresh shaved horseradish, the clam chowder is bangin'. The bloody Marys are spicy and rich. 

GOOD SHIT.
author: Adam S.

description: Food was great - super good portion size, especially compared to other places around here - and it was super tasty! Service was quick, and respectful/positive! Highly recommended!
author: Victoria S.

description: Really terrible service. I think they are under staffed bc the waiters are always running around frantically. Came for lunch on Fri at 3pm and got sat down quickly but didn't get water or a waiter for ten min. Food was overall Delicious but not worth it due to service.
author: Amy L.

description:
This is the best and worst of breakfast food, and even though I rated it a two star, I would recommend it with one caveat: order anything but the stuffed french toast.  If you haven't figured it out, I had the stuff french toast, and it was awful.  It was the worst stuff french toast I ever had.  It was like someone figured out how to flavor french toast with burnt plastic.  I ate one of the three pieces, and couldn't take in the other three.  Luckily I ordered a side of eggs to help dull my appetite.  The eggs are more like an egg, so that was also disappointing.  

Other people in my group ordered the Polish sausage and corn beef hash.  Both were amazing, and would have me coming back for more from the few pieces I tried.  The sausage is spicey though, so if that's not your think, then you should get the corn beef hash.  The corn beef hash was the best I have ever had.  

The service was excellent until my plate was cleared.  It would have been nice if the server recognized that I ate very little of the stuff french tosst.  

The dining room has a great feeling and ambiance, kind of like your grandmother's kitchen if she were a one legged sea pirate.  

If given the opportunity, I will be coming back here for round two.
author: Scott L.

description: This place is a must!! The clam chowder n oysters r amazing here!! The service is great too. Oh n also try the fried fisherman's platter and the cold crab. So delish!!! Great view while u eat too. Love this spot!
author: Jose E.

description: We came here because the other restaurants were over an hour wait and we got seated in less than 15 min. All I wanted was a good bread bowl filled with clam chowder and that is exactly what I got. The inside had great decor. The only reason why I did not put 5 stars is because we got seated in an area where the servers were coming in and out and I was afraid I was going to get something spilled on me. Nonetheless, the food is great for Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Kelly D.

description: Pretty expensive menu. I had a house salad and the lobster bisque soup. My friend had a clam chowder. They weren't very filling but they did the job without having to pay 30+ on a pretty mediocre meal.
author: Rose Y.

description: A perfect place to breakfast,  I'm hardly recomendamos this place, my wife and I came to celebrate her birthday early morning, we love this place, courtesy attention and fast response to serve our food.
author: Sandro M.

description:
This was our first trip to SF, and we stayed near Fisherman's Wharf. We knew going in that the area was a tourist trap, but the views of the bay are great, and it's a convenient jumping-off point for the other attractions in town. Still after travelling all night to get there, we didn't feel like venturing too far for dinner, so we looked for some seafood on the wharf. One place with good Yelp ratings we found had a 45 minute wait and no room at the bar. Next door was this place, less highly rated and only a few minutes wait, so we opted for this. That must happen a lot.

We had a couple of things we liked, and a couple of WTF moments that added up to a two-star experience. The space is quite nice and the views are wonderful. We were seated next to the door leading to the balcony outside, so we were subjected to lots of foot traffic around us. That wasn't a problem though. 

Our food was hit and miss. DLW had a nice side salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl. Sourdough bread is one of her favorite things in life, and the bread bowl was her favorite part of the dish. The chowder was decent, but the potatoes were unevenly cooked, with some soft and some still crunchy. My grilled shrimp and mashed potatoes were cooked well and well seasoned. Some might think the pepper was too strong, but I love pepper so I was fine. They served fried spaghetti strands with our entrees, a strange idea but one we actually liked.

Then DLW needed to use the lav. Not only is there a single unisex bathroom for the whole 100 seat restaurant, the toilet had apparently malfunctioned and wouldn't flush, not surprising seeing how heavily it must be used. No one on the staff seemed very concerned about it either, like it happens all the time. If a health inspector ever showed up at an inopportune moment, it could be a disaster.  

We knew we were in for a touristy experience when we walked in the door. We got that and a little more.
author: Mark A.

description:
For being at the Fisherman's Wharf, the brunch here is pretty good.  A little fancy, and a little pricey, but great dishes!

I ordered two eggs with sausage and it came with a loaf of bread bigger than my fist.  They even stuck a branch of rosemary or some kinda herb right in the middle of my bread.  The dish also came with fresh fruit, and some kinda dry noodles.  Kinda strange.

Anyway, after I discarded the noodles and rosemary, I went to work on my breakfast.  I liked that the potatoes were pretty well seasoned, and it came with onions, and bell pepper to flavor it more.  The eggs were decent, and the sausages were okay. 

I'd come back here for breakfast.
author: Emily S.

description:
$10 oyster shot (get the vodka) - try it one time in your life. Make sure somebody is videoing you. Either you will be a pro and swallow that oyster whole, or you will cough it up and create a funny viral video.

When entering Pier 39, this is the first store on the left on the 2nd level.

Never busy so you will get served fast.
author: Realtor Karl B.

description:
Cute little place! The host tried to seat me and my boyfriend at this small two top near the door when there were other tables available in the main dining area. It just didn't make sense. Why put someone at a tiny little table right near the entrance.

My boyfriend had shrimp omelette and be really liked it! I had the corn beef hash. The texture was amazing but it was way too salty. After the server took our order he didn't come back to refill our drinks, follow up to see how everything was tasting, and didn't see if we needed anything.
author: Vivian R.

description: Very pour service. Don't sit at the bar!! Bartenders are horribly slow and don't speak much English. Had to repeat order several times and they still got it wrong. Long wait fir food actually had to leave and has to cancel part of our order. I hardly post unless it is really bad and this was very bad.
author: James O.

description: Just okay.. So after walking around the entire fisherman's wharf and pier 39, I worked up quite an appetite! My friend suggested that we eat her because upon parking in the selected parking garage we did they have you an hour free if you are at one of the pier 39 restaurants. Once we were seated I looked at the menu and honestly nothing really stuck out to me but I did see a couple of the other customers ordering the famous clam chowder bowls and it did look pretty good! For $10 I thought why not! My friend ordered the fish and chips and boy was he underwhelmed! Haha I told him that I had a weird feeling about this place but he didn't listen anyways needless to say he sent the order back and got the clam chowder bowl like me :-) not sure if I'd ever return to this particular restaurant or not but I will say that the clam chowder was amazing!
author: Alexander M.

description:
Good service and good food.

3 stars because nothing really stuck out to me. I know pier 39 is a tourist trap but when I came here with my group of friends we were just trying to find a quick place to eat. Eagle Cafe was where we ended up. The hostess said it would be a 20min wait (it was Memorial Day) for brunch. She suggested to sit at the bar if we didn't want to wait, so we did. Our bartender was nice but it was just busy so I understand why he couldn't accommodate our needs at once. I just kept asking to get a refill from various staff member. I didn't think that was suitable customer service for the prices they're charging.
author: Luisa P.

description: Since we're on vacation right now, I'll keep my reviews short.  Everything at Eagle Cafe was A-OK.  This includes both their food and service.  We were able to order some items from their breakfast menu and a few things from the lunch menu, since we arrived at a time where they were just about to switch from breakfast to lunch.  We ordered a spicy polish sausage breakfast plate that also came with eggs, potato, toast and a few bites of fruits.  We also got an omelet that contained ham, bacon, onion, cheese.  That too came with potato, toast, and fruits.  On the lunch menu, we ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl and butter garlic clams.  Everything turned out to be decent.  Nothing extravagant, but A-OK.  I would consider this place to be acceptable if I had to visit again.
author: Steven L.

description: Food was pretty decent for touristy area. Bit over priced as you can imagine. Service was pretty bad. Spent 15 min trying to pay, 5 different servers so had no idea who to call.
author: Allen W.

description: The food was good here except they told me they didn't have oysters on the half shell.  I came here specifically for oyster and their sign outside said Oyster Bar.  I ended up staying because the wait was long everywhere else.  Like I said before, the food was good but they didn't have what they are known for.  The service was just ok.  It took them a while to take out order and our drinks were only refilled once because I asked.  Not sure if I would come back again.  I ended up going to the Pier Market Crab Stand to get oysters afterwards.
author: Juan Carlos H.

description:
Meh.  We had a hankering for cocktails and oysters and when we asked the receptionist outside what kind of oysters they had, she opened the menu and said, "oysters on the half shell."  Um, yes.  We know that.

Despite this unimpressive start we went inside and sat by the window.  Our dozen oysters were just okay.  Pretty plump but nothing to write home about.  Their clam chowder was just so-so.  Service was good but the place was empty so they don't get much credit for that.

On the way out we passed by Wipeout Bar & Grill next door.  It had much nicer decor and more waterfront view.  Their dozen oysters were just a dollar more.   Made us wish we had gone there instead.
author: Dave L.

description: My husband and I had an amazing experience. Really great food, we shared the fisherman's platter and clam chowder breadbowl. Very good and fast service!
author: Valerie Z.

description: Can't even rate this place because the snob at the door wouldn't let us walk in to the bar. She literally blocked the door and said the bar is pretty full.  I guess they don't need my business.
author: Jayme L.

description: The spicy shrimp appetizer was good, however the lobster bisque and clam chowder were subpar.  Customer service was blah and food was blah and at the price I was expecting more.  Much better food down the boardwalk a bit at the fishermans restaurant.
author: Brenda W.

description:
My final breakfast in San Francisco and it was amazing. 
We walked in and sat on the patio. 
Great service and even better food.
Corn beef hash was better than moms! And my my girlfriend had the crab cake benedict. My biggest suggestion is to share unless you are hungry because the portions are HUGE!
author: Jd L.

description: Awesome clam chowder in bread bowls and their spicy jumbo shrimp is intense! Loved sitting on the patio viewing the bridge and Alcatraz while drinking a beer!
author: Kristy R.

description: This restaurant was a bit pricey but the food was wonderful, the crab Benedict was delicious and the eggs were cooked perfectly. The view is beautiful and the service was great as well. It was definitely higher priced due to being in a beautiful and touristy location but the food was great.
author: Emily B.

description:
It was a drizzly day when my three partners in crime and I decided to do a little Fisherman's Wharf wandering.

And, then the drizzle became rain.

No matter--we continued to meander unfazed by a little precipitation--I mean...I'm a Northern California native--what's a little rain, right?

And, THEEEN, it began to rain in an earnestness we don't ever enjoy here in the dry, high desert clime of Boise, Idaho.

And, so...we unanimously decided to duck into a restaurant for some breakfast and to wait out the rain.  Which is how, on a rainy Sunday morning, I found myself at the Eagle Cafe.

The atmosphere was immediately pleasing with wood floors, crisp white tablecloths, and large windows overlooking the bay.  Plus, upon entering I smelled the heady aroma of cafe coffee.  I had yet to caffeinate that morning so the scent was a most welcome one.  

They were quite busy (it being a Sunday morning and all) but were able to seat us immediately (perhaps with the rain, it wasn't AS busy as their usual Sunday mornings--since I've heard there can be a bit of a wait).  After begging umbrella bags and steaming hot cups o' joe from our significantly-less-soggy-than-us-server, we ordered.  I got the California omelet (when in Rome, right?), which came with their breakfast potatoes (what I would call home fried potatoes), fresh fruit (in this case a wedge of orange and honeydew), and bread (I opted for the sourdough...because...c'mon...it's San Francisco, my people!).  It was all delicious.  My only complaint was that the melted swiss on the top of the omelet seemed to be some sort of processed cheese.  Other than that, though--comfort food breakfast declisiousness.  I also was able to try their homemade corned beef hash (off one of my dining companions plates!), which was spot on what homemade hash should be.  I should also note that our server was wonderful (friendly, prompt, and efficient--what more can one ask for, really?).  

After luxuriating over our meals and 3 slow cups of coffee, we decided that the rain was simply not going to let up anytime soon...that's ok, fully satiated, we were feeling more in the mood for a leisurely drive than a walk about at that point anyway! 

Well done!
author: Ophelia M.

description: Overpriced for mediocre food. One restroom for a busy restaurant, the most People wAiting was 12 people. Disappointed in the food. Would not recommend.
author: John S.

description: Food here was really good. Service was quick and the staff was friendly and accommodating even if busy.
author: J E.

description: I have very low standards for my alcohol, and this place easily had the worst Bloody Mary I've ever had, at one of the worst prices I've paid. Tourist trap with gross bathrooms. Wait, make that a singular bathroom. As in one toilet for a restaurant that seats 75+ people.
author: Mike W.

description:
Ok, so the place looks good and the beer was super cold. The clam chowder in the bowl was really good and I had to order another cup and pour it in the bread bowl.

If you want a different taste try what I did. I ordered the garlic fries, using real garlic cloves, and put some in the clam chowder. 

My wife got the club sandwich and strawberry shake. Both were excellent. 

The only thing I did not like is the menu says that San Francisco mandated the 5.5% surcharge...that is BS! SF does that to the employer but does NOT MANDATE THAT THE CONSUMER PAYS IT!  So they loose a star for that.
author: Julian K.

description:
I have been to a lot of tourist traps - this one beats them all in terms of "meh-ness" of food. It's really bland. I tried crab cakes, and had a crab sandwich. There is a reason why it is half empty on a Sunday night.
The service was good, though.
author: Natalie I.

description:
The Hubby and I came here on my first visit to San Francisco and the bartender/waiter Ivan was great! He was very accommodating and friendly. He not only filled up our glasses of wine when needed, but was very knowledgeable of the area and helpful to me as a first time visitor in learning more about this wonderful place! 

Overall, Ivan was amazing and I would definitely recommend this place based on the service he provided!
author: Denise G.

description:
This place was fantastic! After a bad restaurant experience nearby, we decided to try this place out and it was wonderful. Good food, great service, and an awesome Bloody Mary. 

Will definitely be back!
author: Jannelle D.

description:
How is it possible that I have never reviewed the Eagle Cafe?  I've been a fan for years--since I first visited San Francisco in 1985 and had my first Potatoes O'Brien...I can still smell it...

I have been back many times since then.  Love the interior of the place--it screams old and rustic.  You can eat inside or outside, with a great view. I have eaten both breakfast and lunch here, never dinner.  Prices are reasonable, especially for the highly overpriced Fisherman's Wharf.  

On the latest visit I had the California Burger with avocado and Swiss cheese.  My son had the bacon burger and my hubby had chowder.  Both burgers were tasty and came with fries (not quite shoestring, but almost).  Hubby thought the chowder was pretty good.  It was different, not as creamy as we are used to.  They also had chocolate shakes, which got rave reviews.

Prices--$13-14 per burger.  HUGE bowl of chowder around $11.  Shakes were $6, but they filled the glass, plus the metal container it was made in.

The service was friendly, if a tad slow.  They were very busy.  

The Eagle is a trusty stand-by if you don't want to drop $100+ for lunch at the wharf.  We will continue to go back.
author: Deb P.

description:
I have a benediction to eggcellent food - #noodosisters on IG

The plan was to explore the pier and then go eat somewhere but when we arrived we were starving. I usually check yelp before I decide where to eat but we were so hungry I didn't even bother. I probably wouldn't have eaten here if I saw the 3/3.5 stars only because when I'm in the city I want to eat at the BEST places possible. Anyways, I'm so happy we ate here and honestly don't understand the low ratings. Maybe the other reviewers tried the wrong dishes? Well, we struck gold with our dishes because it was bomb(dot)com. 

Dungeness Crab Egg Benedict (4.5/5 stars)
My favorite breakfast/brunch dish of all time is eggs benedict and it is always my go to when I go out for brunch. The dungeness crab egg benedict was so good! The crab mixed so well with the tomatoes and the spinach they included in the dish and it didn't taste fishy like other places I've tried. I'm not sure if they seasoned the crab at all but it was very flavorful. You might think that it's a bit salty if you eat the crab alone but when you combine it with the tomatoes, spinach, and muffin, it's perfect. The plate comes with potatoes and those were good, I've had better but  they were well seasoned. Maybe if the outsides were crispy?! 

Steak and Eggs (4/4.5 stars)
When I think of steak and eggs I think of Vegas. When you go to Vegas the steak is usually this super thin piece of meat that's cooked well-done but for the price of $3.99 you can't complain. Here, they give you a real piece of steak and they cooked it perfectly medium-rare. I was impressed. It was almost like eating dinner for breakfast. Not complaining. 

We went Saturday morning and it was surprisingly... not super busy. They sat us down right when we arrived. I thought the service was great but maybe it's because it wasn't busy. The price ranges but it's not too bad. I was debating whether to get the dungeness crab egg benedict or the regular because of the difference in price but the crab was so worth it.
author: Shirley Q.

description:
Nice spot with a great ocean view and the food was just fine. 
I am a big fan of clam chowder and it was just right, my Mom had a lobster soup and it was delish!
We had grilled fish and some hamburger with salad and for my taste the dressing for the salad was way too sweet. 
Other than that, nice spot for a brunch or lunch.
author: Kate R.

description:
Just what the doctor ordered.  Dropped in before our boat to our for a quick bite and some drinks.  

Staff was quick and friendly, drinks came quickly and the food was good.  We got claim chowder to start.  I typically like mine fairly thick so when it came out runny I was concerned at first.  No need, it was delicious and the sourdough that came with it was excellent.  My girl and I decided to share like always.  I got the fried shrimp poboy and she got fish and chips.  The poboy... wow.  Great choice.  Shrimp was done to perfection and they have some of the best tartar sauce I can remember.  Fish was crisp and golden, all around a tasty meal.
author: Dustin E.

description: The food was good, the view excellent and the server was nice.  I had to wait 20 minutes in line for the restroom during my meal.  Very unpleasant.  They have a one stall restroom for over 100 people.  There were 5 or more people in line all of the time.  I asked if they could open the employee restroom and they said no.  This is why cities have to create codes; restaurant owners don't meet the needs of their guests.  We won't be going back.
author: Nancy M.

description: The food was delicious! Everyone's food looked good!  When you add your name to the list, stick around because it you leave the area and get called, you loose your spot. No pager system here. Our waiter was friendly but forgetful.  scenery. But I'm sure that's just him.  Great views where you can sit out on the deck and enjoy the scenery. I'll come back!
author: Larken A.

description:
Good Food.... Amazing location. Prices are fair. Spent $55 for a party of 3

Deducted two star because service was not the greatest and for getting food lukewarm.
author: Maritza M.

description: There clam chowder is one of the best in the area, if you are a fan of pepper. The service is great and the view outside is incredible. Check in and get 10% off ! Definitely a go to spot. Will come back again.
author: Lani F.

description:
I've only had their lobster bisque and clam chowder bread bowls, but I love this place.

I had regular business to take care of in the city on the weeks for about 2 months and I wanted a quick spot to dive in for a bread bowl and dive out. This became my regular spot because you can't beat great quality and flavor for that price. I also loved seeing the sunset there. 

The prices are reasonable, the service is great, the wait is minimal, and the views are epic.

If you hit the pier on the weekend cut the lines and save cash in your pocket and go here.
author: Christine A.

description: decided to give it a try after we got back from Alcatraz. Forgot to take pics. We were just ready to eat. E got the shrimp po boy and I got the burger. Food was super yum and service was fast and friendly.
author: Lynette C.

description:
I never bothered to eat here for Lunch of Dinner , 

But Breakfast , OH YEA ,  
Its a great hidden gem in San Francisco for a nice quality morning Breakfast , with my favorites being the Corned Beef Hash & Eggs ,  Corned Beef Scramble, or one of their Benedicts ,  

another great option  ,, hitting the Oyster Bar for some Eats and Drink before watching the Sunday Games ,
author: Joseph A.

description: Really enjoyed stopping here for dinner after Alcatraz. Great views, lovely wait staff and delicious food. Highly recommend the Salmon Angel hair pasta.
author: Karen G.

description: needed to get breakfast prior to Alcatraz tour got them right at 11:00 after walking in rain.  but was told breakfast ended.  Ordered a hamburger, fries, and 2 soups in bread bowls, lobster bisque and clam chowder.  both soups were good, but in bread bowls I think it's too much bread, Cesar salad was good crispy and decent.  service was good too.
author: Wendy M.

description:
The first place we ate at when we arrived here in San Francisco and I feel 100% confident saying this-I so loved it here!

The overview of the bay area as well as Alcatraz island makes this place well worth eating. Our waiter, Ronald, was very attentive with us. He brought us water to start off with. My girlfriend ordered their BLT and I ordered their Alaskan Fish Cod sandwich. The fish sandwich comes with either a side of salad or French fries, your choice. 

You can see the SF skyline as well as the Golden Gate bridge from afar. Pier 39 here has so much to offer and see. By the way, the food came out very nice with a very reasonable price. It came out a total of $32 for all that. Not bad I must say. A must to try and a very high recommendation from me. Ronald, you the man!!
author: Julian A.

description:
Terrible service waitress inside was rude as heck.
Hostess was nice food was below average. The coffee was served cold the restaurant was freezing and the environment was overall hostile. The best part about my experience there was leaving.
author: Victor L.

description: Really good food for a tourist heavy area.  We were told by a local that if we were eating at Pier 39 then this was the place to go.  Pretty pricey but not horrible. Had oysters on the half shell.  Loved the fresh grated horseradish. They need to start stocking saltines though. Asked for crackers and they gave us some sort of butter cracker, little strange but it worked alright. Our party of three also had the claim chowder bowl which was great as well as the lobster bisque. Lobster bisque was rich with just right amount of fish taste. Shrimp scampi was way to heavy on the garlic but was good until garlic over powered it and we couldn't eat anymore. Service was a little slow.
author: Jan A.

description: This restaurant is really small, while we were eating dinner I kept getting bump by the staff, it's hard to relax, to crowded with tables n chairs.  The food was ok, a bit over priced for the quality of the food.  In addition I had an entire Glass of water poured over me 2 minutes after arriving there.  It was hard to enjoy dinner, too much activity by the staff and not attention to detail or assuring u have a good experience.  Will not return.
author: CLAUDIA I.

description:
I live in Sacramento (about 90 minutes away) and I drive into the city JUST TO EAT HERE at least once a month, IT'S THAT GOOD! 

I recommend this restaurant to everyone that visits San Francisco and tell them it's A MUST DO while here, I have yet to have any complaints on my referral to Eagle Cafe and I always love hearing the rave reviews afterwards! 

I can personally and highly recommend the following:
*Spicy Garlic Shrimp
*Hot Crab Melt
*Bloody Mary's 

Service has always been great and food is consistently on point! I've met the owner as she walks the floor checking on everything. She is pleasant and approachable with her customers which is so important to loyal clientele. :) 

The only "CON" to this establishment is that there is only ONE unisex bathroom for the entire restaurant, which you sometimes have to wait up to 15-20 minutes during their peak times and stand in line which can be a pain if you're visiting with guests, you will be MIA for a while. I will not ding the rating because their delicious food always compensates.
author: Yelp R.

description:
I normally try to steer clear away from restaurants near Fisherman's Wharf for 2 reasons: they're expensive and they're tourist traps. Since we were on a time crunch and didn't want to wait for Bubba Gump's, my friend suggested Eagle Cafe and since there was no wait, we thought it was a good choice. The yelper inside of me slightly rolled my eyes at the sight of a 3 star rating and the somewhat stuck up customers, but the service was outstanding and our waitress was such a sweetheart! The menu did not have much variety, which was rather disappointing, but I somehow ended up ordering a Hot Crab Melt on the Appetizer portion of the menu and a cup of clam chowder.

Hot Crab Melt - According to the waitress, the Hot Crab Melt is basically their crab cocktail salad over bread with melted cheese on top. You NEED to get this whether it be an appetizer or an acting entree because it is seriously the BEST crab melt I've ever had! The crab was fresh, succulent, and juicy and the melted cheese was divine! It is definitely enough to share between 2 people and for the price, it cannot be beat!

Clam Chowder - Honestly Eagle Cafe's clam chowder is just so disappointing and didn't even taste like clam chowder! First off, it was all veggies and barely any clam and second, the broth was so thin! I like my clam chowder thick and creamy and Eagle Cafe's clam chowder was pretty embarrassing.

My total pre-tax and tip was under $25 which isn't too bad! My friend hated one of their pasta dishes, though, so I could see why Eagle Cafe is rated 3 stars. Other than that, I would definitely come back! Don't forget to validate your parking :)
author: Joyce E.

description:
A cafe at the opening of one of the country's most visited tourist attractions wasn't a place I expected to find great food, so we were delightfully surprised to find that each plate we ordered was better than the one before. 

Efficient service, clean linen-covered tables, and a family friendly menu.
author: Stacy H.

description: Eagle café is a landmark Waterfront Cafe & Bar since 1928, easily spotted at the front of Pier 39. It has a wonderful view of the bay and even offers outdoor seating if you prefer. The décor is appropriate with many ship, bridge, and bay themed items to give you the feel and history of where you are. With a well sized lunch menu there were many considerations.  We ultimately went with a double stacked BLT and an acclaimed Clam Chowder in a bread bowl. The BLT, while simple, was well arranged and portioned, and the double stack style really gives you the hefty bite you're looking for at lunch. The Clam Chowder was worth the talk, creamy and well balanced without being too fishy, while still having plenty of tasty fresh clams. I also enjoyed the bread bowl with the flavor soaked in towards the end of the meal. With many eatery options on the Pier, don't discount Eagle Café just because it is one of the first ones you see!
author: Cheri D.

description:
I had a dinner here because the restaurant next to this one had a too long wait time.

What I liked about here is that there were not so many people. The food was just okay, and for me, overpriced.

I had clam chowder and steak.

I liked the view from the window though.
author: Woobin C.

description: An nice spot on Pier 39! Not too pricey and great wine choices. The lobster bisque was lovely for a cold September day and fish and chips were nicely done.
author: Becca C.

description: Showed up after lunch rush. Iced tea tasted funky and waiter said other people had also said same thing. Maybe figure out why it's rancid? All the fried foods looked and tasted exactly the same - calamari, crab cakes, chicken tenders. Change the batter, change the oil, change the presentation, do something. "Sizzling" crab melt was cold and tasted foul. Garlic shrimp was good, clam chowder in a bread bowl was decent. Have low expectations for a tourist trap on Pier 39.
author: Rick M.

description: The Eagle Cafe should be a brunch stop for anybody visiting Fisherman's Wharf. This was the second time in five years that we visited the Eagle Cafe during a trip to San Francisco - and our food, service, and experience was still great. Our table ordered everything from the basic breakfast (eggs, meat, potatoes, toast, and fruit), to the corned beef hash, to the seafood and crab benedict. Everything came out fresh, piping hot, and beautifully plated - and delicious to boot. The bill was extremely reasonable based on what you might expect in SF; and, our server was fast and attentive. The 10% discount for Yelpers and the gorgeous view of the water off Pier 39 didn't hurt either!
author: Chelsea C.

description: Failed my Benedict, yolks were hard.  The picture tells the tail, it was a hard boiled egg.  This is the basic of basics, the yolk should always run it's wonderful goo all over my ham and muffin drenching them in goodness always and it didn't.  A creamy yolk is not hard to do.  The Hollandaise was pretty good, I would have liked more.  Taters, as I write I don't remember, that says something.  Bloody Mary was good.  The waitress was cool, nice gal working hard.  Offered to get it right but there was no time.  The waitress was the hero here.
author: Edward H.

description:
My family and I went into San Francisco for my birthday and wanted to find a nice lunch spot with a view. I chose eagle cafe as my father isn't into seafood so we wanted something that had more than that. 

The outdoor seating is basically just like sitting at a straight away bar so I wasn't disappointed we couldn't get any seating out there. The inside is small and almost every table was occupied, but it's charming. 

Lobster bisque soup. Holy .... Best lobster bisque I have had in my life hands down. My mom and sister agreed. My mother and I shared a grilled shrimp platter and it was also very delicious. The shrimp was nicely cooked and seasoned. The cole slaw I wasn't such a huge fan of but the rest of the meal was great so that was a minor detail. Service was friendly and timely even though they were pretty busy. I believe our servers name was Will.

Thank you for a great birthday lunch and experience Eagle Cafe. Well be back soon!
author: Brittany R.

description:
Unfortunately this place only deserves One star and its only for the View on their balcony/ patio! 
We ordered their crab cakes which were Terrible!!! They came out completely fried, bland, with celery and mixed with many subpar spices that you can get at a regular grocery store.
We sent back the crab cakes and decided to get their Crab Sandwich, big mistake once again! Bland taste with celery mixed with some kind of ranch... What a disappointment! 
Half a dozen oysters... Well you can guess, they were tasteless and disgusting! 
So incredibly disappointed with this place especially coz they have such a cool patio that I would have loved to enjoy...
Anyways, skip this place, it isn't worth it! Or maybe order some drinks to enjoy the view, but don't be surprised if you end up hating them as well!
author: Yana S.

description:
Came down here with my dad on a random whim to put on our tourist faces and be a tourist for the day at the Pier. I find an overwhelming sense of calm at the water's edge, which adds a complexity when joined by the masses of tourists doing the tourist thing absolutely mobbing the waterfront. 
We spent a good 20 minutes deciding on where to dine, given that most of the locations along the pier are of similar or equal quality, but fining the words "Crab Cakes Benedict" in large font outside the Eagle Cafe, that is where we ended up.
The interior is deceptively spacious, and deceptively crowded, for a place facing the interior of the pier and the street, however do not let this fool you, they are a fierce competitor for breakfast's best! My dad ordered the crab omelet, and I of course ordered the crab cake Benedict. The omelet was fluffy, HUGE, and absolutely filled with crab and sauce. The Bene was just as proportionately ginormous, and slightly daunting. The taste, however, of these two menu stars were absolutely delicious. Alongside both there was the shock of spindly delicious crunchy twigs, which I later discovered were uncooked and fried pasta (crazy but actually good), and some potatoes, which I disliked for the addition of bell peppers.
The overall feel of the restaurant was cozy and elegant, waiters were attentive and friendly, and the service was incredibly fast, given that there were no open tables at the time we dined, which I was impressed by.
My only dislike was parking, because in Sonoma county there is always parking somewhere, and usually free at that, but when in rome/sf, you must do as the romans/frans do and pay for parking and then walk a great distance. This being said, the walk was refreshing with the ocean breeze, and worked up our appetite for the already stated huge portion sizes. Next time I return, I am going to split a plate with someone, because that is really how huge the portions are. Wish they were closer!
author: Leah S.

description:
Came here with visiting friends who were on vacation after they had heard about it from some YouTube video. Despite the mediocre ratings, they were able to accommodate us for dinner with a party of seven so we took our chances. 

For appy we got a 1/2 dozen raw oysters. Wasn't anything special. Fried calamari was good/average. 

Ordered the salmon angel hair pasta dish and it was not as described. Instead of a light tomato sauce, it was loaded with big pieces of tomato. The salmon pieces were cooked to perfection and the flavor the pasta mixture was enjoyable but after a while I felt overwhelmed by the tomato chunks and just pushed them aside. Probably wouldn't order it again. 

Good, friendly service.
author: D L.

description: If I could put a minus 5 stars I would. The worse service ever. The bar brought the wrong drink and then challenged us on the order. The manager was beyond rude. Don't even go there.
author: Roni H.

description: I entered but didn't stay to eat there because the place smelled strange. However, they had a friendly staff. Good location and view.
author: Lara K.

description: What a waste of a meal. The clam chowder taste like is it from a cheap can. The sourdough is dry. The seafood salad is a wash in dressing and has very little seafood. With so many good places in San Fran find almost anywhere else
author: Russell C.

description:
It has been a couple of decades since I have been to The Eagle, but such was my experience that, despite everything I've had since my last visit, it remains foremost in my mind as a superior dining event.  When I was at UCB, friends and I would dine there frequently.  It has been around for a long time, and was originally a place for locals.  Current food photos suggest is has gone upscale - if so, too bad.

I have only had breakfast at The Eagle; however, it was obviously memorable, and what I remember was the beautiful, fragrant (and huge) pancake, the corned beef hash, and the virtual pile of hash browns.  Not only would that meal stick with me all day (as a med student, it HAD to), but it has stuck with me all these years since.

If you like a great basic breakfast, I know of nowhere in the Bay that flies higher than The Eagle.
author: Iain M.

description: 5 stars for the view. We watched sunset- had some drinks all on a suggestion of a local tshirt vendor (thanks Hector at a Safe Harbor) Prices are not cheap..... But well worth the view on the back deck. William took care of us! He's a rock star! Great experience.
author: Kella C.

description:
Crab Benedict is no joke. It may be pricey, but they load it with fresh crab. No fishy taste, and melts in your mouth. The hollandaise really brings the flavor to the next level over the standard drawn butter that typically is served with crab.

A couple downsides to the Benedict's are that the yolks are not runny and silky smooth. I think they poach it more to the medium side for the tourists. 

Wouldn't come here ever when I lived in sf, but as a visitor living up the tourist scene, it was a solid option.
author: Peter T.

description: I have nothing bad to say about this place. I was visiting the area by myself and decided it was time for a drink and dinner. So I sat at the bar and had an amazing martini although had I read the reviews I should have had a bloody mary but it was still good. I also had a cup of chowder and shrimp cocktail only because I am watching my weight. Both were yummy I can't complain.  It's a cozy little place. Had it been before dark I would have opted to sit outside for the view of the boats. Cute little place. I would definitely come again.
author: Julia H.

description:
We ordered a dozen oysters with fresh horseradish to pair with it. The oysters were very big and reasonably priced. Not a ton of flavor with them, but good. Open air atmosphere overlooking the pier. 
Would recommend if looking for a quick lunch at the bar.
author: Tom F.

description: TERRIBLE SERVICE. Restaurant was empty, yet we still had to flag our waiter down every time we needed something. Also, the other waitstaff made crude comments about me WHILE I WAS WALKING TO MY TABLE. Disgusting!!
author: Lauren N.

description:
I've wanted to try the Eagle Cafe and normally it would be for the Crab but when looking at brunch places we found the Eagle Cafe at Pier 39 Fisherman's Wharf.

I ordered the Eggs Benedict, served with homefried potatoes with peppers that were really good. The Canadian bacon was a bit much for me, but luckily I had a Canadian there to help me finish it. 

He ordered the two eggs sunnyside up with two more, potatoes and toast and an order of Brown Sugar Banana Pecan Pancakes. Those were so delicious. 

Good place for Breakfast and they gave me 10% off for checking in on yelp. I'll come back for lunch or crab soon.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Best corned beef hash on the planet. Dispense of whatever preconceived notions you have of corned beef hash and try it here. You won't believe how good it is. 

The Bloody Mary is great, but be forewarned: it it hot. Gotta love the freshly grated horseradish and pickled jalapeño accompaniment. 

Remi, the bartender, was super nice, too. 

Overall, great experience.
author: Todd S.

description: I asked place for 4 people she said you have to wait 30min than in 30sec someone asked for place she said 10min waiting time :((( i will never go thus place anymore.
author: Tunc T.

description: I usually go here with my family because it's the best place until yesterday. I had the worst service I ever had by some waiter named Anna. She switched up the two orders because the frying machine wasn't working an she didn't even tell us till we recieved the food. We told her what she did wrong and she said she was going to "talk" to her manager about this, though we didn't even see the manager or saw her talking to him/her, We got a side of free french fries but that was it. Plus she never came back during our stay there to ask how we were doing or to even fill our cups again. I had to ask random waiters to bring more water or other things. But she did come when it was time to pay the bill. After this I'm rethinking if even bothering coming here anymore.
author: Luis V.

description: Even though it is on Pier 39, which I consider a tourist trap, I have had lunch there a couple of times now.  I work nearby and it is just a good decent restaurant with reasonable prices and very good service.
author: Bob W.

description: Very good the food was some of the best seafood I have had and the employees were very nice I thought it was going to be okay and have a lot of tourists but it was still full but they put effort in the food and that's what I love about this place very good
author: Aiden P.

description: Nice staff, they sat us very quickly. The food came out fast and it was very good. We had a great breakfast here and our waitress was awesome.
author: Arbi G.

description:
We came here after seeing the lineup at Mama's --- and having just survived a 3 hour waiting fiasco at the golden gate bakery the night before, we were not about to line up for any SFO hype again. We walked over to the wharf and looked for anything open that served a nice sit down breakfast. 

Their breakfast is so good and the portion sizes are so generous. Ambience is great with a nautical / seafood shack theme and a view of the bay. We ordered 2 items and coffee for $60ish.

The good: Food was great! Location. Price for the size of serving was good. I wouldn't mind it if they made the portions smaller for less $.

The bad: We only tried to items and I really can't fault them.

The food:

1) Cable car breakfast combo - the "homemade" corned beef made this meal...  The flavour was spot on with its spices. I can see some people may find it just a tad bit salty but I could seriously eat a plate of that stuff. The sausage was good too. The bacon, and eggs were not anything special but you can't go wrong with bacon now can you?

2) salmon benefit - salmon was great, it had that nice salmon flavour without being fishy. The poached eggs were made perfectly to order. Normally, the hollandaise in Benedicts taste too rich but this one was just right. 

They has fried spaghetti which was alright but I don't think I'd miss.
author: Carla A.

description: Server is superb.  Food hit the spot and mango mimosa best I've ever had!  Cheers....love this place!
author: Gina C.

description: Very small portions, average service.  Go to the fog house next door instead. Food overall is decent but you will leave hungry..they don't allow you to alter the menu item much.
author: Nate W.

description: We were looking for a quick and relatively small bite to eat before heading to the airport for the flight back to Ohio.  Parked in the Pier 39 validated parking garage.
