Eagle Cafe was the closest place with a bar.  Quick and friendly service for both alcohol and food.  Food was not primo, but pretty good for what we were after.  A little disappointed with the crab chowder. chicken tenders and house salad met expectations.  Great pour for the Woodford Reserve, so overall not bad.  Awesome view of Alcatraz though.  Watched the sun go down and fog roll in.
author: David V.

description: I didn't have any food. Only drinks.  However we set outside which offered beautiful views of the bay and amazing people watching ammunition. Recommended if you need a drink and good conversation.  Friendly staff.
author: Malcolm D.

description: Even though this restaurant / cafe is near the roar and very busy the food was very good. I couldn't give it a 5 star because of the timely service. My friend got her meal and 15 minutes later I got my meal. The waiter was very kind and polite but because of the inconvenience there was no deduction from a hundred fifty dollar bill. Is very pricey. We SAT by the back door with a door opening every 5 seconds with a cold burst of air coming in. The only thing really good about this place was the food. But it wasn't worth $150.
author: Brenda C.

description: Great food and great service. The house made hot sauce is a must for all you spicy food lovers. Good view of ocean through windows and outside sitting area. Right on the deck for easy access to boat tours.
author: Jason E.

description:
Tourist coming through...tourist coming through...with my camera and my map! It was completely obvious that we weren't from around there, but then again, who's not a tourist on Pier 39!! 

We walked all around the pier and finally decided on Eagle Cafe. I like the bar set up and the seats that face the window. I liked how everyone working there was very friendly...almost too friendly, borderline fake friendly, but either way, friendly. 

We ordered:
- the crab salad sandwich: http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pF8ZBEfbgiQzUwAH_7mF5w/l
it was pretty good, tasted fresh and I enjoyed the shoestring fries. 
- the hot crab melt: 
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ddQOrZ-1Y2tbh9QJ3ERklA/l
I've never had this before, at first I felt weird eating hot cheese and crab together, but somehow it worked and I really enjoyed the combination. 

Here at Eagle Cafe, you'll get good fresh food at a high tourist price:
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/b4bYmtBXf85P_GqtyhrWrA/l
a SF Healthy Surcharge??? Seriously?? (minus 1 star) 
Also there is only one restroom for the whole establishment, so the line was a bit long. (minus 1 star) 

Eagle Cafe is definitely A-OK in my tourist book!
author: Lily A.

description:
We went there a few weeks ago for Sunday brunch.  The food wasn't memorable enough to make me want to immediately write a review for it.  We ordered the pancakes and an omelette/scramble.   The only thing that stood out was the ginormous portions...

The service was very slow for an empty restaurant.
author: Melinda Y.

description: Crabby Mary is a must!!!! Also, the shrimp cocktail is so fresh and cold it's to die for. Tried the oysters for the first time and was pleasantly surprised, they tasted so fresh and mild!!!!
author: Dayl S.

description: Breakfast for 4!  The corned beef hash is made in house and the best I have had.   My sister in law was thrilled with the blueberry pancakes,  blueberries inside and on top.  Top it off with outstanding service.   Definitely a must when visiting the Wharf.
author: Vince R.

description: Pretty good for the $1.50 oysters and a good cocktail or two. The bartender was pretty dry but everyone has there off days. Good for a little lunch date in the busy San Francisco city.
author: Kristi D.

description: Well our experience was nice for the first 5 min after that it was pretty my down hill food was good but subpar compared to the price bread was probably the biggest rip off ive had in sf it wasnt completely hollowed out anf on had jus under half a cup i would expect that much from the half size order. Also we ordered 2 salads and and an oyster plate but they never came and then our entrees came still no appetizers and all our drinks had not been filled and our waitress jus seemed to disappear at some point. After all that she brought us the oyster plate when we were almost done woth our food and seemed irritated with us when we said we didnt want it anymore. Our first time we will not be coming back.
author: Nick K.

description: The food here is suuuuper yummy and it's not too expensive. The reason for the two stars is the extremely rude staff. The hostess was very unwelcoming and unpleasant, and one of the bussers reached over us while we were eating to restock the table, didn't say excuse me or anything. Awful!!!
author: Rebecca T.

description: Shady Business Practices. The Eagle Cafe offers horrible tasting coffee, way overpriced food, and they expect you to pay for their workers' comp. We stopped in on our way to Alcatraz. We ordered 2 sandwiches (both extremely overpriced) and an order of chicken tenders. They also charged us a San Francisco Employer Mandate Fee, which in the real world the Employer would pay. I ordered a coffee, which tasted like it was made 4 days prior and then microwaved when I ordered it. If the owner of the Eagle Cafe were legit, they would pay the Employee Mandates, seeing that their prices are already extremely marked up. The owner must be only concerned with ripping of tourists and lining his/her pockets with money. There was no dipping sauce for my tenders, and the cod sandwich was mainly bread. Can I give ZERO stars? Get a hot dog instead.
author: Kevin O.

description: Came here when we first got to Pier 39. We were sat down pretty fast because we agreed to sit outside. I ordered an iced tea and a BLT. Tea tasted really old and I just could not finish it because it wasn't good. My BLT portion was large as it was a double decker style. Fries were cooked well and definitely the best part of my meal. The sandwich was mediocre at best. Bread was over toasted and dry, and it tasted like charred bread. The bacon was really chewy and hard to bite through. The waitress was really sweet and attentive. I still tipped her well because the food quality isn't her fault. It's a shame that I'm here on business so I probably won't come back to update my review.
author: Jaime E.

description: Only got the raw oysters - which were good. Ordered the 24pc and shared with a friend. Satisfies your raw oyster craving, and for the price on the pier, it's actually not that bad ($40 without tax). Knocked off a star because our server tried to charge was for 2 x 12pc oyster which would have cost us $50 but after pointing out that it clearly says on the menu $40 (even though he argued that it was an old menu - like how are we supposed to know that if it's not crossed out or something?) he came back and told us he would give us the menu price. Besides the little price mixup, if you are craving for oysters on the pier, I think this spot has a good deal!
author: Sally K.

description: This is my new favorite place to have a meal in the SF.  Between the food, service and atmosphere this place is wonderful.  The management keeps this place running smooth will all the people who come in and out all day.  Lobster bisque is a must have on the menu, if your not in the mood to have soup fish & chips are over the top.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
This is a nice little cafe located right at the front of Pier 39 in Fisherman's Wharf. My friend & I were starving so we stopped at the first place we saw - plus, there was a check-in offer for 20% off so make sure to check in! The location is really nice and you usually are seated by the window, so you get a nice view of the wharf in the afternoon. 

Unfortunately, the food was just okay. Pretty average offerings for lunch - the menu had a variety of salads, hamburgers, and sandwiches with an emphasis, obviously, on seafood. I tried the Alaskan Cod Fish Sandwich, which was $16 - pretty pricey for a fish sandwich and french fries, but it was a pretty huge sandwich so I was able to save half for dinner. I wasn't overwhelmingly excited about the sandwich. The fish was slightly dry and plain tasting, and the flavors didn't mesh that well together, but if you just want a typical fish sandwich, it should suit you well enough. I also tried a cup of the clam chowder, which again, was just average - and for $5.50, I expected more. 

The rest of their menu is filled with oysters, clams, crab and fish dishes, ranging from about $12-18 per dish. I might recommend coming for breakfast, but dinner prices look even steeper and the food just isn't great enough to warrant such high prices. The atmosphere and environment is nice, but it has more of a rickety, old-time feel than anything fancy or scenic. The servers were nice and attentive, and the food came out relatively quickly, which was a plus.

There are so many other restaurants and food options in Fisherman's Wharf that I wouldn't necessarily recommend stopping here, but if you do, make sure to get that check-in offer.
author: Jenny Y.

description: Great location for a drink or meal. We ordered two bread bowl clam chowders.. The bread was stale and the chowder had no taste. Campbell's would have been tastier. I would expect chowder of this calliber at a sleazy pub, not a waterfront seafood restaurant.  I'd skip this place and find something else!
author: Brian A.

description: One of the worst places in the city.  The only reason it stays in business is because people see the ridiculous prices of the place next door.  I got a cod sandwhich which wasn't all that bad, but then I took a bite of my father's crab sandwhich.  It tasted like rubbery tuna.  Even my dog would spit that out.  Also the French fries were cold and soggy.. How hard is it to make french fries?  If you're looking for a place with bad service, bad food, and a bit pricey this is the place for you
author: Kevin L.

description: Amazing meal and amazing service! We were a group of 12 who showed up after the Sunday Giants game and unlike all the other restaurants at the pier who were estimating at least an hour wait, the manager Mario got tables set up for us in 10 minutes. The fish and chips were amazing, the salmon angel hair pasta dish has unbelievable flavour and the chicken linguine was also delicious. If you're nearby it's definitely worth checking out!
author: Cathy C.

description: Very good service, atmosphere and food. I got the whole Dungeness crab and my girlfriend got the Fried Seafood combo. It would have been nice to have the crab cooked in garlic butter like other places offer. We both loved every bite of our meal.  Being a Maryland native, I was very happy that they had Old Bay, because I forgot mine in my hotel room!:)
author: Greg D.

description: This place was very busy for lunch on a Saturday. The food was excellent and service was adequate. We waited a while for food but drinks were kept filled. Clam chowder was good but not over the top. Fresh oysters were great but had to ask for vinegar. Shrimp was excellent and my bloody ceasar was spicy and good.
author: Teresa B.

description: I thinking is a tourist trap. The food was mediocre at best.  I get better fish and chips and shrimp pro boys in landlocked Colorado.  It's a pass for me.  Bloody Mary was delicious... I'll definitely give them that!
author: Jessica S.

description:
The crab salad sandwich was good but the crab was really good, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

You can see the Golden Gate and the Bay bridge from here which was great.
author: Chris B.

description:
I am so happy i finally ate here!! The night before, my group had decided to not get drinks here since it looked too fancy & we were going for dive bars. 
The next morning, we almost didn't eat here because we wanted brunch and they didn't have it. But we stayed in order to not look elsewhere. 
Boy were we happy!! Try the mimosas! Filled to the top and strong!! Get regular, the mango ones are $2 more and taste the same. 
I had salmon eggs benedict and they were to die for! My whole group ordered different items and were very satisfied! 
Our waiter was extremely nice and we had a nice table in the corner looking out onto the pier. 
Beautiful experience and will most likely come again.
author: Harlow H.

description: It's my first time visiting San Francisco & I have been looking for a good breakfast spot. I happened to come across it & I fell in love with the food. I ordered an omelette and it was flavored deliciously, they serve big portions so be ready to stuff your face. I'm definitely stopping by here every time I visit San Francisco from now on.
author: Kimberly S.

description: My wife and I stopped in here for breakfast on a whim whilst on vacation and were blown away.  Simple and clean decor with GREAT breakfast food made it a memorable stop.  The jalapeño sausage scramble is a must breakfast but for the spice-o-philes out there.  The service was fast, friendly, and good.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I am on a diet and asked for a small garden salad instead of their cup of coleslaw with my salmon. The owner said they do not allow the sub because coleslaw is a garnish and salad is a side. What the owner was telling me was is that they charge $22.00 plus tax and tip for a piece of salmon with no side - only garnish. What the owner was also telling me was that they would not sub out the coleslaw for salad so they can give me coleslaw I did not want and charge me for a side salad.The owner would not budge.
Even after I told him at least twice I was on a diet, he did offer to give me free French fries to make up for their policy. I AM ON A DIET. IF YOU WANTED TO GIVE ME FREE FOOD HOW ABOUT A SIDE SALAD? 

Although I had not been here recently, I had been here al least 50 times with nothing but praise. The owner seemed young (new owner?) What a shame the owner has turned it into a tourist trap. 

My friend also hated her $16.99 deeply fried breaded hard fish stick sandwich with no side - only a garnish of coleslaw.
author: Michael C.

description: Had the fried shrimp po' boy and it was AMAZING! Combined with a glass of beer and looking at San Francisco bay made it all the better! Also try their famous fish sandwich as well... equally as AMAZING!
author: Vernon B.

description: we arrived here around 1135 after our alcatraz tour thinking it was just about lunch time, nope still breakfast. we order a dozen oysters, good and fresh. What confused me was people that were seated 10mins after us order from the lunch menu? Oh well, we already put our bfast order in and just wanted to eat and get on with our day. Breakfast was ok, huge portions was the only good part.
author: S B.

description: The crab eggs benedict was honestly the best I ever had.  My husband had the crab omelet and my daughter the chocolate chip pancakes,  all were amazing and the service was even better.
author: Renee S.

description: I wanted a nice breakfast near our hotel so I hunted through reviews and found this old time gem. Nice environment, great space and some amazing service. The prices were very good for some wonderful food. I am not an oyster or bloody Mary person BUT I hear tale both are very good here and they looked lovely from what I saw. We were expecting a bit of a cluster due to the location and time we were going here to eat but alas, we actually had a great breakfast.
author: Mikhail H.

description:
Great for brunch! I ordered the pancakes with strawberries inside and out and a mimosa - I couldn't finish either because the serving sizes are HUGE. First time I left a restaurant without finishing my mimosa :( but overall it was great. Cute space! 

There were a lot of flies flying around which was a turnoff but the windows and balcony was open so I get it. Service was decent!
author: Kiran S.

description: Pier 39 , great area for family , dating , or just going out for a good time . There is a great view in the Resturant , my first time here I got a sourdough bread bowl with the famous clam chowder , it was amazing , I couldn't finish it , reasonable price , great service
author: Anthony M.

description: Great views of the pier area and beautiful sunsets. Shrimp scampi was a flavorful changeup with rice and veggies instead of pasta.  But the best dish there was actually the spicy shrimp appetizer. C'mon guys, serve this over pasta as an entree!  It's fantastic.
author: Gino D.

description: This two stars is sorely for the Asian lady whom I think was the manager. She was very attentive and friendly. My server was nowhere to be found and my group have to stop two other bus boy/ server to get us to get use some services. Yet they keep walk by without getting thing that we ask for. Trust me our request weren't complicated at all. One time is water another is to get us a small place. And twice the manager was the one who response to our request. The food were poorly made. I were very disappointed.
author: Kevin P.

description:
Stupid. Stupid. Stupid. (Pounding my forehead on the wooden railing in front of the invisible sea lions at Pier 39). Not the Eagle Cafe. No, the owners are actually savvy. I'm talking about me. What was I thinking that I could possibly have a good, satisfying meal on this godforsaken series of worn-out planks, this crowded bastion of highway robbery tourism? You might as well take your wallet out of your pants and throw it to the sea lions...hello, where are you, you smelly pinnipeds? 

The Eagle Cafe looks like a decent enough place from the outside, and it has history since they moved the entire building from the nearby waterfront to the upper level of Pier 39. They shouldn't have bothered, and the menu should have given me a clue. $18 for a Crab Salad Sandwich billed as the "#1 Crab Salad Sandwich in San Francisco". Well, hell's bells, sign me up. What a meh - and at such an inflated price. Spread on a split French roll was the most generic tasting, mayo-infested crab sandwich this side of a lunch truck, accompanied by slices of unripened tomato and pre-packaged fries. 

Jamie W. had comparatively better luck with, get this, "San Francisco's #1 Fish and Chips". Gee, someone thinks mighty highly of themselves. Another $18 dish, but at least you get three good-sized strips of cod fillets battered up - though in dire need of the malt vinegar to give it any flavor. That tartar sauce was also desperately needed here. We were also surrounded by shrieking toddlers and parents indifferent to their complete accountability over muzzling their brats. Even the sea lions had to leave because they have their standards, too. 

FOOD - 2 stars...expensive cafeteria food 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...Pier 39 feels like Disneyland without the seven dwarves...unless you count the Bushman 
SERVICE - 3 stars...nice enough even if some staff can't seem to see when customers need refills on their Diet Cokes 
TOTAL - 2 stars... why it's "San Francisco's #1 Self-Proclaimed Eatery"...well, hell's bells, sign...oh man, I almost did it again!
author: Ed U.

description:
Awesome place for Breakfast
Sikkk Bloody Mary's
author: Marco V.

description: Popped in for breakfast! Wow!!! Bloody Mary was yum! I love caper berries and was happy to see one in my drink along with olives and a jalapeño! Nicely done. Corned Beef hash: I was scared because oddly enough I'm a huge fan of Libby's canned corned beef hash and homemade sometimes doesn't stack up...DELISH!!!! I was NOT disappointed! That was so good! 5 stars from this super picky eater!!!!
author: Jessica D.

description: For a touristy spot on the wharf, this place is pretty dang good. When I visit this part of the city (and let's face it the wharf has become a giant generic tourist trap), this is where I would prefer to get a beverage and appetizer. I've been here several times just for the bloody marys and calamari, two of my favorite things on the planet. Looking at the photos from their Yelp page is making my mouth water, so I'm going to have to make a trip there soon!
author: Kim V.

description: The view is awesome. Breeze is nice. Host unpleassant. A lot of employees seem to not like working here. Our waiter was the only one who provided excellent service. The soups were great. Lobster bisque was sweet. Drinks were good too.
author: Trinidad E.

description: Nice wait staff.  Have me a 20% discount for part of  my 1/2 crab missing.  Food was great what I had of it.
author: Mary H.

description:
AWESOME brunch. Mimosas were a decent mix in a good sized wine glass. I had the crab omelette which was very well done. Best part of the meal was the breakfast potatoes and fried angel hair pasta. 

It was very busy but there was available bar seating if you wanted to get in and out quickly.
author: Jessee M.

description: Came here for dine about town on a Wednesday night... started dinner with Happy Hour oysters, fanny Bay and east point, very delicious. Our server, Simon,  was very attentive and made sure every detail was perfect!  We had clam chowder and their mixed greens,  the dressing was so good,  I dipped my French bread in it! This was followed by a huge garlic butter crab for each of us and we ended with a brownie a La mode... Can't wait to come back!
author: Chan T.

description: Went to visit Alcatraz today and came here on a whim. The food was satisfactory. It was good for its price. I ordered the lobster bisque. The soup tasted fresh, but they didn't use real lobster inside. The waiter was great and helpful, but the server gave us the wrong order and was very rude about it. He blamed us for getting the wrong order. Perfect customer service. Overall it was good, but this is not one of the first places I'd go to for food around here.
author: S M.

description: My fiance and I were here about a year ago and he couldn't stop thinking about the bacon! We had to come back...Cable Car (PROTEIN IT UP) AND Crab cakes Benedict with a side if bacon, of course! Great atmosphere and view in to,the harbor!
author: Jessica V.

description:
Wait was short, food was meh... No sauce for the Benedict, no credit on the menu. If I ordered a side, would I not have been charged? Thought so. One of our party got sick from her breakfast. Like puke sick. Before we could leave. 

Touristy, on the pier, what can you expect? Not to get sick perhaps. I'll take a pass on my next visit.
author: W K.

description:
Went to Eagle Cafe with my significant other yesterday and had the half steamed crab. It was divine! Let me be frank, the food was great. Now let me be honest: in my opinion crab is pretty hard to not make great, so let me tell you about what makes them such a great place to be.

1. The service was INCREDIBLE. We had different waiters checking up on us when our waitress was occupied. This was awesome. When we needed refills on our beverages, they were quick to get on it.

2. The staff is friendly, warm, and efficient.

3. The atmosphere is great. Located on Pier 39, the folks at Eagle have a lot to offer in terms of their location. It's in the centre of everything going on along Fisherman's Wharf.

Definitely a great place to go.
author: Kristen D.

description:
Spent my 50th B-Day in S.F. last month and while waiting for our touristy Alcatraz and harbor boat trip, we spotted the Eagle Café upstairs in one of the building at Fisherman's Wharf.    We were in the mood for brunch and were so glad we ventured in.   No wait, and a beautiful room with a spectacular view of the bay.

Fantastic friendly (gorgeous) waiter, excellent coffee and overly generous portions.    I had a California Omelette (spinach, veggies, feta) with some hash browns, excellent sausage  and my partner had his usual eggs over hard.  All the dishes come with a side of ripe fruit and delicious sourdough toast.

This was a great Thursday Brunch ... would definitely come back  ... really loved it here!
author: Anthony W.

description: Great food, nice workers, and nice and fast food. Great for breakfast I recommend the French toast it's really good.
author: Davis B.

description: The portions were huge! Didn't have enough time for lunch but we were able to get a little seafood for breakfast here. Staff was friendly but you don't get much of a view sitting inside. Service was quick and there are a lot of options on the menu for egg lovers.
author: Shifa A.

description:
Very friendly staff.  We did have to wait quite a while, but hey,,,, it's Pier 39 and there's like 10,000 people here!
Had a Pyramid Hefenwizen.  VERY good local beer!  And 24 oysters.  They were very fresh tasting and not too small.
I liked it here, but they are very expensive!  Wanted crab, and maybe a couple of appetizers or something, but they are too expensive.  Opportunists maybe?  Living near Morro Bay I can get basically the same thing at a fraction of the price!
author: L R.

description: We really enjoyed our meal. Thought the clam chowder was excellent. It was seasoned a little spicy, which I appreciated. Fish was seasoned similarly. More flavors than lemon, butter, and garlic. Is it like right-from-the-fish-market, catch-of-the-day kind of fresh seafood? I don't know, really. Seem's like the menu is pretty consistent day-to-day. But it was tasty and portions were huge. And maybe best of all, they had a bathroom with a changing table.
author: Todd W.

description:
On one side of this light and airy restaurant, you have the view of San Francisco bay, Alcatraz island, the Golden Gate Bridge. On another there's the view of the SF business district skyline. And on another, you can people watch the comings and goings at Pier 39. Any way you look at it... a pretty good venue for a leisurely breakfast.

 Wife ordered the eggs Benedict, while I chose the "Original Breakfast" that comes with two eggs, bacon, sausage, corned beef hash.

 The Beni was really done right with a delish Hollandaise, and runny egg yolks, along with the crispy smoked bacon... a nice way to start another SF adventure.

 My "Original," was also very good, but what took it up a notch, was the homemade corned beef hash. Nice and crispy on the outside, and nice delicious, tender corned beef on the inside. After sharing some with the wife, we both agreed ... probably the best CBH we've had to date, which says a lot as we've had a hella hash!

 With a clear sunny SF morning, along with a side order of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge, with our sour dough toast .... I'd say this is starting out to be a pretty good day!
author: Joe K.

description: Back again. SF PRIDE weekend was fun, but I needed to get away from the close to naked partiers and relax with a cold beer. The Eagle popped into mind, took an Uber and here I am. The bartender was friendly and attentive making sure to check if I needed more beer before it was empty. So glad I sat at the bar, because their raw bar is awesome and fresh with a great variety of oysters, fresh shucked. I had to order some oysters. How could I not? The Eagle serves it with fresh grated horseradish!!! If you have not tried fresh horseradish, do! First sweet, then that in your nose kick. I will definitely have to try the Bloody Mary, as highly recommended by other Yelpers :)
author: Sandy L.

description: Came here for lunch on President Day and I am so glad I did! We were seated right away and the restaurant was very accommodating since we had a stroller with us. My husband order the eagle bacon cheeseburger and he said it was really good and juicy. I ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl and i must say it was really good! wish the bread was hot and toasted but overall the soup itself is really good. I would order it again without the bread bowl and maybe just ask for some sliced sourdough bread. I also ordered half an order of their garlic butter crab and omg it was bomb.com! defin would return again if i am in the city wanting to be a tourist for the day!
author: Thuyvi M.

description: Best seafood I've ever had. I clapped as my empty plate was taken from me!
author: Rachel Y.

description: Walking around looking for a place to devour some breakfast and came across this place. The breakfast food was amazing and the prices are fair. If you're visiting San Fransisco and want a quick delicious breakfast, I highly recommend this place. Also customer service was great! Enjoyed this place 100%
author: Abraham C.

description:
Walking on pier 39 on vacation. No wait at 5 on a Sunday. Bay side table. Great view. 

Ronald was the waiter. Fabulous job. Kid was top notch in every aspect. 

I had the grilled salmon. Not only seasoned well but cooked perfectly. The side of mashed potatoes kinda stole the show. My girlfriend is a mashed potatoe nut and she started stealing mine so she ordered her own side. The side of potatoes was almost as big as her meal. 

Food came out fast and our server was on top of things. When I come back I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again
author: Andrew R.

description:
I live in this neighborhood.   Eagle Cafe is one of the places I frequent.   Great breakfast, lunch.

The Hamburger there is a must.

I love sitting outside looking out to the bay.

I have never been disappointed here.

Of-course if you go busy hours, there may be a wait.
author: Doris A.

description: A gem within the confines of a "tourist trap". Enjoyed a bay view during breakfast. Hands down the best Bloody Mary ever!  The Dungeness crab eggs Benedict were simply amazing as were the banana pancakes. Great attention to details. Fast and friendly service. Warning, the servings were very large.
author: Halcyon M.

description:
We stopped into Eagle Cafe for a drink before our ferry arrived. I am glad we had the time, because this place is pretty cool.

I got a casual feeling with some relaxing undertones.  The patio is pretty cool with great views, but we chose to sit at the bar as we only intended to drink.

The bartender was friendly and when we asked if they have any specialties, he immediately offered up the 'famous' bloody mary.  We accepted his challenge and ordered one each.  They arrived in a big glass with lots of extras:  olives, peppers, celery, carrots...perfect mix of garnishment.

After reviewing the menu we decided to get a snack and try some oysters.  Instead of just getting them on the half shell, we opted for the shooters (some with alcohol, some without).  To me, they were too large to actually shoot, so I forked it and took two bites instead.  Very yummy and fresh.

I would like to come back here sometime and try a full meal, everything that we saw looked quite good.  A little pricey, but take into consideration where you are, and you get over it quickly, realizing its pretty good for Pier 39.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
My all time favorite place in the city for everything from drinks to salads, oysters, and soup. Their customer service, presentation and food is amazing.

I use to be in love with the clam chowder, but I am actually cheating on it with the lobster bisque. It is actually pretty new on their menu so I hope it doesn't go anywhere. It is flavorful, creamy, and you get lots of lobster in each and every bite down to the end of the bowl. When I finished I was contemplating if I should lick the bowl or not... haha.

Their vinaigrette dressing is home made and to die for. It's not to sour, not to sweet just the right amount of vinegar and olive oil to make any salad taste good.

I believe their pineapple juice is freshly made too. It was in a large glass not like when you go to  other restaurants and you get a small glass.

Make sure you get validated when you park in the parking structure 1 hour before 6pm and after 6pm validation is good for 3 hours.

PS - They serve fresh horseradish for their oysters!
author: Kathy V.

description: Firstly, this place is more expensive than $$. Out of our family of four, only my husband liked his mixed seafood salad. His only complaint was not enough shrimp or crab is in the dish, and the salmon piece was only decent size. Our two sons ordered the pasta with meat sauce and the portion size was disappointing for $20! I had the angel hair pasta with salmon and I was very disappointed. The light tomato sauce turned out to be nothing but olive oil and tons of sliced garlic. The marinated tomatoes were over marinated and tasted sour. They also overpowered the dish and there were only three small chunks of salmon. It was not worth $26. My husband spoke to the manager and she was understanding. She took off one of the pasta with meat sauce from the bill and gave us 10% off. So for the service I would rate them higher, but their food is disappointing and overpriced. We should have listened to our city bus tour guide and stayed away from Pier 39. The entire place is over priced. Stay away from the fruit stand!
author: Maria G.

description:
Hubby and I ended up at Eagle Café for lunch after a morning bike ride around San Francisco. Every restaurant at Pier 39 seemed to have had about a 2 hour wait and we were starving. Even though Eagle Cafe was full we were able to be seated right away. If the place had been empty with no one eating there we would have walked away. The host/hostess was very friendly and we were waited on immediately after seating. Our waitress was friendly and took our order and then she disappeared! The manager brought our food to the table and I immediately noticed that my order was wrong. I told her what I ordered and she apologized and said she would take care of everything. It took about 10 minutes but she came back with my food, fresh and hot. I had the fried jumbo shrimp platter with fries and coleslaw and hubby had a platter with fish and shrimp. The shrimp and fish was very good and the coleslaw was probably the best I have tasted. It was different from most coleslaw, crisp in taste and texture. 

Yes, the food is overpriced but it would have been even worse if the food sucked but it was pretty good but let's face it everything on Pier 39 is overpriced and that's just the way it is!

I do agree with others that they could use another restroom but since they don't have one, they should keep the one they have cleaner for the people eating there. You shouldn't eat your food and walk into the facility and see how nasty, dirty and disgusting the restroom is!

We don't have any complaints other than the fact that the restroom was filthy and our waitress disappeared and never came back. Not sure what happened to her, we kept seeing her but she totally ignored our table after taking our order and the manager was the one person that kept coming back to check on us. 4 stars go to the manager (but a word of advise, clean the restrooms!) 0 stars for the waitress! 

Worth a return visit.
author: Vikki J.

description: Great place! Got here right at opening. Beautiful views of alcatrez with fantastic breakfast. Salmon Benedict may have been a tad over priced at 28 bucks but was pretty good. Extra crispy bacon was fantastic!
author: Amy M.

description:
Ehm....nope. 

We came in with a party of 4 and a baby and due to the long weekend I guess it took a while to be seated (20 min?) Not a problem, for almost every good diner there is a wait and the hostess was pretty nice about it. 
Waiter was nice too and pretty quick, so no complaints there. 
It was just the food. It wasn't like it was really bad....it just wasn't good. I had the crab omelette and it was just meh. With meh toast and weird fried spaghetti (?) The potatoes were nice but seriously for $17 for an omelette I expected something better. For 4 people we paid a bit over a hundred dollars. Then to feel like it was all meh kinda stinks. 

Also unless you are on the patio you are basically not getting much of a view. And to top it off, they only have one toilet for which there is a constant line (and it is kinda gross). 

3 stars for meh.
author: Chandra S.

description: Delicious shrimp pepper jack scramble. Awesome bloody mary. Little small inside so limited seating. But they do have balcony seating available to enjoy the ocean view.
author: Lin T.

description: Ambience was nice. Had the oysters on the half which ran $23 a dozen. Oysters were extremely fresh and quite tasty. I'm used to receiving crackers with an oyster appetizer, but maybe that is not a west coast thing. Service- Horrible. I would have reviewed other menu items if I was not made to feel like I was interrupting my waitress' day. My drink order was requested, but before I could answer, the waitress snatched up the drink menu and   stormed off to retrieve glasses of water. Upon return , I had to request the drink menu in I order to place me order. Would I return? Likely.  The food looked really good. Hopefully, a better server would redeem my visit.
author: Terry S.

description:
I went to Eagle Cafe over the weekend for some appetizers with a big group of 12.  All I can say is that we were amazed.  We know Pier 39 is a great place for seafood but we didn't know that Eagle Cafe was the best seafood place on Pier 39.   And it's the first one you see as you're coming out of the parking lot.  

We were served an assortment of appetizers:

Crab Cakes - the crab cakes were amazing.  They were lightly breaded in round balls but cooked to perfection.  The crab was moist, sweet and spicy, dipped in tartar sauce, it was the best crab cakes I've ever had.  It was the perfect size as well for an appetizer because it was filling but not overly.

Fried Calamari - I absolutely love calamari but I'm very picky about it.  i hate it when the breadedness doesn't connect with the squid or when the squid is too chewy.  The calamari here was perfect.  Also lightly breaded and fried, the calamari tasted great with the marinara and tartar dipping sauces.

Chicken Tenders - I don't eat this type of meat but from the words of my party, this was the best ever.  They tasted better here than places that specialized in chicken.

Steamed Garlic Clams - I don't normally eat clams or oysters because a lot of places don't clean them properly.  The clams here were clean and made to perfection.  With cut pieces of garlic, these clams just flavored up your mouth.  I'm craving one right now...

Grilled Jumbo Shell of Prawns in a garlic spicy sauce - I'm saving the best for last.  Why say it's the best?  Because I normally don't eat prawns or shrimp (too chewy for me) but I absolutely loved these.  The shrimp were flavorful and not too chewy.  The sauce it came in was just spectacular.  We all began dipping our bread in that garlic sauce because it was so good.  

They also have a full bar that the guys in our group were frequenting with a large range of cocktails.

When I go back to Pier 39, I'm headed straight for Eagle Cafe.
author: Sheena D.

description: Good bloody Mary's, decent seafood, good views. Not the best SF has to offer, felt like a tourist trap. When I checked in on Yelp, I got a coupon for 10% off our meal, which I had a very hard time getting applied to our check because the server had already closed us out before we had a chance to tell him we had a coupon...took 25 minutes to resolve.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Came in for a drink and a bite. Sat at the bar and had horrible service. The bartender acted as if we were bothering him for a drink. Even though that's what he does. Right??? Decided to not order food as it was hard enough to get a drink.
author: Joel A.

description:
First time here. Food was great. Service sucked. After being seated, waited literally 20 mins for service. Practically every waiter was standing around watching the game... They weren't even busy. 

Thank god for Ivan, who walked past us maybe two times and right away asked if we had been serviced yet, whom, I also noticed, seemed to be the only one doing any work. THANK YOU IVAN, WONDERFUL WAITER. 

And I'm sure the bad service is because my friends and I look young, so the waiters must have thought we couldn't pay for our meal. And also I'm pretty sure that's what they said in the middle of our meal when they stared over at our table and started whispering to each other.
author: Charlene P.

description: Food was alright, nothing different about it. Good environment, reason why im giving 3 stars is the service was SLOW. Took forever to get my food.
author: Eddie K.

description: My daughter loved her crab cakes Benedict. I loved my crab omelette (was that zucchini I tasted?!). We all loved the breakfast potatoes!!! Service was great as well. Highly recommended for those going to fishermans wharf that don't want to go to those chain restaurants.
author: Chuck W.

description: Holy fresh oysters! Sit at the bar and order a few dozen. Kick em' back with a few martinis. Bliss. Stick to the fresh seafood and you can't go wrong in this place!
author: Kristin L.

description:
Whenever I visit Pier 39, this is usually the first stop.  It is definitely recommended to get a Lychee mojito.  The only place I have been to that uses actual lychee when they muttle the mint.  Another drink to try is a Wisconsin Lunchbox, which miller lite with a splash of orange juice, and a shot of amaretto topped off with southern comfort.  You drop the shot into the glass and chug away.

The raw oysters are pretty good as well.  I cannot comment on the food since I do not go there to eat.
author: John C.

description:
Stopped in after a long day of touring the city.
We got seated around 8PM.  I wanted to order an oyster appetizer first thing before ordering dinner, but was told they had ran out of raw oysters.  Not a problem I usually have a backup, so I asked for the Lobster Bisque in a bread bowl.
Again, I was disappointed!  Although they had plenty of bisque, they ran out of bread bowls....
I was about ready to walk out and go find another restaurant that actually had food left at 8PM on a Monday evening but my wife insisted we stay and eat there.
The dinner was ok-not good-not bad.  I had the grilled salmon and my son ate the grilled chicken with gravy.
Not sure I would go back.  There are so many more places to go in the area serving the EXACT same fair, but do not run our of the core menu items.
author: Shawn R.

description: I was only here on drinks but the place hace a very nice view on the bay an alcatraz island. It's worth coming here, but don't order Samuel Adams ;)
author: Marek W.

description:
We came here for dinner on a weekend. It was really busy so we were ok with the bar seating. We had grilled maahi maahi, grilled salmon and pasta. The service was strictly ok. The food quality was really good. The salmon was definitely a fresh catch, grilled very well with spices. Same goes for the mahi mahi. Each costed around $25. 



Next time will try the crab.
author: Rush N.

description: My husband and I split the whole crab hot (you can get it cold too) and it was a lot better than we expected! Service was good and the food came out quick. When I hear "Eagle Cafe" I was expecting a dive but was pleasantly surprised. It was not too casual but not too fancy.  They also have bar-like seating along the water but it was too windy and in the shade by the afternoon. It's right off the main road at Pier 39 so easy to get to if you don't want to get caught up in all the crowds at the pier. Even late afternoon we had to wait about 20 min for a table for 2. Only main con for me is they have just one unisex bathroom so you may end up waiting awhile.
author: Jane N.

description:
Since they were busy they asked us if our party of 5 would consider the tables adjacent to the restrooms. No problem we said.

We waited maybe 10 minutes for them to set the table.  After we were seated we waited another 15 minutes for our server. 

Not ever seeing a server we left.  The hostess said "oh".
author: Endel J.

description:
BEST LOBSTER BISQUE IN SANFRAN!
Super tasty with real pieces of lobster. I've tried a lot of others and NONE compares to Eagle's.
author: Thais O.

description: If you are local and havent checked out this spot on Fishermans wharf, you are missing out! We were looking for either breakfast or brunch and it was just 10am...evwrything seemed so much different at pier 36 in the morning hours. Eveeythinh just opening and coming to life! So much fun to experience! We walked up to at least 4 different restaurants that both of us had been to before, they were all closed unfortunately...but fortunateky for us, we found this gem! :) The "finer dining" that was closed, ended uo being a godsend! We had the best waiter ever!!! We ended up tipping 50% we were so happy! This may not be your typical 5 star restaurant, but from the prompt seating, gorgeous view, delcioud food, exyremely fast and GREAT service, I once again wish there were more than 5 stars foe this outstanding experience! I orderrd the dungeness crab benedict, wow, soooooo delicious! I was even worried because I have recently had a regular benedict and it tasted like fish...no crab or anything...don't worry, 1 bite and it didn't eat it. So back to the view, You can see the sealions at sealion lookout, the golden gate, the bay, the people on the pier (if you get outside seating for sure)...I am in love and am  glad the regular restaurants we go to when we visit were closed, this was fabulous!!! If they are servicing the Dungeness crab cakes (maybe just during crab season), don't miss your chance!! ;)
author: Jasmine H.

description:
This restaurant was on point.  BY FAR the best meal I had in San Francisco. 

I ordered the basic egg with a side of french toast.  It was excellent.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, the breakfast potatoes were out of this world and the french toast. I don't even know where to begin with the french toast.  Probably top 5 I've ever had. 

Well done!
author: Ashley B.

description: Good service and the chowder was delish. I got 10 percent off with Yelp. They were pretty busy, but we got served super quick. It's a bit cheeper that most of the other restaraunts on the Pier.
author: Liz C.

description: Touristy but you will get a surprisingly delicious breakfast. The portions are extra large. I personally love the eggs benedict. The wait can get long here but it is worth it. If possible, sit by the window for a great view of the water.
author: K R.

description: Looking for oysters, stopped at Eagle Cafe  got 24 oysters for $40 and they were delicious. Great view from deck, others in our party got lobster bisque, fish and chips, and seafood salad and very satisfied.
author: Payton B.

description: The employees at this restaurant are so inept I will never ever give them a flipping dollar of my money strongly suggest nobody frequent this restaurant
author: Beth S.

description: Me and my fiance stopped by seeing that the hostess was very nice in the front and this spot offered 1.50 happy hour oysters.  Besides the hostess in the front whom sat us down; she was very friendly, the service was quite awful. Maybe because I am young or whatever it may be, I felt like they were staring at me the whole time I was there...awkward. Besides taking our orders the waiter never, never came back to check up on us. We also had problems with the asian guy at the bar who gave us a little attitude when we asked if we can possibly get the happy hour oysters at the tables. He said no and of course I paid for our table and then moved to the bar to get the oysters.The only reason why I gave them the 2 stars is that the food is fairly decent. I work in the sales and service industry so this is how I would rate their service for me today...
author: Phuong T.

description: Shared a dozen raw oysters with my gf. We both got food poisoning the day after. 3 days of fever, nonstop vomiting, and diarrhea.
author: Anthony C.

description: Grilled salmon was amazing (had a him of lemon)!!! Nice clean atmosphere. Building is small but cozy. Our waiter seemed to speak little English and didn't follow up with us.
author: Cassie B.

description:
This review is mostly for the service--specifically regarding the waiter named Rodolfo. 

The food was average--not bad, but nothing to write home about. I tried the crab salad sandwich, which is supposed to be one of the most popular items on the menu. There was way too much bread in proportion to how much crab salad you got. 

Now, for my review of the service.

I came up to this place with a few friends after doing some sightseeing, and after being greeted by a pretty decently friendly hostess, decided to try it. 

We were seated at a table and it was a few minutes before a waiter came over. He clicked his pen at us several times and asked us in a rude tone if we were ready to order. I asked him what flavor iced teas they have, and he responded, "I don't know..strawberry? raspberry? probably.." 

It took a while for our food to come out, and when it did, Rodolfo checked on us once after a few minutes, and then did not come around again for a while. When he did come over to refill my drink or to take plates away, he didn't even say anything. He just reached over us, grabbed our plates, and left silently. 


Overall, this place was just okay, but definitely did not meet my expectations. I'd suggest hiring better waitstaff if you're going to try to run a business in a very busy tourist area.
author: Jennifer M.

description: From the moment we had parked and started walking around, I knew I wanted soup in a sour dough bread bowl. I had lobster bisque, and it was my most favorite dish during my Cali vacation! Although the decor was ok, I bragged about their food my entire trip! Mmmm!!!
author: Linda K.

description:
Two words TOURIST TRAP.  My son and I wanted to get a taste of the dungenous crab that everyone was overpaying for so we decided to get the crab salad sandwich for $18.  They should call it the dishonest crab salad sandwich because there is no way the little bit of "stuffing mayo mixed with mystery meat" was fresh crab... Tasted like the weak tuna my wife makes...

Unless you're a foreigner with no concept of what an American tourist Trap is.... Save your money... Go inland to find a place that doesn't overcharge you for listening to dopey sea lions bark down the pier.
author: Sam T.

description: Awesome ranch dressing and great service!
author: Correy H.

description: Food was very good. Rating is based on incompetence - to a comedic level - of the servers on the outside bar. 3 different servers brought my hubby the wrong beer... over 2-3 minutes after we waited to order and were ignored by 4 servers for 15 minutes.  Yikes!
author: Jill G.

description:
It's a good thing this restaurant has an endless supply of tourist customers who don't know any better than to eat here.  If they had to survive strictly on the value of the food they serve, they wouldn't be around very long.

I ordered the fish and shrimp platter.  I will say the food came out very quickly.  The breading was very crisp, and the shrimp were huge, but the dish was devoid of any flavor.  It tasted like the breading was just flour and water.  The cole slaw it came with was mushy, absolutely no crunch, and entirely unappetizing.  For some reason I thought I might nibble on the lettuce garnish after, but it smelled more fishy than anything else on the plate.  I don't even want to guess at the reason for that.  

I will say that our server, Andrew was attentive and efficient.  But given the opportunity again I would go to Long John Silver and get a better meal for 1/5 the price.
author: Michael L.

description: Went in for quick lunch. Took a bit to get drink orders but food came our very quickly! Loved massive club sandwich and authentic clam chowder. Great tourist stop!
author: Shay F.

description: Terrific mimosas and great view with breakfast.  Veggie omelette and big egg meal and trimmings.   Service was prompt and friendly and can't beat the people watching and water view.
author: Rick R.

description:
Stopped in here with my young son during our outing to Pier 39 - we were both famished, and this place was nearby and got decent reviews. I've been craving a bread bowl of clam chowder for a while now, so Eagle Cafe seemed like a good bet! Sadly, it wasn't.

Pros: 
- The staff was uniformly polite and reasonably friendly, if a bit brusk
- Location was handy, with a good view of the marina area

Cons: 
- The clam chowder was tasty (chunky with potatoes and lots of clam), but the bread bowl was very hard and very, very cold - it must've been pulled straight from a fridge and had some hot soup slopped into it. It was so hard and so cold, I was hacking away at it with my dull butter knife, and really didn't enjoy it much at all. Nothing at all like the classic warm-n-fluffy sourdough bread bowls this dish is known for. 
- My son ordered the "pasta with butter and cheese sauce" from the kids menu, and what arrived was a plate of greasy plain spaghetti noodles and a little plastic Dixie-type cup of cold powdered Parmesan cheese. That's it. He ate it, but it was pretty lackluster. No "cheese sauce" to be found.
- We ordered a $7(!) chocolate malt to share, and while it was presented nicely (tall glass of malt + metal mixing cup with "extra" on the side), it hadn't been blended well at all, and there were large chunks of ice cream plus (even weirder) chunks of actual ice, all smashed into the bottom of the metal cup. It tasted okay, but wasn't even remotely worth the $7 - it felt like it'd been thrown together by someone who'd never worked a milkshake maker before. This milkshake will bring no boys to anyone's yard, ever.

My son was climbing the walls by the time our food was delivered, so I opted to not send anything back just in the interest of time, but in any other circumstance I would've (at the very least) sent the clam chowder back - the damn bread bowl was almost inedibly cold and hard, and basically ruined this classic San Francisco / Fisherman's Wharf dish. What a bummer.
author: Huxley D.

description: Service was fast and efficient. Had smaller edit but the bar service got us our chowder within maybe 2 minutes and rest of lunch right after. Chowder was great as was calamari.
author: Jason F.

description:
We have eaten breakfast here on our last two trips to San Francisco! 

The service and food presentation is impeccable. The food is delicious!! Of course, the Mimosas are perfect!!

This last visit on 10/24/15, we had to rush!! (We had Alcatraz tickets.) We could not have had better or faster service! They were not aware that we were in a hurry, but our food came out fast, and our waiter was very attentive! 

We love that they take the time to present the food like we are at a top of the line restaurant without the top of the line price! The fresh fruit and potatoes make this my favorite breakfast place!!

The crab omelet is my favorite!
author: Sarah B.

description: View outside is to die for. We had mixed grill and it was super. Mashed potatoes and slaw are fabulous. Food far superior to Fog Harbor which is where we are having lunch now.
author: Kathleen R.

description: I was there yesterday on Valentines day.  Food OK service terrible in my opinion.  My burger came three minutes before my wife shrimp poor boy so my food was cold when I started to eat it.  Hamburger was supposed to be medium and was extremely rare.  Waiter did not come back for ten minutes,  I asked for it to be cooked more.  All that they did was but the end that was cut in half on grill.  Rest of burger was still almost raw.  Waiter nice guy but never saw him.  I appreciate it is Pier 39 and they could care less if I am happy because they have captive audience.
author: Dennis M.

description: This place Dont even deserve a star but the hostess was extreamly rude....Maybe she thought we didnt speak english but I felt like she was being racist.....
author: William K.

description: Probably the best food I had while in san fran. My boyfriend and I only wanted a light lunch so we just got the garlic butter clams and lobster bisque. Both were delicious! Lobster bisque was a little on the sweeter side though. But the clams were amazing.
author: Joann K.

description:
Six co-workers and I just experienced one of the worst lunches we've ever had in SF. This goes beyond bad. It was inexcusably terribly horribly awful. I know what you're thinking, "Aaron, it couldn't have been THAT bad, could it?". Well let me tell you, it was. 

[begin rant]

We arrived at 12:30 on a Tuesday afternoon. We were seated right by the windows in front, which would have been nice if it weren't directly in the path of the bathroom line. They have two bathrooms, but one is marked "employees only, do not enter", which means that there is a constant line for the one available unisex restroom. I know because the people in line kept tripping over my chair leg. We asked if we could be seated elsewhere, but there weren't any other available tables.

The waitress that took our orders was extremely friendly and helpful, recommending which oysters were best today and helping our vegetarian friend find something on the menu he could eat. The Eagle doesn't apparently have many vegetarian visitors. His options were Cobb salad without the meat, or a BLT without the B (yes, that's an LT sandwich). They were kind enough to add some cheese to it.

Once we ordered, the drinks came quickly, and as soon as they were drained, they were refilled. This happened frequently, because by 1:45 (that's 75 minutes later) we still hadn't received our orders. There was no explanation, no apologies, just a reclusive waitress and a lot of grumbling stomachs.

After waiting over an hour, we had to return to the office and asked that our food be placed in to-go containers. 10 minutes later we finally got our orders.

Getting back to the office, we dug in. My $26 dungeness crab salad was inedible. A generous serving of fresh crab was suffocated by sweet mayonnaise dressing. This lay on a bed of sadly wilted greens, doused in a sugary vinaigrette. The entire salad had clearly been sitting under a heat lamp for at least 20 minutes, the wilted lettuce and mayo doused crab were both nice and warm.

To add insult to injury, there was no local discount offered, no apologies made for the severely botched lunch, and we were charged in full for our meal. The bill for the 7 of us? Over $200. And that's with no cocktails or wine (one guy ordered a beer, the rest of us sodas and iced tea), no dessert & coffee, just the lunch.

My coworkers swear they've got a killer Eggs Benedict. I'll never know. I will never EVER return to this place.

[/end rant]
author: Aaron M.

description: We came in because I wanted oysters, and they were delicious!! The crab melt was kind of bland though. Bartender was nice and have tips about the city. A bit expensive, but it's to be expected on peir 39
author: Jennifer J.

description: Food was amazing!!! However staff was no where close to amazing. We sat outside at the tables and had to go inside to find a waiter to wait on us. He finally showed up and we saw him twice, once when we order and lastly when we asked for the check. I was highly disappointed with the lack of customer service and the fact that they had one bathroom for the entire restaurant
author: Andrea M.

description: The clam chowder bread bowl was alright, definitely not the best (the little shack across from Musée Mécanique is still my favorite!). The atmosphere was great and the prices reasonable. Only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the service was very slow--and the restaurant wasn't very busy from what we saw in the dining area.
author: Jazzi M.

description:
I went here for Dine About Town and had an amazing dinner! Portions were large! I had the clam chowder to start which came out hot, just the way I like it. I had a choice between the ribeye steak, seafood platter, or 2lbs crab and of course, I went for the crab.  It was deep fried and coated with a sweet ginger sauce. The crab meat was cooked to perfection and it was very filling. Dessert was huge! A decadent, rich brownie with 3 scoops of vanilla bean ice cream. 

I would have never thought about coming here because I thought it was a touristy overpriced spot, but good thing it was participating in Dine About Town. I will come defintely come back! 

I have nothing to complain about Eagle Cafe. The wait staff was really friendly, attentive, and quick. It was a great atmosphere and the view of the wharf topped it off.
author: Lynn V.

description: The food and atmosphere was great! Nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the crowded streets. The staff was so nice and very attentive. Food was fabulous! We got burgers and spinach salad. Large portions and great quality.
author: Theresa B.

description: Had a great breakfast, fruit was a really nice touch.  I asked for wheat toast when ordering and was slammed down by waiter that I'm in San Francisco so sourdough was all I would get.  The only thing he didn't call me was stupid.  I am a tourist so why would I know that? Only one toilet and had to stand in line waiting and felt awkward.  If you want a view siting balcony as we sat inside and all people on the balcony blocked the view.  Great food xx
author: Joyce T.

description:
Used to be where "real people" went to get "real food". Now, just a gussied-up fancy pants place that has high aspirations and high prices but low execution.

The servers are great, though.
author: George T.

description:
Two words: food poisoning.

Thanks so much, Eagle Cafe!

In case you're wondering, I got the Dungeness crab Benedict.
author: Tram T.

description: Had bfast there and it was exceptional. Very fresh and our waiter could not have been better. I recommend the omelette with a side of pancakes
author: V H.

description: Came here this past friday for their happy hour. My date and i had an oyster each and also a margarita each. The prices were awasome especially for the pier and then we began to show food poisoning symptons. We couldnt put our figure on it and then thought about the fact that we hadnt even really eaten anything yet. Lucky we only had the one oyster each but my date had problems for a couple days after. I happily threw up the same day probably making it easier on my body for the next couple of days. Wont be coming here again sadly because the oysters were actually good.
author: Jackie B.

description:
Prices here are really high, even for being on Pier 39. This place is a tourist trap. 

I had the clam chowder (kind of tasteless and watery) and the fish & chips (bland, plain tasting fish that were overly salty). My friends' dishes weren't much better.

The environment and views were nice, but couldn't make up for the high prices and low food quality.
author: Ken S.

description: The hostess was so rude and did not care at all...I would not and wouldn't want other people to have the same experience....
author: Sarah N.

description: Perfect place to have brunch. Came here during a girls trip to San Francisco. I had the polish sausage w/ potatoes and eggs. If you like spicy foods you have to try it. It hit the spot after a night of drinking and dancing. My friends had mango mimosas which they said were delicious. Everybody was happy with what they ordered. Our waiter was very nice and super attentive.
author: Nay S.

description: Amazing food!! Highly recommended the Dungeness Crab Benedict and Corned Beef Hash!! Bartenders were helpful and amazing!
author: Jeremiah S.

description: This is my husband and I first visit here and we were not impressed! Food and drinks are way too over priced and service is not good! My spicy Bloody Mary was not good at all! They merely placed a jalapeño on the rim and called it a spicy Bloody Mary. The clam chowder wasn't flavorful and the oysters weren't the best. My husband ordered the fried mixed seafood and it just tasted like cheap fish and chips, again it was WAY over priced! I had to ask for our waiter numerous times and not once did anyone come check in on us. To top it off after receiving our check the waiter  tried pocketing a $25 tip and we had to ask for our change back! So ridiculous!! Not worth your time or money! Go somewhere else!
author: Crystal S.

description: Oysters are really huge and fresh. Tried their oysters and salmon angel hair - the tomatoes in the pasta were really fresh and tasty . Service can be a tad better though .
author: King Wai S.

description:
This is the only place in the world where a clear view of a penitentiary is a good thing. 

We were here on a Saturday so it was pretty busy with tourists and so on. We got seated almost immediately because it was just the two of us and my friend thought it would be a great idea to sit outside so we could see the happenings going on around the pier. The only downside to sitting outside was the chilly breeze. 

Our waiter was attentive and my burger was unexpectedly yummy. I guess I wasn't expecting much for the taste as most touristy "cafe's" tend to be hit or miss. 

The only big negative to this place is the restroom. There is only 1 shared bathroom for men and women. There is something yucky about a unisex public restroom !!! Needless to say the line forms to the left and takes forever. Why? Because most woman take forever. What's the reason for that? What the hell do they do in there? Seriously!

Nonetheless, this place is A-Ok.
author: M L.

description:
I'm surprised this place doesn't get slightly better ratings, but I figure that San Franciscans might deduct a star for anything on the touristy Pier 39.  (There really isn't much reason to visit Pier 39 other than a couple good restaurants and the view of the Sea Lions--the shops are a boring mix of typically touristy crap.)  

My wife and I enjoy the Eagle Cafe.  It has a nice location on the second floor of Pier 39 and is easy to get to at the base of the pier.  On a good day, sit outside and enjoy a great view up Fisherman's Wharf and of Alcatraz. The people watching from their deck is excellent!

The interior is spacious and clean.  Service has always been great.  We've mostly had breakfast here, and it never disappoints.  The portions are (too) huge and the food is consistently very good.  The omelets are great, and my wife absolutely loves their Crab Cake Benedict.  

If you don't mind paying a lot for parking, there is a structure with a pedestrian bridge that takes you right to the Eagle Cafe's front door.  But you can also frequently find on-street two-hour parking on Bay Street just two or three blocks away.

--------------------------

Updated: 10/2010

I had a very disappointing experience at the Eagle Cafe and felt I needed to reduce my rating.  (Note: I wanted to provide this feedback to them privately but their Web site fails to furnish any means for feedback or an email address.  So, because they do not allow private feedback, I guess I have to slam them here. Showing no interest in customer feedback in the era of social media is silly and harmful!)

My wife and I visited for lunch on Sunday, checked in with the hostess, and were told we'd be the next party of two seated.  As we waited patiently, another couple walked in and was seated at the bar (an option that was not offered to us and we would've taken.)

Then five minutes later another couple walked in, and again they were immediately seated.  At this point, I'm frustrated and ask the hostess what's going on, and she managed to compound the problem by arguing with me!  She said the second couple was being seated outside on the deck (yet another option that was not offered to us and we would have found preferable.)  

We walked out with the hostess still arguing to the back of my head.  Had this been my first visit, I'd have given The Eagle Cafe a one star, but since I've been there before and been happy with the food, I reduced my rating to three stars.  Bad service really annoys me, but arguing with a customer is just inexcusable.
author: Augie R.

description: I really liked this comfy feeling restaurant.  I didn't expect to like it so much since it was in a major tourist spot but food was good, drinks and staff excellent.  Great views from restaurant
author: Nancy L.

description:
Located in the Pier is a nice touch and the 20% discount we got from Yelp seemed to make things a lot better. Me my girlfriend and another couple went on a spontaneous dinner to this place because we heard good things about it and they offered 10% off.

The food we got was tasty. The clam chowder, the fish and other things that we ordered. I would probably come back to this place but without the check-in offer from Yelp the place seemed a little expensive. (Their floor was also very slippery).

They have a full bar so get your drink on!
author: Tim M.

description: Wasn't too happy about the food here. Wasn't bad but not that great. The coleslaw was really gross. The clam chowder was pretty good, the view is really nice and the service was fast. If you coming to visit Id come here and sit outside for the experience but that would be it.
author: Evita R.

description: Nice view from window of passing ferries. The fried Fishermans basket was definitely fried. The Samuel Adams beer was great.
author: Bryce M.

description: Fantastic breakfast. We ate breakfast here every day for the entire week that we visited San Fran. It was that good. Scenic location right on the waterfront. Great rustic atmosphere. Easily accessible by trolley car from Nob Hill hotels. Excellent menu choices. Clean.
author: Sam J.

description:
My friend and I wanted to eat outside on the
Pier - this was a great option. We sat and watched the morning unfold with propel coming and going. Outside seating was
Only bar style at the time we were there. But this was really nice.  The breakfast food was good too.
author: Amanda Q.

description:
I thought this place was good for a touristy place to eat.  The oyster shooters hit the spot and we topped them off with about 5 dozen orders of raw oysters and a seafood platter.

I would go back.
author: Jarrod F.

description:
I experienced only the bar part of the restaurant.  For the most part it was a pretty decent experience.  I'd say I was pretty passive about the service, but the oysters were fresh, well priced and the happy hour drink prices were definitely a good value.

Can't pass up $5 margaritas or $1.50 oysters!

Would definitely go back to experience the dining aspect based on our brief trip.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Everything is overpriced for their quality of dishes.

Small Fresh Oysters and nasty Fried Oysters.

Ordered a Coke in a glass with ice thinking about the strong taste of coke, but the taste was flat as a wall.  Following the coke, I ordered Ginger ale still hoping for the crisp taste. Nothing crispy about the Ginger ale either.

I took a sip of all my family member's (5) drinks as well, same flat taste in all drinks.  The only good thing about Eagle Cafe is the scenery and that they have a TV inside on Sports center.

I recommend going to another cafe, restaurant, or Oyster bar besides Eagle Cafe!  Save yourself some money and some time. I do not recommend this place at all!
author: Marvin P.

description: Hot whole crabs lobster bisque soup were good to go! They just gotta monitor their restrooms for cleanliness.
author: A M.

description: Eggs Benedict with crab was the best breakfast I've had in a long time. The portion size of crab in the meal was huge and walked out of the restaurant stuffed.
author: Paul O.

description: Great breakfast. Big portions. Yummy corn beef hash. PLACE WAS CROWDED so we ate at the bar. Sonja the bartender was AWESOME.
author: T. L.

description: The staff amd Manager were absolutley wonderful!  They accomodated 30 of us for my Mom's  80th bday!!  Thank you thank you!
author: Yvette H.

description:
Do not go here if your looking for even a decent dinning experience! 
Went out to the city with my friend  to have a fun day. I know that pier 39 is tourist central but thought "why not act like a tourist for a day and go there". We went for their happy hour oysters, drinks and a couple of entrees and desserts, but felt uncomfortable, unwanted and we were ignored. Server never greeted us nor even cared to take our drink order, but eventually when he showed up the first and only thing he said was "do you know what you want?". We had the overarching feeling that they didn't want to serve us because they assumed we were younger then we actually were. Anyways the only good thing was that the bartender saw how we were ignored for an unacceptable amount of time and then came over to take our drink order and then signal to the server to get over to our table. 
Bartender, I sincerely say thank you for that!
But sadly it wasn't enough for even a decent dinning experience, we just paid our tab for the drinks and left.
author: Andrew B.

description: Will try my best to balance the review. This place is on the second floor f the pier right across from hard rock. We came here because my girlfriend was dying for a burger and an associate in one of the stores on the pier said this place apparently has the best burgers. We decided to come check it out. The place kind of reminds me of a dinner I would find on the side of a highway. Feels kind of homy and dingy. White paper table cloths, only one bathroom and it was on the dirtier side. We ordered the hot crab appetizer and a California burger. The burger was mediocre, but this may be a reflection of the expectations set. The fries were awesome. They were thin and crunchy, like a much better version of McDonald's fries. The appetizer was not fabulous, at least not for $18 dollars. The server was super sweet and attentive. The drinks were on the strong side and the bartender was awesome. Overall the food and atmosphere aren't top notch.
author: Inna L.

description: Good Food, typical tourist area. service was fine and attentive. fish and chips, clam chowder very good, portions plenty. even cheeseburgers for grand kids were huge. all in all good and would return. very crowded on a Sunday.
author: Dino P.

description:
My husband and I come here every time we are in SF!
Looking out at the water while eating the BEST pancakes! Love eagle cafe.
author: Kimberly A.

description: Not good. The pancakes for breakfast were terrible. They weren't done properly, dry and very flat. They shredded raw strawberries in between and called it good. The syrup was in the oil dispenser bottles which was so hard to use, it wasn't even funny! The fresh orange juice made my bf sick and the skillet potatoes he had as a side dish were disgusting. Do not recommend this place, they seem to half ass stuff.
author: Elliott B.

description:
My family came to town and they had heard so much about the Eagle Cafe's clam chowder bowl.  We went there for lunch and we were very disappointed.  The clam chowder was really thick, like eating mashed potatoes and flavorless.  It was pricey too.

The waiter was rude, and their were flies buzzing around our food.  When I go the Pier and want to get my clam chowder fix I usually eat at the Fog Harbor.  I would recommend if you are trying to find the best clam chowder on Pier 39 you can't beat this place.
author: Bud F.

description: Food was excellent I had bacon, eggs, potatoes with a side of incredible French toast they served some really delicious fruit with it.
author: Nate D.

description: Absolutely BEST corned beef hash. I wanted more, but was shut down by the boss. We all loved the bacon.
author: Peter B.

description: I took my man here for his birthday because I love their oyster shooters. I have been before with my girls and STACEY took amazing care of us. I am so glad my boyfriend got to share the same experience. We are both in the service industry so we like going to severs we admire and respect. They are amazing!
author: Dalene N.

description: Worst food I have ate!  Crab cakes tasted like tuna.  Drinks were water down.  Terrible.
author: Kim S.

description:
Eagle Cafe is conveniently located on Pier 39 in San Fransisco and offers a great view of the bay along with a good hearty breakfast.

I had heard some mixed things about Eagle Cafe but I wanted to see for myself so I went Sunday morning before my flight home.

The restaurant itself is very  clean and as expected for being in the middle of a big tourist location it is pretty busy.

My meal consisted of banana and pecan french toast, country potatoes, fruit and 2 eggs over easy.  

The food was good but not great, my biggest complaint was the syrup was very thin and not super flavorful and the french toast was a little dry.

3 stars for A ok (not bad)
author: Shane H.

description: One unisex bathroom with a plumbers helper on the floor that looks older than the pilings in the pier, but otherwise clean. Pyramid Hefeweizen on tap tasted sour (from fermentation in the keg): please keep your kegs from getting warm enough to restart fermentation.
author: Jeremy M.

description: I was visiting SF and was looking for a good place to eat. Happy I stumbled onto this place! Had breakfast and came back another day for dinner!
author: Christina C.

description: I'm so bummed that this place has so many low reviews! My husband and I just had breakfast and it was fabulous. I had the dungeness Benedict (pricey,but the portions are huge!) and my husband had the corn beef hash. The hash was fresh and not over salty like most hash is. Everything came out a little on the lukewarm side, but I'm OCD about that anyways. The view is incredible and my mimosa hit the spot. I guess everyone can experience a negative no matter where you go......so take the bad reviews with a grain of salt. We had a wonderful experience and would go back in a heart beat.
author: Alexis B.

description: My hubby and I came here for lunch. We were seated right away - the speed didn't stop there. The waiter was constantly checking in on us even when it was very busy. We had a crab melt for our appetizer and it was DELICIOUS!!! Highly recommended. We had the clam chowder soup in bread bowl and that was yummy as well. Great experience here!
author: Allison E.

description:
I would fly to have breakfast at this place again!

It was delicious. Crab cake on english muffin with tomato and poach egg, spinach and potatoes on the side with fresh fruit. It just don't get no better than this. I took a picture of my half of the plate :)

Portions are super size!

We were there at a time when it was not very busy (middle of week after 10am). Our lovely waitress did an outstanding job. So very helpful in suggesting menu items and catering to our needs.
author: Paula C.

description: Shrimp omlette was very yummy. Suggest a side of bacon, thick cut and cooked perfectly.
author: Sarrie P.

description: Travis makes better Irish coffee than the burna vista!
author: Allison I.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE!!!!

Where do I begin? My boyfriend and I came here on a friday around 2 pm and should have known not to stay when we see every other restaurant is packed and has a waiting list but this place was not busy and took us right in. So my boyfriend sits down while I wait in line for over 15 mins to use the ONE bathroom they have. When I finally sit down my boyfriend tells me he wasnt acknowledged by anyone for 10 minutes. He then goes to the bathroom and after 5 minutes the waitress finally comes with our waters. Really? 15 mins for water! I ordered our food which came out 20 minutes later and was awful!!!! 

My chicken tenders tasted like fish and my boyfriends grilled chicken chipotle sandwich was DRYER then a hot summer day!!! Nothing but chicken with a little chipotle sauce on a hard loaf of french bread. No condiments on it at all.
