So my boyfriend asked for bbq sauce and the dude is sweating, all red like he just got the damn death penalty! He returns with the water down gross bbq sauce, when my boyfriend took a lil nibble he instantly started gagging!! The ranch was even gross! We didnt even eat half of our food!!

This place is such a dump that there was cut out white drawing paper covering the tables! When someone left they would crumble it up and place a new piece of paper down. Like really wheres the crayons to draw??

Overall this place is a joke!! Shitty service, food, and decor!!!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
author: April S.

description: We came here for breakfast, super expensive, the food was average at best. The service was below average.
author: Alex A.

description: Ordered the fish and chips and it was absolutely delicious! The wine and service was also great. Sit outside for a breath taking view. All is good at this restaurant where they take care of you.
author: J T.

description: This place serves an amazing breakfast. Grab a Crabby Mary while you enjoy the views. The wait staff are friendly and have a great sense of humor. The kids loved the wax paper over tablecloths to do their artwork. Portions are large and delicious.
author: Nina F.

description: Went it Pier 39 in hopes of seeing sea lions (we have a 2-year-old). Unfortunately, they are off mating or something. Boo!  Made the most of it and went to Eagle Cafe. Not bad!  Not wonderful. I would've really enjoyed my veggie omelet, but they put 3 really big slices of cheese (and not good, high quality cheese....more like a white version of American cheese) on top instead of real, shredded cheese. It was strange. My husband's French toast was yummy though!  And the bloody Mary's are delicious!
author: Tiffany J.

description: Always a favorite and a must stop when I visit San Francisco. The corned beef hash is homemade with a crisp texture. The blueberry pancakes were a huge portion and did not disappoint.  Service was prompt and friendly. Our coffee cups were never empty.
author: Kathy S.

description:
Nothing to see here folks. The atmosphere was boring. The service was ok. 
The food was just ok. My friend ordered the grilled Polish Sausage Breakfast platter, and as a pollock, I can promise you that it WAS NOT! It was so spicy - chorizo or something like it. 

But, if you have an early morning meeting at one of the offices nearby, and you need a warm place to duck into, crack open the laptop and order some food you will forget about as soon as you walk out - this place will do!
author: Stefan L.

description: My second time visiting this place. They have the best oyster shots I've ever tried so far. Also try their cream chowder soup in the bread bowl.
author: Ronald A.

description: Good food and good, attentive service. Pleasant, clean space, but the location is very touristy. The portion size was good for the price, but everything was fairly expensive, so I wouldn't come here very often. A nice place to take guests from out-of-town who want a tourist experience.
author: Anna B.

description:
I love benedicts and this place really knows how to make them. Some friends and I decided to order two benedicts to share, the salmon and the crab cakes. They were absolutely delicious! I favored the crab cake benedict more simply because I never had such a great tasting crab cake. It was creamy and didn't have too much bread crumbs. My only complaint is that the potatoes could've been cooked more to give it a little crunch.

This is more upscale than your average breakfast spot. I would not recommend bringing children. Two orders of benedicts, three mango mimosas and a bloody Mary was about $90. Pretty steep but I would come again.
author: Lisa T.

description: Love, love, love Eagle Cafe! Been here several times and I am never disappointed! Eggs Benedict, corn beef hash and two egg breakfasts are amazing!! Highly recommend!
author: Laura A.

description:
I had the Corn Beef Combo:  2 eggs, 3 bacon, 2 sausage, corn beef hash (home made....and maybe the best I've had...coming from Miami where the Rascle House made the best), fruit and bread.

Service was ok...took a bit to get my coffee refilled and water, but I would return.
author: Kenneth G.

description: I went here on Valentine's Day. The food there wasn't all that great. They had to over charged us when we didn't tip. Our waiter was rude and they were all over the place. Our food total was 89 dollars and when i check our transaction the next day and it was 105 dollars because we didn't tip WoW! I will never eat here again.
author: Stacy C.

description: Great portions, kind servers, awesome view! It was a great experience. Went there for breakfast on the day I proposed! We loved it.
author: Manwell R.

description: Had the soup breadbowl clam chowder.  Fair, but not really amazing.  Bread was also too thick and not that great.  Prices here are really really overpriced/tourist trap.
author: Alice S.

description: If you like your breakfast to appear delicious, this is the spot! and if you like your food to taste more bland than water, this is the spot as well. Breakfast was definitely not worth it. Can't knock their seafood as I haven't tried it, but man did this make the start of vacation a disappointment.
author: Saemlinh I.

description: Went here for a late breakfast because it was close to our hotel and I was feeling under the weather and we heard good things about it. They were able to piece together a vegan friendly meal for me -- I got potatoes with sauteed veggies on the side and an English muffin. Rather oily for my taste and expensive for what I ended up getting (potatoes, some sauteed spinach and bread) but I appreciated that they didn't give me a hard time and tried to accommodate. Also gave me hot water quickly (I had my own herbal tea bag because yup, I was that girl). Beautiful view and nice waiters, if not particularly friendly. Also were cool about the fact that a couple of friends met up with us while we were eating and didn't order anything.
author: Karen M.

description: Best breakfast I've had while in San Francisco. I had the steak and eggs breakfast with a side of French Toast. Everything was well cooked and beautifully presented. I sat at the bar and received good service.
author: Renee W.

description: Wow the food was awesome!!!! ..... But! They screwed up bad! All 5 of us ordered our food they brought 4 of 5 orders and the server did not let us know that our other plate was working or it was coming right now. So guess what we did... We waited until the last plate came out so we can all eat together... Guess what happened next? Nothing the food never came out lol. Now that's ok people screw up and make mistakes I get it but when we presented this issue to the restaurant the server started blaming other people and told us that someone else should of brought our food and that he can't believe that they didn't. Now my Pepsi was empty the entire time during my visit. He did not come by our table once until we walked up there and asked them for our food. Long story short our food never came out and we never received it and they didn't gave two f*** about their service to us.  As you can tell I don't write reviews and this made me come on here and let the people know how careless you are. Thanks for reading
author: Freddy R.

description: Great fish and chips!!!  The tarter sauce was delicious. Friendly and helpful staff.
author: Larry T.

description:
My favorite part of San Francisco so far.
This cafe overlooks Alcatraz, and has  a great little bar outside for sunsets and cocktails.
The appetizer menu was laden with seafood delites. I had the crabcakes and a Manhattan and got to people watch from above and I loved it.
The crowd is indicative of San Fran tourists on the wharf...but not so crowded.
I really enjoyed the experience and the vibe here and will go back again and again.
author: Sherri K.

description: I have eaten here before - it was great!  Today we are having eggs that look over cooked.  My son ordered an omelette.  It's eggs cooked flat covering whatever he ordered.  Weird
author: Linda G.

description:
This rating is mostly attributed to our server Carolyn. 

On a whim my cousins and I decided to come to pier 39 for calamari. I suggested this place since it serves one of the best calamari I've ever had. I'll give them that and on that note we weren't disappointed. Other than that our other dishes were not outstanding. We ordered a fried fish sampler and the selection choice of fried seafood was odd and not very appealing. I also ordered a Bloody Mary. The flavor was dull and not spicy enough.

When we sat down we first felt rushed when trying to select our orders. When we did decide, I asked if the "fried" fish sandwich could be grilled instead of fried. But our server snappily replied "It's a fried fish sandwich." I then opted for soup and salad forgetting the idea completely. After we finished our calamari appetizer, our server failed to clear the table for our main courses proceeding to crowd the table with our dishes. Luckily the three of us were seated at a four person table for I piled up our used dishes on this place setting. Even after this effort was made by me, our server did not take the initiative to clear the table. We felt crammed. Our server was not every attentive either and it took numerous attempts to grab her attention. 

This restaurant offers a 10% discount when checking in on yelp, which is a great! However, when I asked to use it our server seemed annoyed and I even overheard her say "we have some yelpers here" to her co-workers. I was offended. 

I hope this is just deviant from this restaurants norm considering other good reviews. I did really like the calamari and would try it again if only I have a better server.
author: Erin D.

description: Recommend this place! Was looking for a place that was quiet, oppose to a place like Chowders (since I was on a mission to find my mom a place with great clam chowder) at Pier 39 on a busy Sunday afternoon and I found this place to be just that. Casual and chill. Great service and nice atmosphere. I recommend their lobster bisque and fish & chips.
author: Jasmine V.

description:
Thanks Eagle Cafe! In a touristy neighborhood on a wet Sunday morning you pulled out the stops and served us touristics clam chowda in a bread bowl at 10 am when no one else would.

Granted, the chowder needed salt, but it was definitely not bad. And the bread bowl was the beautiful sourdough that SF is famous for. And our server was like sunshine on a cloudy day.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Holy Smokies! 

The breakfast is amazing! And the Bloody's Mary's--top notch ;)
The view from the outside patio is so beautiful & relaxing. The interior is very open & fresh with wood floors and white walls. The waitresses are on it!! Couldn't have asked for a better experience.
author: Vanessa X.

description: Had the chipotle chicken sandwich, lobster bisque and oysters, oh yeah and some screwdrivers. Everything was great. I would recommend outside seating with view of pier
author: Robert N.

description:
Grabbed some to-go so we would be able to watch the Blue Angels from a rooftop and much to our surprise Eagle Cafe had BEST Calamari I have ever had. It was seasoned to perfection...In addition to the calamari, we also ordered two chowder bowls. The chowder was definitely up there in the rankings(8 outta 10....I've had real Boston Chowder, so nothing can compare) This place is in a great location and has an awesome patio if you would like to sit outside as well. 

The waitstaff are very friendly and courteous and helpful. This place is for sure a 8.25 outta 10 for restaurants on the pier.

**This place on a Sunday for brunch is AWESOME!!
author: Hillary H.

description: Ate dinner there on Thursday evening.  Service was fine.  Food was ok and prices are what was to be expected. Chose this place because it was quieter than other places. Plenty of fries with the food.  Daughter had the grilled mahi mahi was good.
author: Anne L.

description: The breakfast is great and service is pretty good. Super busy on the weekends and only one bathroom. If you ask for a glass of water check for "floaties" as we sent ours back two times and finally got one with no ice that had no "sea monkey's".
author: Jim B.

description:
So, as I can tell from the lack of reviews for this spot from any actual San Franciscans, I'm sure this place is skipped over by most the locals with their "I'm better than you" mentality that this place is only a tourist spot and nothing more.  Yes, I was a tourist when I tried this place, but it was damn good by any standards (get over yourselves Yelpers from San Francisco who all think they are professional food critics).

We went here on a Saturday morning and had one of the best breakfasts ever: peanut butter and banana french toast!  To whoever invented this incredible combination of some of the greatest foods of all time, I thank you sir (or madam), because you made my trip to San Francisco better.  I would come back to this city just to eat this meal again.

Not only is the french toast here awesome, but their corned beef hash is the best ever too.  It made canned corned beef hash taste like dog food in comparison (and I've always liked canned corned beef hash).  Additionally, the mango mimosas they have at Eagle Cafe are the best alcoholic breakfast beverage ever (not counting beer, which is great any time of the day).

The service here was also great, with our waitress topping off my coffee before it ever got less than half full, even after I was so full that I couldn't stand to look at it anymore.

The only reason I can't give Eagle Cafe five stars, is that the day before we ate breakfast there, we went there for lunch at 11:45 AM.  When we sat down we were given breakfast menus.  I asked for a lunch menu and was told they don't start serving lunch yet.  Really? what kind of restaurant doesn't have lunch at lunchtime?  Maybe they cater to slackers that sleep in all day and eat breakfast until 2 in the afternoon.

Anyways San Francisco, get over yourself and your fear of tourism and come out and try this awesome breakfast spot.  There won't be any other locals in there anyways so you won't have to worry about being seen by other elitists and losing your indie cred.
author: Jake K.

description: We were in a hurry and needed to eat dinner in less than an hour. We spotted Eagle Cafe... I was in the mood for seafood and decided to dine here.  We were seated by a window and had an awesome view of the bay and boats.  I ordered the grilled tilapia accompanied by a nice glass of red wine. The dish came with delicious, creamy, mashed potatoes.   I was very satisfied with my choice.  Our server was friendly and quick.  We even appreciated that the manager checked in on us a few times.
author: Liz O.

description: Had lunch here today. Had a great meal and a great view. Crab salad sandwich was amazing and my husband had the famous fish sandwich which was also delicious. tip- oysters are pretty small. And don't sit by door on a chilly day.
author: Mae B.

description: Good service, excellent lobster bisque! Don't forget to check in when you get here, they give you a 10% discount!
author: Amy E.

description: Great food Great Service Love This Place the Calamari and fish and chips were both great
author: Todd O.

description:
The lobster bisque was amazing. Bloody mary's I didnt like at all (dont order it)
The burger was large and the fries are amazing!!
author: farah b.

description: The food is delicious and the outdoor seating has a beautiful view of the pier! Our server, Stacey, was attentive and very friendly!
author: Monica P.

description: We had such a bad expierence at the Crab House we decided to try this place out.  Our server Sarah was great and the food was amazing.  Really nice manager Mario took great care of us.  Will stop by next time in San Francisco.
author: David O.

description:
Great breakfast!  Great service!  Great atmosphere!.....again.

Thick cut bacon, real potato hashbrowns, eggs were great, sourdough toast was tasty, strawberry pancakes were fantastic, and the coffee was on par with Starbucks.  Top marks from me.

I really enjoy the atmosphere here.  Back again soon.
author: Laine D.

description: Came in here for some celebratory mimosas on a Saturday morning. My fiancé and I sat at the bar, drank some delicious original mimosas (they have a few varieties) and chatted with the very personable bartender/oyster shucker.
author: Summer F.

description:
YUMMY!!!!!

Calamari - THE BEST. It's so good. Probably the best I've had.

Oysters - This was my first experience with an oyster. Although I could tell that it's very very fresh here, I realized that I'm not an oyster person. They have freshly grated horseradish to go with this.

Mahi mahi fish and chips - This was good. I loved the garlic fries that came with it. The fish pieces were a little thin for my taste and it ended up being a little dry for me.  I enjoyed the regular fish and chips better.

Fish and Chips - This was more moist and flaky in my opinion. I enjoyed this more, but sister's BF enjoyed the mahi mahi more. I guess it's personal taste.

Spicy Shrimp - I don't really know what this was called on the menu, but those shrimp were HUGE and spicy. Parentals enjoyed this one a lot.

Altogether I feel this restaurant is legit. The owner gets the seafood fresh every day and it is so delicious. What a great way to start our vacation!
author: Beverly T.

description:
The breakfast here is pretty good.  Their portions are huge and the food is fresh.

You should definitely check out their corned beef hash.  Pretty damn tasty and "home-made" fresh daily.  Full of flavor and has a great crunch on the outside after chillin' on the skillet.

Their omelettes are pretty good.  Just the standard stuff you get at breakfast joints.  Ie: Veggie, shrimp, mushroom.

Service is great.  Attentive and aware.
author: Chai S.

description: The food presentation was incredibly wasteful. Plastic cups and huge leaves of kale. Slow service and overpriced.
author: Megan S.

description: Had an excellent lunch. Triple decker blt, dozen oysters, and a long island. All were great. Although it is clearly a tourist location with tourist prices it is clearly a gem. The drinks were great, mom ordered a mudslide and it was just awesome. Wish I had enough room left to order one for myself. I give four stars for the service and the food. My only criticism is the shucking, a little more experience or gentleness is required,  no one likes pieces of shells.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
First off, the service was mediocre at best. After ordering a round of waters our party decided we wanted cocktails as well. When the waiter came by to take our dinner orders he didn't stick around long enough for us to place our drink orders and didn't come back until he was serving our meals.

The food was also mediocre and what we we received was over-priced and didn't match the menu description.

A disappointing night out.
author: Kelsey A.

description: The view looking out onto the water is beautiful. The Fried Fisherman's plate was delicious and it's definitely kid friendly which Was ideal for our group including for kids! The staff was great and Ivan out server was friendly and accommodating. We'll definitely be back!
author: Jess M.

description:
My boyfriend and I stopped in here for food and drinks shortly after arriving in San Francisco. It may have just been due to the fact that I was so thrilled to be in California, but I enjoyed the place quite a bit. 

The inside was pretty typically, but we scored a seat outside overlooking the water- perfect. Definitely sit here to make it worth your while.

The drinks were absolutely delicious. I had an orange crush, which tasted somewhat like a sweeter orange mojito, and then a mango mojito- i downed both, they were some of the best I've had. Average prices- about 10$ each.

We got the spicy shrimp appetizer. You can order by the pound or half pound- we got a half and downed it. Very spicy and absolutely delicious. It came with bread to sop up the sauce, which was definitely the right idea. We also ordered the lobster bisque in a bread bowl- maybe a little overpriced, but super tasty.

For entrees, I got a house salad and my boyfriend got the crab salad sandwich with fries. We enjoyed both very much- lots of crab in the crab salad.

The service was a little slow, but if you're sitting outside in the sun, who cares? The servers were very friendly.

After we ate, we sat inside at the bar and had oysters and oyster shooters. At happy hour, oysters are 1.50 each- not too bad, and the bartender was very nice.

This place might not have anything mind-blowingly original, but if you want some tasty seafood and a nice viewpoint, check it out.
author: caley t.

description: Delicious drinks, yummy food and good service. You'd expect it to be a tourist trap, but the food is much better than you'd expect and the serving size leaves you undoing a button or two.
author: Cindy D.

description: We shared a plate with everything on it. Fried. I now know I don't care for fried oysters or salmon. The only bad thing is the waiter wasn't very attentive.
author: T C.

description: Very good food, easy fun atmosphere. The service was excellent. Very attentive. Kept checking on us to see if we needed anything. I expected a tourist trap and instead it was a nice relaxing place with good food and good service that just happens to be at Pier 39 in San Fran. Good choice to hang with a date or even go with kids. It was a nice afternoon.
author: David W.

description: The raw oysters were a bit small. Wasn't really worth the price. The calamari had delicious breading. And the crab salad dressing was delightful.
author: Denise L.

description:
Nice but very slow service for a half empty restaurant.  Food quality was underwhelming as expected given that it's a tourist trap. Food is pricey for the poor quality. 

French fries were good though.
author: Bayarea K.

description: The malted strawberry milkshake was excellent and what really brought together my cod fish sandwich was the hot sauce and tartar sauce combination. The cod itself was lightly fried and very delicious. Skinny fries were good, too, but could have used more seasoning. Pretty good for a touristy place since I'm a tourist and all hahaha...
author: Chad L.

description: I like this place. I have been to this restaurant a few times. One of my favorite places in San Francisco is Fishermen's Wraf were there is so much to see and do. So I take my friends who come from other places to visit to the Wraf. Well this restaurant happens to be the most visible and I just liked everything I tried in this place. The beer, oysters, clan chowder soup and even the burger. So go to this place with the intention to win and don't worry about prickly Yelpers who usually get it wrong. I am with you in sprit. Be brave and ignore the temptation to go along with group think.
author: Ali B.

description: Overpriced touristy spot, but the food's good and it's in a convenient location.
author: Lisa T.

description: We stumbled in because we had time to kill before the tree lighting. Plus there wasn't a wait. The dinner menu was small and the usual price for seafood at the wharf.  We ordered a lobster bisque bread bowl which really good accompanied by a nice cold beer. The wait staff was nice and I got to use my 10% discount.
author: Janelle M.

description:
Met some out of town friends who were staying nearby here for breakfast. I ordered the 2 eggs, which came with potatoes, bacon and toast. 
OK, so the eggs were ok, the bacon was actually pretty good (thick and crisp) but the potatoes were bad, mushy and flavorless and the toast?? a hamburger bun with a sprig of rosemary jammed in the top. Really? 
The fruit that came on the plate (a slice of melon and some orange) looked unappealing. 
Also there were some strange garnishes, like what looked like several strands of dried spaghetti... really? 
The view is great, the coffee was good, but I would skip this place for the breakfast food! Perhaps their lunch is better.
author: Nina W.

description: Came here last Friday with my BF and 2 year old son. It was a nice enough place. An employee greeted us at the door and led us directly to a table which was nice. I was a bit underwhelmed by the interior of the restaurant, not sure what I was expecting but it seemed to be a bit plain. Our waiter was a nice young man who was very attentive to us. The food, like most things at pier 39 was a bit on the pricey side. My BF enjoyed his Po boy sandwich and the fries were tasty although upon first glance, they appeared bland. My burger however, was undercooked for my liking. When ordering, I wasn't asked how I wanted it cooked and didn't think to mention it. The result was that I got a burger which was much too pink for me. I was a bit disappointed, especially since the burger cost $12 but didn't notice until I had actually taken a bite. Overall, we were satisfied with our visit here but I don't think I'll be in any rush to return. During our next Pier 39 visit, we will likely try out a different eatery.
author: Vanessa S.

description: My parents were in town and my dad wanted his last lunch to consist of crab! We chose the eagle car because two of the four of us don't eat crab and they have a very wide variety on the menu. They also have outdoor seating and would allow our dog on the patio. They even brought her water without us having to ask! Anyway, my dad started out with raw oysters and loved them. For our entrees I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with a side of greens instead of fries my husband ordered a fried cod sandwich with fries. The sandwiches were HUGE and there was so much chicken breast on it. The side of greens was soooooo delicious. My husband loved the sandwich and the fish wasn't too fried. My mother ordered fried oysters and said they were the best fried oysters she had ever had. And she's had them a lot of places including different countries! My father ordered a huge dungeness 3 pound crab and absolutely loved it. He ate every single bite. Aside from the great food, the view was very beautiful.
author: Kelsey K.

description: This was our second visit to Eagle Cafe. Both times were very enjoyable. The first we got to order breakfast and both the crab cake Benedict and the pancakes were awesome! This past week, it was our first stop from the airport with my parents and the beginning of our Napa Valley vacation. My father's only request was to eat seafood at Fisherman's Wharf. The food was great! He and mom had fried shrimp and oysters that they both loved. We all shared raw oysters that were so fresh and yummy. I had the lobster bisque in the bread bowl and I had to fight everyone off of it it was so good. My partner had the salmon salad with blue cheese and walnuts and it was fantastic. Everything just tasted so fresh and the service was impeccable. I will always recommend this place and return there myself.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Arrived at the Eagle Cafe for a quick drink after a long day of walking with the hope of having a good experience. I have never been so angry to spend money anywhere!!

There was one bathroom that men and women had to share and the wait was 30 minutes. When it was finally one's turn to use the bathroom, they were welcomed by a disgusting fecal mess and toilet paper everywhere...disgusting!

We sat at the bar to have our drinks and I had to hail the bartender to order. When he came over to get our order, he was very rude and non-conversational. The drink was poorly made and I think I may have ordered a glass of soda with a splash of whiskey for $9.00.

As I was sitting at the bar and drinking my beverage I watched the bartender start to shuck some oysters. I watched him do this for several minutes and I observed two disturbing incidents where he found an oyster that had split itself already and had been sitting exposed since we had been there. I then saw the bartender start shucking oysters, stop to wash the counter with a bleach rag, and then promptly begin shucking again without washing his hands. 

I had to hail the bartender again to pay for our drinks and promptly left this horrible establishment!!!
author: Wilhelm S.

description: I have to say I was excited to eat at a historic sf eatery.  When we got there, we got seated outside on the windward side of the building to freeze our asses off at a little railing that was built out of little more than a couple 2x6's. This should have been foreshadowing of what was to come. The iced tea we ordered tasted like it had been sitting for a day or 2.  The French fries we got with the eagle burger were cooked in the same oil as their calamari so they tasted like squid. Don't get me wrong, I love calamari. But not when it's got the consistency of a French fry and is dripping with ranch, not so much. The burger made my pregnant wife so violently ill, I contemplated taking her to urgent care.Thankfully the staff comp'd our meal, but I won't go back. There are many places to eat on pier 39, the eagle shouldn't be on the radar.
author: Steve F.

description:
Retro building overlooking the pier area. We had lunch there today and the dining room was nice with white table cloths and butcher paper on top.
The Crab Salad sandwich was large and very good, the roll was awesome. My wife had the Clam Chowder in Bread bowl and she loved it. We had some oysters on the half shell; they were good, small and OK, not outstanding.
Parking bridge comes right into the restaurant so it is a convenient location.
I'd recommend it.
author: Craig S.

description:
My friend and I went here whenever it was pretty busy. Despite it being so busy, we didn't have to wait very long for any sort of service. The noise level was pretty high, especially given how close together the tables are. It's definitely not a place to go if you want any level of privacy, but the food is delicious, so that makes up for it.

Oddly, though, they were out of clams when we visited. Somewhat disappointing for my friend.
author: Kevin B.

description:
3 stars are just for view, atmosphere and service.
food soooo bad.
My husband and I had breakfast here. i had eggs benedict, he had pancake.
the dominant taste of eggs benedict was Vinegar!!! too small eggs, too little hollandaise sauce that muffin was dry and half empty!! besides vinegar, no other taste.
Pancakes were not fried enough...just like cooked dough, heavy.
author: Neda M.

description: The food and service were both good. A few things though, my french toast would've been better without it being drenched with butter and although the waiters came back and checked on us, they never asked if I wanted more water. I was going to ask after they came around again, but figured forget it since we were going to leave anyway. My nephew ordered the 2 egg basic breakfast which came with a ham, toast, potatoes, and a side of fruit. I also tried my sister's omelete, which was delicious. Big portions...very filling.
author: Nani V.

description:
Headline: Aweome Breakfast in a Tourist spot

I'm staying down at Fisherman's Wharf this week - definitely a tourists spot.  As a result, I wasn't really expecting much from the food.  We noticed this place was open for breakfast the previous night and decided to give it a go.  It's on the Embarcadero end of Pier 39.

Contrary to the stats above, this place was open at 7:30am, which is good, because I'm here working, not sight seeing.  We were sat immediately - the place was empty, and offered coffee - a perfectly wonderful flavorful coffee (no starbucks burnt taste here) - that I wanted to refill several times.

I ordered the corn beef hash.  This was an overstuffed plate.  The garnish included orange slices, watermelon wedge and fried angel hair pasta (which is new).  The "edible" components included breakfast potatoes - large amounts of paprika in this, the eggs, and the "home-made" corn-beef hash.  The hash was crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside, and seasoned well.  The eggs were made just the way I like them, and the potatoes actually had some flavor.  In addition, there was a local bread roll that was huge.  No butter on the table, but thats a small problem.

My wife went for the salmon benedict.  The salmon was perfectly cooked, the spinach raw (I would have preferred it steamed and wilted), One of the eggs was perfectly cooked, but the other was over-cooked.

Service was excellent - friendly and fast - just what you want out of a breakfast place.

This place is worth the trip down to Pier 39.
author: Adrian H.

description: I really enjoyed everything about this place! Atmosphere wasn't too fussy despite the touristy location. The drinks were delicious; I got a pina colada and a bloody mary (the bloody mary garnishes were gourmet, definitely worth going back for!). Quality of the oysters were excellent. And there's nothing like the giant, creamy, well-seasoned bowl of Lobster Bisque when that cold fog rolls in off the bay in the middle of a warm spring day. Next time I'm in town I plan to come around again. Yum!
author: Ellen M.

description: We had breakfast at Eagle cafe Wednesday morning, the place was not crowded. We opted to sit outside since it was nice and warm, and the views were amazing. Since we picked the place for the view, I had fair hopes for the food quality, and I was ready for the price tag. I ordered the Dungeness crab eggs benedict and my husband the steak and eggs, both were delicious! We got our parking validated ($8 value) so overall it was an Ok deal and we'll worth the experience
author: Marion M.

description: Very good clam linguini, had seats even at 7 pm on a Friday. Angel hair pasta was a bit al dente
author: Isaac Y.

description: We will definitely go back. Pleasantly surprised.  Great eggs Benedict, very good coffee, great omelettes. Plus, we liked the Old SF atmosphere inside.  It's light and bright.  This is not what we expected on Fisherman's wharf, so it was a nice surprise.
author: Polly S.

description: Busy little location but an absolute must if you are coming to San Fran. Highly suggest the Bloody Mary and the peanut butter and banana stuffed French toast. Service very quick. On pier 39 it is one of the first places you hit. Great for breakfast or lunch but watch out they don't serve both all the time. They serve breakfast up till bout 1130. Also a must try is their corn beef and hash. Made fresh there with wonderful flavor and even a hint of sweetness.
author: Alexander S.

description: Decided to come here because it was one of the restaurants on the list to receive 1 hour of free parking. We had a group of 7 and surprisingly there was no wait. The atmosphere was decent so I expected good things from this place. I believe the food is way overpriced for nothing special. My friend ordered the vegetarian omelet and it wasn't worth it. I have had a better omelet at the local Denny's for much cheaper. The only credit I will give was the food presentation. This place is just ehh.
author: Ian K.

description:
Lunch here was great. Very good service. Wonderful experience. 

Sourdough bread bowl clam chowder was delicious. California burger good as well. Nice, clean atmosphere. Recommended.
author: Jere J.

description:
You find yourself at Pier 39 and you need to eat lunch, the Eagle is a great option. Located right upstairs in the front of the pier. 

Sandwiches, salads and some selections from the sea. 

Tip: check in on Yelp and there may be a discount for you. When I went it was 10% of our meal.  Thank you Yelp for saving me almost $4! 

Can be crowded. Not sure if it is worth a long wait.
author: Coral H.

description: The clam chowder was magnificent. Plenty of clams and red potatoes as they were perfectly cooked. It wasn't a thick cream like most chowders, it was more of a soup it was great and I'm picky about chowders. And what made it even greater was the fantastic service. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Donna G.

description:
The view here is great and the food is good but the service was pretty bad.  Our waiter didn't write down our orders.  Maybe 20 seconds after ordering he walked back over to us to confirm the order.  Thankfully when the food came out it was the right order.  

I felt the serving sizes were pretty good and the prices were fair.  When it was time to pay the check though they messed up twice.  First they charged me for the wrong table.  A table that had a bill twice as much as mine.  The second time they didn't give me the 10% yelp check in discount.  They got it right the third time though so that must have been the charm.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Four stars NOT for the food, but for our server, Shannon. 

The food was average. I had their lobster bisque for lunch. Creamy and heavy, but the lobster bits were a tad bit over cooked. 

Crowded place on a weekend. We had to wait a few minutes to get a table. But that's understandable.
Had we not has Shannon as a server we would have walked out. She's on spot, great personality and meedless to say she was able to turn our frowns upside down. 

Did Mention the 10% off when you check in on yelp? Over all it was a so-so experience with the food, but great customer service.
author: Bianca V.

description:
The Eagle Cafe has a special place in my heart....even way back when it was just a small cafe on the corner of the upstairs entrance of Pier 39.  When I was pregnant with our first son, my hubby used to buy me blueberry pancakes on Sundays.

These pancakes were the size of the plate itself - sometimes overlapping!  They were incredibly fluffly and light.

Since then, we've reacquainted ourselves with the Eagle Cafe....now remodelled, bigger - and better menu!

We like to get their salmon benedict.  It's a generous filet of salmon, grilled, topped on a bed of sauteed spinach, tomato, pouched egg and smothered with hollandaise sauce. They serve it with an English muffin and homestyle potatoes. 

this is one breakfast of champions!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: I usually avoid eating at tourist areas but when you get outvoted 3-1 you do what you must. The place was packed as you'd expect during the summer but our  wait was short. Using the 10% off coupon from yelp was a nice bonus.  In ordered a salad with fish and really enjoyed it. Fish wasn't overcooked which is always a plus. Started with oysters and they were really good. So when I'm back and need to eat by wharf I'll give it another shot
author: Carl G.

description: A mixed bag.... Food was quite good, but the service was abysmal. It was like we weren't even there. Had to ask for coffee refills twice, didn't see our server (Carolyn)  for over a half hour. We were left to fend for ourselves with the busboy. The worst service ever, and they weren't even really busy. Could be a good spot with a little staff fix up. One coed bathroom in the place, a long line the whole time there. Steer clear...
author: Rick T.

description: Love the Eagle cafe, huge bread bowls of clam chowder, incredible fish and chips and super fresh oysters!
author: Shannon T.

description:
Mr took me to Pier 39 past Saturday around 2ish.

Checked out Eagle's Cafe, mainly because we craved for some oysters & clam chowder. Also it seems like their price is a bit reasonable.

We didn't expect for the price to be cheap since it's located in one of the major tourist spots in the City.

Our server was friendly and efficient. We ordered my fav. Kumamoto only to find out they are out. The only oysters they have left were Fanny Bay & Chesepeke so we settle for whatever they have left. Fanny Bay was ok but I like Chesepeke coz it's sweet.

We settle for fish & chips, like it. It was crispy on the outside but middle part of the cod fish was juicy and tender.

Also try the Crabby Mary Bloody Mary - love it! Don't mind paying for $18, the crab meat were overflowing.
author: jubi l.

description: The hamburger was good, so were the fries. The spinach salad was so sweet, better order it for dessert. I would have  skipped writing a review, if it wasn't for the waiter, who had way to much attitude and made us regret having gone to this place.
author: Lisa M.

description: Clam Chowder was fine. But what I really loved here were the oysters. They were so fresh and tasted really good!
author: Angela B.

description: The Bloody Mary here was great! I had that combo breakfast, my man friend, Mimi, had the corned beef hash and the salmon Benedict. The potatoes here are terribly flavorless and undercooked. The corned beef was okay. THE SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE. Our server mumbled the whole time and never checked on us. The poached eggs for the salmon Benedict came out rock hard when we asked for soft poached eggs, and our server went to the kitchen and started talking smack about us so the kitchen staff threw HELLA SHADE AT ME. And hell no I didn't back down! I kept glaring back until the kitchen staff looked away in defeat. Overall, it's a nice spot with decent food, but the people who work here truly don't care about their patrons.
author: Esther K.

description:
They're known for their friend stuff so we did it.
No regrets, I'd do it again.

Their batter on the fry was just really good.  We had the fish and calamari.  Probably the best calamari I've had before.  

Calamari with fish and chips.  Not something to do everyday but a nice treat.
author: Daniel T.

description: Great food and very friendly service. Fish and chips were crunchy and warm. Dungeness crab was fresh and tasty.
author: Rob R.

description: My cousin from Italy visited the states for the first time and we took him here. He loved the meal. I had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and we shared the calamari appetizer. Both were delicious. The calamari was the best I have ever had. A little pricey but what do you expect?
author: Aaron B.

description:
Was just in SF last weekend... and of course - back to Eagle Cafe we go! Got to meet the owner this time and she is such a sweetheart! Feels like family everytime we come up there. 

Tried their NEW Garlic Butter Crab this time... in addition to our usual Salt & Pepper Garlic.... OMG... YUMMM. The garlic butter crab was soooooo good. even dipped our bread in that stuff afterwards! 

Tried the calimari for the first time and it was DELISH. The batter was good and just enough. and the calimari were solid calimari pieces. 

Clam chowder was good as always and my husband ate the oysters on half shell and really enjoyed that. 

sigh... salivating as I write this. We came in for brunch for the soup on Saturday aroud 1030am... it got crowded fast! by the time we came back for lunch at noon... it was packed and little bit of a wait for a table. Lunch starts at noon on Saturdays tho... so that's good to know because we were craving that Crab in the morning already!
author: Linh N.

description: Bisque in bread bowl was good but not great for the price. I've had better in Denver for god's sake. Service was incredibly slow but decently friendly.  Unless you have a very specific crave on, skip it.
author: Jenn H.

description:
This place may be marked for being a tourist junction, but hey, we were tourists in the for weekend so we figured "what the hell!" And it lived up to the hype!

The location is lovely, as during our sunny morning breakfast we overlooked the water. The service was good, not overly friendly or super great, but good and not rude so i suppose thats a good thing?

 i had the strawberry pancakes and they were amazing....so good in fact, that i am craving for some right now. My husband had the bacon omelette and loved it.

Yum.
author: Amy T.

description: If it wasnt for the bitchy waitress this place would of got 5 stars. The hostess who sat us was very polite and courtious. But we had this waitress from hell. So me and a few colleagues went here for breakfast. Little did we know that breakfast was almost over with. We were unaware so the waitress said and i quote" well you guys need to make up your mind because we are changing to lunch as of right now!" Im like ohh ok well we felt rush. The chef came out and said it would be ok to order breakfast and for us to take our time. The waitress stormed and stomped off in frustration. So my colleague just had a little request to heat the syrup up with his pancakes and the waitress scoffed... Then she brings us butter but the butter were those refrigerated cubes and they were frozen... The food was cool, The milkshake was excellent just that little snotty waitress...
author: Tareau B.

description:
This food is more better  than any other place in pier 39 

The calamari is the best it is fried but not to fried or chewy it is perfect  

The garlic clams are perfect and truly awesome and truly my favorite on the menu 

The chicken strips are to die for 

The place is so spectacular
author: Jevon s.

description: Had breakfast and it was great.   Chef's omelette, spinach omelet and veggie omelette.   Awesome portions, great flavour, great service.
author: Craig M.

description:
Whenever I visit San Francisco, I ALWAYS go to Pier 39 for some YUMMY Clam Chowder at Eagle Cafe.
This place has NEVER let me down with their yummy oysters and clam chowder!

PROS:
-EXCELLENT SERVICE
-FOOD:
Clam Chowder - creamy, flavorful with chunks of clams.  They are really generous with their chunks!
Fanny bay oysters - delicious! 
Fried seafood platter - This is to die for! Something's definitely in their batter which keeps making me come back for more! I'm actually thinking about them right now!
Dungeness crab omelets - chunks of crab need I say more?

They have a full oyster bar and regular bar as well so it's a perfect place to hang out, have a drink, and relax at the Pier.

CONS:
-PARKING: You have to park in the parking lot across the street which usually takes awhile to get in and you have to pay for it, but if you eat here at the restaurant, they will validate the parking for you!

I can't wait until I return!
author: Jay Y.

description: Ooohhhh Heeellllll nnnnaaaahhhhh!!!!!! We just got here at this restaurant 10 mins ago and the girl at the front already had an attitude!!!! We didn't want to sit near the bathrooms and told her that we decided to just wait for an open one. So my homeboy Jay O.,who lives in Palmdale, decided to get a drank at the bar and the hosted kind of gave him that look like "where is this brown skin guy going?" And when it was time to be seated,  the hostess was like "umm.... you're table is ready!" So we all went in but they did not tell us which tables we were in. We figured it was the table that was being still cleaned. So we sat our selves down. 30 minutes passed and we still did not get any server to get our order. So my homie.... AKA... the" brown skin dude" flagged down a girl to get our server. And this woman had the nerves to say "ohh, your server   didn't come here yet?" Ok... let's get this shit straight!!!! If our server was already here,  then we wouldn't have to ask for one!! 20 mins gone by, we still didn't get our order!!! But we noticed a group of women sad down after us had their orders taken way before us. I hate so say it, but I think it was the color of our skin. So finally, we flagged down another staff and he said "oh... we thought you guys already had a server cuz you guys have drinks already?" The hell was that. ... so e left after we drank our booze.
author: Kai P.

description: Really great food here. Had the meatloaf, lobster bisque, and oysters. Don't forget to use your check in deal through yelp!!!
author: Jay V.

description:
Crap food and horrible service. Do not make our mistake.  We got the fried fisherman's platter to share and bloody Mary's.  The blood Mary was by far the worse cocktail I have ever had. I think a 5th grader could have made a better bartender.  Now to the important information: 
1. Terrible service!!!! Food took forever to come out. Had to ask for water refills. 
2. Asked for coffee at the end of our meal and waited almost 20 minutes and still did not receive our to go coffees or check after having asked repeatedly. FINALLY after waiting we asked again for the check and told them we were going out side to smoke. When we returned from smoking we still had no check or coffee. When we finally got our check we had been charged for the coffees we did not receive. And then found out the restaurant called the police on us for suspicions of drinking in public.  It was 1pm and we each only had one cocktail that sucked. 
3. After a mediocre meal that was luke warm and rude service not to mention the police situation and poor cocktails.  We made it roughly an hour before both of us started feeling terrible stomach pains which was shortly followed by frequent trips to the bathroom for the better part of the evening.  
If your on fisherman's warf stay away from this over priced place and stick to one of the fish counters that offer freshly cooked fish and won't make you sick!
author: Nicole B.

description:
The hint of trouble was when the hostess told us there was a 20 minute wait, yet hardly anyone inside. Then once we were told the table was ready and went inside, we were told our table was switched and had to wait another 5 minutes to get a table with a great view of a white wall. And it goes on:

1. The server came and hit us like a ton of bricks and asked about drinks. My SO hesitated for a bit, and I felt the attitude from the server. When he came back with the drinks, the straw fell on the table and the waiter just grabbed it and put it back in my kid's drink....yeah, I don't think so.

2. The menu was pretty limited (at least for lunch)...sandwiches, and fried, fried, fried. 

3. Finally ordered and everything came out like there was a fire in the kitchen...all almost at the SAME time ...appetizers, and main course, although had to be reminded about our kid's hamburger and fries and SO's oysters on the half-shell (yeah, server did NOT write anything down)

4. Main server was always in a hurry and the other ones look like they don't want to be there and just PLOPs the food down on your table. 

5. Cocktail Shrimp and Cocktail Crab - skip it. first one is room temp on the outside, warm on the inside and second one is a tasteless clump.

6. Mahi Mahi grilled - should have had a sandwich instead

7. SO asked about oysters TWICE

On the bright side:

Kid's cheeseburger and fries had a thumbs up from the kiddo (and FREE with adult entree), ergo the LONE STAR. 

SO's Mojito must have been good as he had two. 

I think our server did not take a breath until after he asked if there was anything else. "HELL NO," was what I wanted to really say, but Miss Manners got the better of me and said, "No thanks,".....ever again.
author: Francisco T.

description: The burger wasn't really tasty and the service was really bad !! I could not advice to go there !
author: Thomas L.

description:
Fish and chips are perfect. The fish is nice and clean. 
The lobster bisque bread bowl was awesome. 
Only knock is it was just a tad to liquidy. 
Food came out quick and the service is friendly. 
From sd but this place is definitely not a tourist trap.
author: James B.

description:
I've eaten and drank here several times during my many visits to the City...always came away satisfied. a few of my favorite items...

the mojito cocktail - my first and favorite mojito that I've ever had. I kept hearing about them and finally got one here. it was mixed to perfection, not too sweet, not too limey...just right. the alcohol flavor wasn't strong but it did the job real well. they didnt use any syrups or artificial flavoring. I have had many mojitos after this and they never matched up to how good this one was mixed.

the bloody mary cocktail - the blood mary mix they make is very very very good. it has fresh grated horseradish and spices/seasonings. perfect drink to start the day off on a great note. after a couple these I leave with a happy smile on my face. 

fresh shucked oysters on the half shell - variety of oysters that are freshly shucked to order. taste very fresh like it was just out the ocean. comes with cocktail sauce, lemon, pepper, hot sauce and a lot of fresh grated horseradish which is my favorite part of it.

whole salt and pepper garlic crab - fresh, simple tasting crab where the crab meat was nice and sweet.

garlic spicy shrimp cocktail - comes in a spicy flavorful rich broth with fat plump shrimps. good stuff, then i really liked  dipping the bread in the broth.

crab cake benedict - really big portion with 2 crab cake benedicts filled with lots of crab meat and potatoes on the side. good hollandaise sauce!

grilled halibut and salmon - both fishes were seasoned just right, came out with a nice buttery flavor and great texture. 

i've also had various breakfast platters, burgers, steaks, chicken strips and fish & chips. all were very tasty and they're never skimpy in portion size. overall it was a great experience with great service. this is a MUST whenever you come to the area.
author: Vien L.

description:
Wow, this place was surprisingly good! Some friends were staying near the Wharf a few weeks back and in an effort to make things easy, I sucked it up and told them I'd meet them for lunch at the Eagle Cafe. 

Despite the fact that this place was half empty at noon and has a view of nothing other than Embarcadero, the food was yummy! I ordered a cheese burger and a Trumer and couldn't finish either (which matters, because that never happens to me). The burger was perfect, the frites were great, and though I'm still not sure why I was served 24 ounces without asking for it, the beer sure did hit the spot! 

Made heading to work directly afterward fun too :)
author: Kate P.

description: Way overpriced, mediocre food. Only 1 restroom for entire place. I would NOT recommend eating here.
author: Michael F.

description:
Went here with 2 friends while visiting San Francisco.  We walked around Pier 39 for 30 minutes to find a place with a great seafood dinner and a short wait.  We were happy to have found Eagle Cafe!

A friend and I split the mussels and whole crab. The mussels were awesome and came in a garlic butter sauce.  Our waiter was very accomodating in bringing us multiple plates of bread since we were dipping it in this great sauce and kept needing more!  The crab was huge and I was not able to finish my half. It was a fun, touristy dinner which is just what we were looking for.

The service was good- the staff was attentive and there were several people who tried to take away our garlic butter bowl and probably thought it was weird we were trying to keep it until it was empty!

The only thing I would change is that our table was right by the bathroom which often had a line and was a one-person room, so everyone waited right next to our table.
author: Amanda C.

description:
In town for the weekend and I read about this place so I decided to give it a try.  Mostly seafood menu - DUH!! It's San Francisco and situated on Pier 39. No matter they had a couple of non seafood items on the menu so I went with the Eagle Burger.  

Basically a bacon cheeseburger with the basics.  The patty was huge and juicy and the bacon was big enough to cover the bread and patty. They get brownie points for that.

I sat outside so I could do some people watching while I ate and get some of that brisk bay air.  Perfect way to wind down after walking all day. 

The next time I'm back in the city I'll be back at this place.
author: Ayanna H.

description:
You have to hear the whole story of how we ended up at Eagle Cafe to understand our appreciation for this oasis on the wharf!

There we were, two weary tourists from the hinterlands, dragging our suitcases the ENTIRE length of the Embarcadero, with fresh Muni passes on our pockets.  Why, you might say, would people walk when there is a lovely antique streetcar right there to bring the hordes to Fisherman's Wharf?  Because SF has pickpockets on their mass transit, but brave women who alert the car that this is going on and get belted in the face for their troubles!  This happened on the streetcar in front of ours, and as our driver wisely surmised, "One streetcar can't go around another."  Thus, our forced march down the foggy Embarcadero.

When Pier 39 came in sight, we limped the remaining few feet and up the stairs and fell at the door of this tempting seafood bar.  I had to have oysters and I had to have them now, and without hesitation, ordered an Anchor Steam to go with them.  A bowl of steamed shrimp followed.  There was no dehydrated traveler in the desert who appreciated the rejuvenating affects of this repast more than we did!  The bar was bright and airy and very friendly.  The other concoctions we saw being prepared looked scrumptious.  Maybe a tad on the expensive side, but the life saving cure of beer and oysters is priceless!
author: Gretchen W.

description:
It's has been 2 remodel in Eagle Cafe in past 10 years.
(it got fancier and fancier)
I actually liked the original one and the newest one.

Some reason I really like going to Pier39 for a cold beer in the hot day on weekend. Mingle with tourists who they are happy and having good time in SF. I often go to Eagle cafe for just a drink and a brunch.
You can enjoy your drink on the deck with great view of Pier39.
I ate grilled salmon egg Benedict and my  Mom ate crab omelet.
They are very good. 

I just love the fresh air and open space on the deck so much (especially having a drink with it!). 

Good to know the place.
author: Green Mango Y.

description: Five stars for hangover cure omelettes a quick trot from my work place.
author: Reishi A.

description: Good place, got the crab with garlic and butter. Priced decently, not sure I would go back though.
author: Annie Y.

description: Oysters r gross. Service is good. Their butter for dipping crab is sick. I never use butter but this time I was dippin my crab into it at every chance. Not a quality place but better cuz its upstairs and away from a lot of tourists so less wait time. I would go back to sit outside to eat.
author: Kasey H.

description: Stopped by here because it has an oyster bar and I was in the mood for oyster shooters. Oyster shooters were GREAT...get the tequila one. I also ordered the hot crab. Can you say steamed to perfection?! I will return.
author: Nicole W.

description: Haven't had dinner there but breakfast is great. Huge servings of tasty food. Crab omelet, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, we have tried a lot on the menu and have not been disappointed. My only problem is they do not open early enough. Last time we were there at 7:45 and they were not open yet. Then at 8:00 we gave up and had to settle for a crappy bagel across the hall. Pickings are very limited for breakfast in the area.
author: T Lee T.

description:
This place was actually a last resort for my friend and me. We had gone to every other restaurant on the wharf that was participating in the 2-hour parking validation, and each had an 1+ hour wait time. Eagle Cafe, on the other hand, was only a 15-20 minutes. We were starving, and we settled. Boy, was it a bad idea. For the amount of money I paid for my dinner ($92 for two people, without tax), I expected better food. Yes, I looked at the menu before I went in, and yes, I looked at the pricing as well before walking in. I ordered the fried seafood platter, with a mix of shrimp, salmon, and mahi-mahi. But everything was doused in sodium, and I swear that on the first bite into that fried shrimp, I was going to shrivel and dry up and die. Needless to say, I left my fried foods untouched. The side salad was also doused in dressing and was very soury/salty as well. As an appetizer, we ordered the clams (marinated in garlic and butter). Not a special dish, but something I usually enjoyed. I actually expected it to be at least better than local restaurants in Sac. Sadly, it wasn't. The clams in garlic and butter at Frasinetti Winery in Sacramento tasted a whole lot better! 

All in all, it's a nice, cozy little restaurant in the front corner of the wharf. VERY friendly and nice service!! The staff were attentive and the receptionist upfront was approachable. A+ for service. That's where the extra star comes in. Otherwise, if I'd just based this review on food, I'd give it a one (just because there isn't anything less). Of course, the review in regards to the food is only what I had ordered - maybe their lunch or breakfast (or other dinner items on the menu) tastes a whole lot better than what I had...
author: Amanda H.

description:
Yes it's touristy; quit being a snob already---it's San Fran.  If you can go five minutes without seeing a gaggle of tourists, something is up.  (same with us in LA).

That said, I came with my tourist friends for brunch Sunday and it was great!  We all had pancakes...two of us had the blueberry ones and the other had pecan (?)  They were SO good...the blueberries are cooked inside, but the ones they sprinkle on top are warm and gooey, like they threw them on the skillet for 10 seconds or so.  The meals came with a generous side of fresh fruit...yum!  I was a bit irritated the coffee, all cup and a half I had, was $3...if I wanted to pay that, I would have gone to Starbucks twice...but otherwise everything was just great.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This restaurant nearly ruined my trip to San Francisco. While on a business trip, my colleagues and I stopped here and asked right when we sat down if the check could be split between the 7 of us. I used to be a server myself and I understand this is quite a request, but the server told us it would be no problem and we appreciated the meal all the more for it. The food was mediocre but we didn't expect much more. It was pretty awful to have to sit right next to the only restroom for both men and women - there was a line next to our table for the whole duration of our meal. We paid our bills and left after an overall decent experience. It was the next day that I realized, while looking at my bank statement, that I had been charged not only for my portion of the check, but also for the entire meal of ~$235. I figured it was a mistake and called the restaurant. I spoke with Marcy Lim who treated me like trash. She was kind and managerial at first, but quickly became hostile and sarcastic. First she told me it was a mistake, but quickly changed her story to something along the lines of it being a policy they had to put a hold on the first card's account for the total. This was mind-boggling to me and completely illogical. I calmly informed her that the $235 was a solid amount of money and I needed it back as soon as possible. It was at that point that she broke down to total immaturity. She told me I was "coming at" her, when in reality I was calmly letting her know that this was not an acceptable "policy" (or mistake). She even had the audacity to sarcastically offer to charge my account AGAIN for the $235, and when I asked how that would help she responded with "I don't know sir, you're the one that's upset here". I was completely shocked. It took over a week for that hold on my account to be dropped. Not once did Marcy Lim offer ANYTHING to help me. Only sarcastic apologies and immature resentment. I hope people read this and learn not to trust the Eagle Cafe or Marcy Lim with their money.
author: James M.

description: Great view, sitting outside looking over the bay.  View of Golden Gate Bridge, and the sea lions.  Eggs Benedict were very good, wait staff (Gabriel) was very helpful and courteous.  I can't wait to come back to San Francisco.  Thank you guys!
author: Scott F.

description:
Being a SF native I'm always a little skeptical about restaurants in "touristy" areas. Since we were smack dab in the middle of Touristville (Pier 39), I was expecting a mediocre meal that was overpriced. After wandering around a bit, I decided on Eagle Cafe due to the pretty good reviews on yelp. My nephew and I had just watched the magic show performance and we were both hungry. I am SO glad we chose this place, because it had all 3 of the most important components of any restaurant....    great ambiance (casual-style "traditional Americana" character)... great food... and great service!! 
I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed this place. Even my 9yr old nephew gave it 2 thumbs up. He ordered the fish and chips, which were delicious and tasted fresh. I usually don't even like fish, but it was so good that I stole a few bites from my nephew's platter. I ordered the crab salad sandwich and substituted my fries with a side salad (their dressing was great by the way). It was perfect and was exactly what I wanted!.. I decided to have a glass of wine and our server ( I think his name was Ronald?) helped me decide on a great pinot grigio... I loved it so much I asked to see the menu again to get the name so I could purchase it at BevMo.  
Our server (Ronald?) was very nice, super friendly and very attentive (without being overly). Towards the end of our meal, a friendly, older gentleman (the owner?) came around and greeted each table and asked how everything was. I thought that was a nice touch. 
I will definitely come back to this place again, if I'm ever in the area. 
Oh yeah, I forgot to mention they scored a few more points for having a  big screen tv to the side of the bar area, where I could catch a glimpse of the basketball game that was on...  Nice!
author: Kimberly D.

description: Located in the tourist trap that is Fisherman's Wharf, I didn't expect much, however, my breakfast was large and in charge and dare I say, quite tasty. I went with a California omelet that came with spinach, avocado, bacon and cheese. Every breakfast was accompanied with fruit and a huge roll - I didn't eat the roll. Instead I gorged on a side of fluffy pancakes that seemed a foot thick. This place offers a nice view of the water, is a short stroll to view the sea lions and is reasonably priced. Surrounded by other cheesy places like Bubba Gump Shrimp and Hard Rock Cafe - this place is a bit of a gem.
author: Genevieve W.

description:
Went there for the first time last week.
Had breakfast.
Usual Fish stuff on the menu but I went instead for the Eggs Benedict.  Very nice.  The country potatoes were a little different, in a good way. Nice taste. What was unusual was the Deep Fried Angel Hair Pasta!!!!  Looked strange but was actually fun to eat.
My partner had the Traditional Breakfast. Eggs, Sausage etc. It also had the country pots and deep fried angel hair pasta.
Place is small but tables are not too crowded.
Wait staff were attentive.
Not sure about the lunch/dinner menu but I will go back next time I'm in the area for breakfast.

Go there!!  :)
author: Graham H.

description: Located on the Pier 39, I have not expected much from this place. I just assumed it to be just another tourist hole. I was pleasantly surprised. The wait was about 15-20 minutes (which is not bad, considering the location), service was great, and the food was amazing.
author: Karina L.

description: Oasis for hungry tourist. Excellent crab omelette and incredible, spicy Bloody Mary. Definitely worth the stop.
author: Miss U.

description: Great service and even better food.  Love the open bar and the lobster bisque was awesome!!  Would have been the best if better views.
author: A W.

description: I ordered the lobster bisque and it was exceptional. The service was on point, however... The butter to bread ratio was astronomically unbalanced in favor of dairy. I would have given four stars but there was a line for the women's room and a small tear in the leather upholstery of my bar stool.
author: Cory H.

description:
I don't know if I came on an "off day" or what, but this was quite possibly the worst meal I have had in San Francisco.  I came here for lunch with a small group.  Not only did they forget our drinks, it took them forever to take our order, forever for food to arrive, and they had actually forgotten to put my meal in.  So while the rest of my party was trying to choke down their meals, it took another 20minutes to a half hour for my food to arrive, and the crab melt I received was cold, horribly salty, and so disgusting that I just couldn't eat it.  Another person in my group was also unable to eat her food because it was overly salty and endedup just eating french fries.  I don't think the cook knew how to use any other spice but SALT.  All in all, we had them take atleast my meal off the bill, which they reluctantly did without a single apology.  I would never come back here.

Service: 0/5
Ambiance: 1/5
Food: 0/5
author: M R.

description:
I found this little gem in the early morning hours while waiting for my boat to Alcatraz.    I ordered the sausage, spicy!, home style potatoes, scrambled eggs.  It came with some seasonal fruit and their own homemade bread.  Nothing out of the ordinary but still amazingly good.  It was on the pricey side but about what you would expect in the middle of a very touristy area.  I was mostly impressed by the service, very attentive and nice.  They seemed genuinely intrested in making sure my experience was a great one.  
I would go back and this time for dinner! It looked great as well.
author: Molly P.

description: the worse customer service ever!!!!!!!!!! the host sits us down and we are getting ready to order but all of a sudden the manager comes ups and says there was a party before us so can we move!!!!!!!! who would actually do that???? it was only four of us and the party was for nine! they still had to wait regardless. we will never come back here and for them to take it out on us like it was our fault we were seated is ridiculously absurd! i wish i could give zero (0) stars! management is a joke here! rude and unprofessional!! and i am calling to talk to another manager in the morning!!
author: Nick F.

description:
OK food but way, way, wayyy too...

Overpriced!!

Snooty atmosphere which might appeal to some but not I.. (Fancy is nice WHEN it all comes together & works...)

I left feeling unsatisfied & ripped off! Haha.

Sorry Eagle.. 2's the best I can give. 

:[
author: Kai S.

description: We had a totally underwhelming breakfast here.  Ugh.  I'm still trying to forget it.  They had a polish sausage on the menu which caught my eye -- but it turned out to be chorizo.  There IS a difference between Mexican sausage and Polish sausage.  Maybe they thought no one would notice.
author: Tracey M.

description:
Came in on Saturday the 22nd and HOT DAMN it was packed. I was seated and to my surprise, I only counted a total of two employees running, bussing, and taking orders. I was quite surprised at how well they managed considering it was a full house. 

Our server took his time and recommended the fish and chips, which was delicious. The fish was juicy and the fries were crispy. Not drenched in oil like a few other places that I've been to. We also ordered a grilled seafood platter which was surprisingly good. 

The service was quick, the server/busser/food runner (yes, all the same person) was very efficient and took great care of us. If you happen to find yourself at Eagle Cafe in the future, you're going to enjoy the food, the service, and the unique decor. I believe my waiter was Waymond, and I hope to be seated at the balcony again.
author: Alex T.

description: Great place to stop-in and have lunch with a view. Good prices, good food, and a great location on Pier 39. Highly recommend!
author: Carson S.

description:
I live three blocks away from here and this is the first time that I have ever been to this establishment. Out of all of the restaurants in Pier 39, this is probably the only one that I would come back to. It also helps when the group of people you went with know the owner. I, however, will still base my review solely on the food and service. 

Keep in mind that this place is a tourist spot.  It's not going to be your every day "go to" restuarant.  This is going to be one of those type of restaurants where you go to once in a while.  This would be a type of restaurant that I would go to if I was a tourist.

Their salads are good, I had the Cobb salad. The bacon was crispy, the turkey was smoked, the salad was fresh, and the dressing was light. 

Their fish and chips are surprisingly good as well. Lightly battered. It can be seasoned a little better. Portions are huge. 

The oysters were sweet and satisfying. It came with horseradish, cocktail sauce, and lemon under a bed of shaved ice. When ordering anything from the oyster bar, the oyster shuckler brings it out themselves which I like. It adds a level of service to the table that I appreciate. 

Their fried calamari and chicken tenders were ok. 

The clam chowder...........I wont' lie......I had better. 

Something about going to Pier 39 seems more vibrant. Couldn't really be too critical about this place because we are amongst tourist and when you are amongst tourist...............everything seems to be 5 stars. The place itself is very bright, people around you are very happy andrelaxed. All in all...........a great place to end the weekend. 

Although our meals were comped, I would still say the price fits the location. Again.....would I come back? Absolutely...... and would be happy to pay their prices base on their food and service.
author: jason g.

description: This is a great place.  Can't say the best in all of SF buy consistently great food throughout the meal.  Bread is better than Boudin and clam chowder is best we've had in SF.
author: Nala H.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed the service, food and view. We walked over from our hotel several blocks away and had no trouble getting a table by a window.
Pricing was almost identical to what the hotel was charging. Qualty of the food was very good and the decor with the Navy Hats was also very appealing. Shrimop and eggs was a treat.
Would definitely go there again.
author: richard b.

description: I went to this place on Saturday, and the only reason I went is because my son really wanted crab and I saw that they had crab for a reasonable price. First, the unisex bathroom thing.....IJS who does that. Next all the flies in the resturant was driving me crazy.. Then after ordering my son got his 1/2 crab which was really good. I orderded the #1 best selling crab sandwhich... GROSSSS it taste like tuna, ground up meat and you couldnt even tell that it was crab.. Then I got calamari--- it was like chewing on a rubberband. Needless to say I left just as hungry as I was was when I went in.. Don't waste your money..
author: A M.

description:
Great food there, can get busy on the weekends from the tourist. 
Their breakfast menu is actually not too expensive for the portion you get and tastes yummy. Their lunch and dinner menu  are what you'd expect in a tourist area.

I've been here a few times and it doesn't disappoint each time. If you love fried food, the seafood platter is awesome there, a little of everything. The Oysters on a half shell is also something that you must try.
author: James C.

description:
Someone recommended this place to us. We were in the area & hungry.

The portions are huge! 

Grilled chicken burger: size of his face. The sauce looked good & a lot of it dripped onto the plate so I assume it was probably drenched.

Baked oysters: they have two kinds garlic & herb and Rockefeller (spinach and cheese.) I couldn't decide so I asked if they could do two of each which they accommodated. I liked the Rockefeller more it was juicier, but I'm glad I got to try both.

 Crab melt patty thing: I was thinkin it was something diff't but it cheese melted on top of crab meat on a bread. Pretty good.

Overall the food was good & a lot. It did it's job, I would come back here but it's hard when there's so many other options near by.
author: Shirley T.

description: Went here with very low expectations, given the location.  The menu was kind of overwhelming at first, in that it all looked like giant, expensive dishes.  Once I slowed down and studied the menu, I realized there were some smaller options, so I settled on the lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  I haven't ordered anything in a bread bowl in about ten years, but it seemed like the right thing to do here. My dining companion had the grilled seafood salad, which was decent, fresh seafood with nice greens.  The best part was my rose gimlet.  This thing was a bucket of martini.  All gin.  You will not be disappointed.  I enjoyed my bisque because it was of the thinner variety, not overly gloppy and heavy.  Our server was truly, genuinely surprised when I said that I liked the bisque.  All I can think of is that it came from a can, and she was like, YES, they BOUGHT it again. Didn't give me the best feeling, ya know?  We were 1 of two tables there on a Friday night @ 7:00pm.
author: Felicia M.

description: Great atmosphere and top breakfast...I even like it better than local fave, Mama's on Washington Square.  Try the crab omelet with has browns.  It can't be beat!  They serve the best sourdough bread.
author: Desiree G.

description:
Always a pleasure to drink and dine here, great views of the bay and decent value for your money
Wait staff is always nice, 2 tvs that you can see in the bar from the main dining area.
Seafood is fresh and tasty!
author: Rose A.

description:
I thought that I had reviewed this place before, but I guess not. Probably a good thing that I hadn't because my opinion of this place COMPLETELY changed! 

The first time I went here was with a group of friends the morning after my bachelorette party (Maybe this is why I thought it was good) b/c our hotel was close to the Wharf and we couldn't find any other place open within walking distance for Breakfast that seemed ok to eat at. 

Anyways... I went there recently with my husband b/c our favorite breakfast place in the city was closed for the weekend... SUPER ANNOYED at this but whatever... 

We ordered the Mango Mimosa's b/c the last time I had them they were fantastic...this time it was watered down OJ and cheap champagne with NO MANGO. So I told our tatted up waitress, Yeah very professional, that there was no mango in either of our drinks and she actually argues with me! Saying that there is it probably settled on the bottom and to mix it....UM, NO! So she brought it over  to the bartender who looked to be about 12 and I watched him dump an orange mixer in a plastic bottle into the top of the drinks and she brought it back trying to say that there was Mango Puree in there. Effin liar, called her out on that as well! 

So, we ordered some of the banana nut bread to start b/c we were STARVING and she comes over, about 15 minutes later with one slice of bread that had been microwaved with two thick pieces of cold butter lying on the top and told us it was fresh....Can you say COMPULSIVE LIAR? The last time I had gone here we got a bread basket! 

Then our meals came out, which last time I remember being very good... Crab Cake Benedict. 

Um....not quite! The crab cakes were so salty they were inedible. We ended up leaving still hungry and REALLY ticked off that we had even gone there, PLUS I was embarrassed b/c I had vouched for this place as being good and my husband loves to give me "playful" grief when a restaurant I claim to be good isn't up to his standards! NEVER AGAIN!
author: Nicole C.

description:
One of those times where you just go somewhere random because you don't feel like fending off crowds at Pier 39.
